title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
About the Team

Bloomberg’s External Relations team leads the company’s engagement with governments, regulators, and key stakeholders on public policy and regulatory issues that affect Bloomberg and its clients globally. The team combines strategic advocacy, subject-matter expertise, and thought leadership, working closely with colleagues across Legal & Compliance, Communications, Corporate Philanthropy, and Bloomberg’s business and product teams to ensure policy engagement is aligned with broader corporate objectives.
Based in Brussels, the EU team sits at the centre of Bloomberg’s engagement with the European Union’s policymaking and regulatory ecosystem. We maintain active, trusted relationships with the European Commission, European Parliament, Council, ESMA, and national competent authorities, contributing constructively to regulatory initiatives that shape European financial markets and the data, technology, and infrastructure that support them.

The Opportunity

Bloomberg is seeking an External Relations Manager to play a leading role in shaping and driving Bloomberg’s EU government-relations and regulatory-engagement strategy, with a strong emphasis on building, sustaining, and leveraging trusted senior relationships across EU institutions and Member States.
Based in Brussels, this role sits at the centre of Bloomberg’s engagement with the EU policymaking and supervisory ecosystem. As a senior member of the EU Government Relations and Regulatory Affairs team, you will be personally accountable for cultivating long-term, high-trust relationships with senior policymakers and regulators, while providing strategic direction and senior-level advice on complex regulatory issues at the intersection of financial markets, data, and technology.

Success in this role requires deep regulatory expertise, excellent political judgement, credibility with senior stakeholders, and the ability to convert strong institutional relationships into effective regulatory outcomes that support transparent and vibrant European capital markets.

What You’ll Do:

  • Support the external engagement priorities of the senior team in Brussels, as well as internal partners (Legal, Compliance, Communications, Marketing, Corporate Philanthropy, and business leadership) to ensure a coordinated, consistent, and relationship-focused approach.
  • Drive Bloomberg’s senior-level EU government-relations and regulatory-engagement strategy, with a clear focus on relationship-building, trust, and long-term influence rather than transactional engagement.
  • Build, deepen, and maintain durable, high-trust relationships with senior officials across EU institutions (European Commission, European Parliament, Council), ESAs (including ESMA), national competent authorities, and key Member State stakeholders, positioning Bloomberg as a credible, constructive, and long-term partner.
  • Act as a primary senior point of contact for EU policymakers and regulators, ensuring continuity, institutional memory, and strategic coherence in Bloomberg’s engagement over time.
  • Set strategic priorities and engagement plans across EU financial-services and data regulation, including market structure (MiFID II/MiFIR), transparency regimes, trading venues, capital markets, the Savings and Investments Union (SIU), benchmarks, digital finance, sustainable finance disclosures, and AI-related regulation.
  • Provide trusted, senior-level counsel to Bloomberg’s leadership, business, and product teams on regulatory developments, political dynamics, and supervisory risk, informed by close, ongoing engagement with policymakers and regulators.
  • Lead Bloomberg’s regulatory and policy positioning, overseeing the development of high-quality consultation responses, position papers, briefings, and engagement materials that support and reinforce Bloomberg’s relationship-based approach.
  • Represent Bloomberg in senior external settings, including high-level regulatory roundtables, expert groups, and industry fora, using these platforms to strengthen relationships and reinforce Bloomberg’s credibility and influence.
  • Design and deliver targeted, relationship-driven engagement initiatives, including senior-level meetings, small-group roundtables, and strategic stakeholder programmes in Brussels and other key European financial centres.
  • Contribute to broader External Relations leadership, helping to embed a culture of long-term relationship-building and institutional trust across Bloomberg’s EU engagement.

What You’ll Bring:

  • 10+ years’ experience in EU government relations, regulatory affairs, or financial-services policy, with a strong track record of building and sustaining senior-level relationships within EU institutions, supervisory authorities, and Member States.
  • Deep expertise in EU financial-markets regulation, particularly market structure and transparency, combined with a practical understanding of how regulatory outcomes are shaped through sustained engagement.
  • An established, credible network across EU institutions and key national authorities, and the ability to expand and strengthen that network on behalf of the firm.
  • Strong political and institutional judgement, including the ability to read stakeholder dynamics, manage sensitive relationships, and engage effectively in complex regulatory environments.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the confidence to engage senior policymakers, regulators, and internal executives as a trusted counterpart.
  • Comfort operating in senior, matrixed, international environments, balancing relationship management with strategic delivery.
  • Fluency in English is essential; additional European languages are a strong advantage.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg Intelligence ("BI") is an investment research platform of 475 investment professionals covering company and credit research at the single-name and strategy level, while also addressing litigation, regulatory and environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues that will shape companies, industries and markets. BI research is a combination of written analysis accompanied by interactive charting and analytics from a team of independent experts that provide deep insight into where crucial industries and investment market trends stand today and where they may be heading next.

As a member of our Therapeutics team, you’ll be responsible for building detailed patent databases related to drugs and biologics. You will work with our patent and litigation analysts to contribute market exclusivity analysis for our disease hubs.

REQUIREMENTS:
- Graduate degree in chemistry, biochemistry or related field or combination of commensurate education and experience
- USPTO Registration and patent agent/attorney experience
- Experience in comprehensive, worldwide patent searching
- Experience in chemical patent prosecution
- Understanding of scientific and clinical data
- Strong attention to detail
- Excellent communication and collaboration
- Proficiency in Excel
- Good writing skills
- Strong organization skills and capable of balancing multiple projects
- A dedication to developing and improving products
- An ability to meet deadlines, logically address problems and set priorities

NICE TO HAVE:
- Knowledge of the biotech industry and regulatory environment in the US, Europe, Japan and/or China
- Understanding of financial markets and concepts
- Experience with Python, R, or SQL

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/careers/working-here/news-and-research/?tactic-page=588594

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg LP has built a significant Media business spanning television, digital, magazine, radio and live event platforms across the globe! In the midst of a historic time in the Media industry, Bloomberg Media is growing its global footprint and reach through new innovations from Originals to New Economy.


We work hard, and we work fast! - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. "Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces." We bring out the best in each other. And through our countless volunteer projects, we help bring out the best in the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.


Bloomberg Media has an exciting opportunity for an Advertising Operator to join the team who will contribute to the end-to-end execution of advertising campaigns across digital, television, audio, print, programmatic, social and terminal platforms, focusing on client performance, optimization and insights.


This candidate will have the opportunity to use a blend of technical aptitude, analytical mindset, organizational skills and creative problem solving to bring media solutions to life and ensure client success. In their day to day role, this individual will lead campaigns across our various advertising platforms to traffic ad creative, troubleshoot problems, optimize campaign delivery and report results for clients advertising on Bloomberg’s owned & operated and off-platform properties.


This is an amazing opportunity for an entrepreneurial person with an eye for growth to own operations and use their unique skills to drive revenue generating recommendations, tactics and strategies across all our lines of business.


We will trust you to:


  • Traffic and maintain ad campaigns on Bloomberg's multi-media owned & operated platforms and off-platform, working consultatively to ensure deal terms are met including delivery rates, start and end date, reporting requirements, viewability expectations, etc
  • Provide best-in-class customer service for internal and external stakeholders, clients and agencies by providing optimizations and insights
  • Have an understanding of advertising regulations, capable of working consultatively with sales, clients and agencies to foster understanding and adoption of industry specifications and standards
  • QA campaign assets and creatives against advertising standards and compliance specifications, to ensure proper functionality
  • Collaborate with sales, ad product, ad technology and planning teams to understand client KPIs and how we can leverage Bloomberg assets to drive success
  • Attend client meetings with the sales team as a key resource for ad operations queries


You'll need to have:


  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 2+ years of experience in advertising operations or trafficking
  • An understanding of digital, television and audio advertising
  • Articulate and comfortable speaking with diverse audiences, including sales and clients, demonstrating the ability to translate technical subject matter into relatable business terminology and respond to unexpected questions on the spot
  • Strong time management skills to ensure we are effectively leading requests and deadlines both internally and externally
  • Ability to work both independently and collaboratively while maintaining attention to detail and multitasking in a fast-paced environment
  • A natural ability to proactively problem solve and think creatively
  • Impeccable technical acumen and a good understanding of advertising performance metrics
  • Experience working in Google Ad Manager as well as with third party ad servers (Google DV360, Flashtalking, Celtra, etc) and ad-verification vendors (Integral Ad Science, DoubleVerify, etc)
  • Understanding of Excel, including the ability to create and use pivot tables.


If this sounds like you:


Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional


Life at Bloomberg is many things, but it’s never dull. We're a truly global business with a truly diverse workforce. We pride ourselves on being open, inclusive and collaborative, and provide a work environment that inspires our employees to be their best. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive healthcare coverage, and programs to support you and your family through different life stages, from parental leave to generous retirement savings plans.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg Media is looking for an individual with a proactive attitude who is focused, flexible, and proficient in several aspects of broadcast operations, and who can work collaboratively in a live control room and studio environment in a camera operator capacity. They will be required to work with operations, on-air talent, engineering, and editorial teams, as well as their global counterparts to ensure a high-quality visual production on an early morning weekend (part-time) basis.

We'll trust you to:
  • Participate in pre-show meetings with editorial and technical teams to align show vision.
  • Move quickly and accurately under pressure in a fast-paced broadcast environment to deliver a high-quality audio/visual presentation to our audience
  • Operate, frame, and shade robotic cameras and external feeds in a multicamera studio setup for a 3-hour production.
  • Read, follow, and execute all relevant tasks outlined in a live news broadcast rundown
  • Communicate with Team Leads to report on issues and faults that will impact global counterparts.
Be able to assist in the lifting of set pieces up to 50 lbs.

You'll need to have:
  • Bachelor’s degree or 2 years of experience working in a live TV environment
  • Experience with multicamera robotic systems in a fast-paced live show environment (knowledge of Shotoku robotic systems preferred, but not required)
  • Experience with multicamera shading (knowledge of Sony RCP shading units preferred, but not required)
  • Knowledge of video routing systems (Evertz or similar)
  • Knowledge of RTS systems
  • Ability to follow a live rundown (knowledge of ENPS preferred but not required) and ability to adapt to adjustments in real time
  • Early morning weekend availability is required.
If this sounds like you, apply today! We're eager to speak with you.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
ENG Security Architecture operates and evolves enterprise security infrastructure that protects employee-facing services and internal platforms. This role is infrastructure engineering with a Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) mindset applied to security: secure operations, observability, operational automation, and disciplined change control through Git workflows and continuous integration gates. You will own services that must be measurable, stable, and audit ready under real production load, and you are expected to operate independently with minimal ramp up while raising the bar on reliability and security operations across the organization. We own these platforms end-to-end from management consoles and backend services through endpoint agents across Windows and macOS, with Linux support expected over time. Scope includes security control planes across endpoint controls, secure web and data controls, vulnerability and exposure telemetry, logging pipelines, and identity and privileged access services spanning SaaS and on-premise environments. 

We'll trust you to 

  • Define and operate service level objective (SLO) backed reliability for security platforms, including dependency mapping, failure mode analysis, resiliency improvements, and rollback readiness Build and maintain operational automation for provisioning, validation, drift detection, evidence collection, and exception handling using scripting and orchestration 
  • Run secure change management for configurations and integrations via Git based review, continuous integration (CI) gates, environment promotion, ring-based rollout discipline, and rollback readiness 
  • Establish observability operators can trust, such as health metrics, data freshness and coverage, structured logs, dashboards, and actionable alerting with noise control 
  • Lead incident response and problem management for security service degradation, from triage and containment through root cause analysis (RCA) and corrective actions 
  • Partner with infrastructure, identity, endpoint, and corporate technology teams to standardize operational contracts, access patterns, audit artifacts, and runbooks; drive vendor escalations with evidence packs and regression prevention 
You'll need to have 
  • 4+ years of strong experience operating enterprise infrastructure in production in a security context across SaaS and on prem dependencies, including on call incident ownership and root cause analysis (RCA) 
  • 4+ years building and maintaining production automation in an object-oriented language, typically Python, plus PowerShell or Bash for operational execution; experience integrating with REST APIs and enterprise infrastructure services   
  • Proven troubleshooting strength across authentication flows, enterprise networking, proxy constrained environments, certificates, and distributed dependencies 
  • Hands on experience operating endpoint agents and security services at scale on Windows and macOS; able to extend operational patterns to Linux environments over time 
  • Strong familiarity with continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines and secure change management for infrastructure and configuration changes using Git workflows, pull request (PR) review discipline, continuous integration (CI) gates, controlled promotion between environments, and rollback strategy 
  • Experience building and operating observability for infrastructure services, including dashboards, alerting, health metrics, and data quality checks with noise control 
  • Hands on background supporting identity and privileged access workflows, including least privilege and time bound elevation patterns 
  • Hands on operation of enterprise security controls: endpoint, secure web and data, vulnerability telemetry, logging pipelines, privileged access; comfortable with Infrastructure as Code or orchestration frameworks and converting runbooks into automated checks 

We’d love to see 

  • Track record defining service level objectives (SLO) and error budgets for security infrastructure services and using them to drive prioritization 
  • Experience building self-healing automation with closed loop validation, drift remediation, and audit ready evidence 
  • Demonstrated ability to lead cross organization reliability and security initiatives, setting standards and influencing roadmaps 
  • Experience performing threat modeling and architecture reviews for internal platforms and translating findings into concrete control requirements 
  • Familiarity with automation hardening and secrets and key management: artifact signing, dependency controls, secrets storage and rotation, and certificate or key lifecycle management at scale

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg Government is changing the government sector by delivering the most sophisticated research platform on the market with a focus on automation, analytics and real-time answers. Our goal is to become an indispensable tool for private and public sector professionals by supporting their day-to-day tasks and providing solutions that help them get real-time answers and better serve their companies.

Within Bloomberg Government, the Data Platform team is hiring!  As part of our team, you will help build a visualization layer on top of the Bloomberg Government data platform, as well as develop the internal tools that our data analysts use to curate our products. You will also help in our task to migrate our data to the cloud. Here you will use AWS technologies like Lambda and Step Functions to create robust ingestion workflows as well as implementing Databricks Lakehouses. You will be given the opportunity to display your creativity and deliver continuous end-user value in an Agile environment. We are self-motivated engineers who like to research, learn, and apply current technologies to build new product features that anticipate our customers’ needs.

We’ll trust you to:

- Work directly with product owners, data experts and other engineering teams to build solutions that our clients use to solve complex problems

- Build and support a distributed platform supporting all Bloomberg Government data

- Work with data analysts to collect insight on possible data collection efficiencies and identify automation potential for manual workflows
- Developing infrastructure as code (IaC) and embraces DevOps principles.

- Work with AWS cloud services to implement micro services using serverless technologies

- Work with Databricks to build a Lakehouse

You'll need to have:

- 4+ years of experience programming in Python

- 4+ years of experience with relational databases, SQL and Linux

- A passion to learn new technologies

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
About Bloomberg
Bloomberg delivers critical information in a world where information matters. We empower decision makers across finance, business, and government by connecting them to a global ecosystem of data, news, analytics, and technology. Our success depends on innovation, collaboration, and a relentless focus on client needs.

Our Team

Enterprise Technology Solutions helps financial institutions solve the complexity of system integration across their organizations. Clients rely on multiple internal and external platforms to support trading, risk, operations, and reporting workflows. Our team provides the tools, expertise, and services that enable seamless integration between client systems, Bloomberg applications, and third-party platforms.
Within our implementation organization, teams focus on both standardized integration solutions and customized client implementations, supporting a wide range of workflows across asset classes and regions. We work closely with clients, product, sales and engineering partners to deliver scalable, secure, and efficient integration outcomes across the APAC region.

What’s the Role?

In this role, you will deliver client-facing technology solutions within complex financial or enterprise environments. You will work closely with clients to understand their business workflows, technical landscapes, and integration requirements, and contribute to the delivery of scalable, production-ready solutions connecting client systems with Bloomberg platforms and services.
You will be involved across the full delivery lifecycle, from scoping and solution design through implementation, testing, and transition to production support, while collaborating closely with internal product, engineering, and support teams. The role spans a broad range of integration use cases, including cloud-based connectivity, data transformation, real-time and batch processing, and interoperability with third-party systems. You will develop a deep understanding of client workflows and apply that knowledge to deliver reusable and scalable solutions that support evolving business needs.

We’ll Trust You To:

• Design, configure, test, and implement solutions connecting client systems, Bloomberg platforms, and third-party technologies
• Collaborate with internal teams such as Product, Engineering, Support, and Sales to deliver high-quality client outcomes
• Support multiple concurrent projects across the full implementation lifecycle, from delivery through transition to production support, while balancing priorities in a fast-paced, client-facing environment
• Troubleshoot and resolve project-related implementation and connectivity issues efficiently to minimize client impact
• Develop and maintain a strong understanding of client workflows to support delivery, handover, and ongoing support
• Contribute to process improvement, standardization, and best practices across implementation and onboarding activities
• Demonstrate adaptability and a willingness to learn as technologies, products, and client requirements evolve

You’ll Need To Have:

• 3+ years of experience in the financial services industry, preferably in a technical role supporting front-office technologies, brokerage platforms, or OMS providers
• Experience supporting or implementing technology solutions involving system connectivity, data integration, or workflow automation
• Working knowledge of financial data transfer or messaging technologies, such as FIX, Web APIs, MQ, SFTP, or SWIFT
• Hands-on experience leveraging automation frameworks or internal/external tooling to standardize connectivity, configuration, and certification workflows
• Proven ability to manage multiple initiatives concurrently and communicate progress, risks, and outcomes to stakeholders
• Strong ability to work independently while building effective relationships with external clients and internal partners
• Demonstrated initiative in identifying process gaps and contributing to continuous improvement
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Japanese, with the ability to engage in complex technical discussions with diverse stakeholder groups
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience

We’d Love to See:

• Experience with FIX onboarding or comparable protocol-based client integrations
• Experience applying data transformation within integration workflows using specific ETL tools (e.g., Informatica, Mulesoft, Tibco, Dell Boomi) or transformation languages (XML/XSLT)
• Foundational certification or basic understanding of cloud technologies like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
• Experience with IT service management, client relationship management, or operational support frameworks
• 3+ years of programming or scripting experience used to support automation, tooling, or integration workflows (e.g., Bash, Perl, Python, C#, Java, C++)
• Experience using Web API testing tools such as Postman
• Proficiency in an additional Asian language

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg offers a diverse range of fixed income, commodity, currency and equity indices. With extensive asset coverage, a strong history of innovation, and objective and transparent rules,

Bloomberg indices are widely used as a source for portfolio construction and performance comparison. We offer an array of services to clients interested in custom index development, investable index products designed to offer access to systematic strategies, index administration and calculation agent services. Bloomberg indices are driven by the same trusted reference data, pricing and analytical calculations that are leveraged throughout the investment process.

What’s the role?

As a Japan Asset Owners Index Sales Specialist, you will be a key driver of the commercial strategy for Bloomberg indices within this client vertical, working closely with clients, sales, and product management to deliver solutions and develop business opportunities. The Japan Asset Owners Index specialist will be part of a team focusing on Pension Funds and Insurance firms, and responsible for coverage of strategic accounts as well as working closely with regional index sales specialists to seek wider adoption and increased penetration of Bloomberg Index products within this client segment. You will be responsible for building and maintaining relationships with key influencers in the Pension Fund and Insurance community and provide them with consultative and commercially focused index solutions. You'll be involved in all aspects of market sizing, prospecting, account management, including senior level relationship management and in-depth discussions regarding Bloomberg index methodology and new product development. You will be a key source for future Index product strategies, having input on the entire product life cycle.

The role will require you to collaborate with the wider APAC Index Sales Team, Bloomberg Index Product, Engineering and Marketing to develop client-focused solutions. You’ll be joining a highly experienced, motivated and fast-growing Index Relationship Management team in Asia Pacific that sits within Global Financial Product Sales. You will need to have passion and knowledge of the institutional industry, keep pace with Index trends, local regulation and what our customers need.


We’ll trust you to:

  • Maintain senior level relationships with Japan’s pension funds and insurance community
  • Conduct in-depth discussions regarding Bloomberg index methodology and new product requirements
  • Increase client wallet share and adoption of Bloomberg Indices
  • Take a lead role in conducting internal and external training sessions and sales pitches
  • Work with clients throughout the sales process including commercial terms and contract execution
  • Collaborate extensively with different internal teams to cross-sell our suite of solutions
  • Provide detailed product feedback from clients to internal business managers in an effort to continually improve our products
  • Travel regularly to meet with clients and prospects

You’ll need to have:

  • An extensive network within the pension fund and insurance industry in Japan
  • Significant industry and client experience in navigating index related engagements
  • Experience working in, or selling to, Pension Funds and Insurance Firms
  • An astute commercial mind-set, working to exceed sales metrics
  • Demonstrable ability to identify new prospects and build and maintain solid client relationships
  • Excellent client communication skills in conversational speech, writing, and public speaking in both Japanese and English
  • Aptitude to excel in a dynamic, rapidly growing environment
  • Ability to creatively market our product to a vast demographic of potential clients
  • A self-starter and dedicated collaborator with strong multi-tasking skills

If this sounds like you:

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/products/indices/

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen. 

Bloomberg’s Global Facilities Operations team is responsible for delivering consistent, right-sized, and data-driven operations across our global portfolio. We balance risk, cost, and workplace experience while operating and continuously improving complex, high-performance space. Deep knowledge of our sites, paired with data and user insight, enables us to anticipate needs and operate as a trusted business partner to the organization. 

You Will Be Trusted To  
  • Lead Facilities & Workplace Experience operations across EMEA, managing a portfolio of 50+ sites with a strong bias toward execution, consistency and service quality  
  • Build, lead, and support multi-disciplinary teams, removing obstacles, setting clear expectations, and ensuring teams can operate effectively day-to-day while building a culture of accountability  
  • Own vendor management across the region, including contracts, scopes of work, and performance, holding partners accountable to service, quality, and commercial outcomes  
  • Act as the senior stakeholder interface for Facilities and Workplace Experience matters across EMEA, operating with transparency and a high-trust, service-oriented partnership model  
  • Ensure a consistent, high-quality guest and visitor experience, partnering closely with internal teams to deliver personal, well-run, and value-aligned service across sites  
  • Set and execute a clear regional vision and operating roadmap aligned to global strategy, connecting design intent, user behavior, and operational reality while balancing day-to-day excellence with proactive planning  
  • Flex seamlessly between hands-on operations and strategic planning, staying close to the details while anticipating risks, demand, and opportunities  
  • Own regional OPEX management, including forecasting, variance management, business case development, and reporting in close partnership with Finance  
  • Drive space planning and analytics to optimize utilization, support growth and change, and inform strategic workplace decisions  
  • Develop data-backed business cases for strategic investment in the regional portfolio, linking space performance, risk reduction, lifecycle cost, and employee experience to enterprise outcomes  
  • Partner with Design and Capital teams as a thought partner, challenging assumptions early, stress-testing concepts for operability, maintainability, and scale, and translating design intent into high-performing live environments  
  • Serve as a trusted advisor on site risk, asset condition, capital planning, and workplace standards, ensuring long-term performance of the built environment  
  • Partner with Incident Management and Business Continuity teams to strengthen preparedness, response, and recovery across the region 

You’ll Need to Have  
  • 15+ years of progressive experience in Facilities, Workplace Experience or adjacent disciplines (e.g. Operations, Customer Support, Design etc.) including 5+ years leading senior teams in a complex, multi-site environment  
  • Strong hands-on people leadership capability, with a proven track record of developing talent, removing friction, and building trust across disciplines  
  • Demonstrated experience in vendor governance, large contracts, and commercial performance management  
  • Exceptional stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence and align senior, cross-functional partners  
  • Commercially minded and solutions-oriented, comfortable navigating ambiguity and competing priorities  
  • Strong grasp of user experience, workflow, behavior, and systems thinking within workplace environments  
  • Ability to translate business and design objectives into data-backed operational strategies and execution plans  
  • A hands-on, transparent leader who values collaboration, accountability, and purpose-driven work

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg News is one of the biggest financial and business news organizations in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis on financial markets, from intraday coverage through in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It's what keeps us inventing and re-inventing, all the time. 

Bloomberg LP has built a significant media business spanning television, digital, magazine, radio and live event platforms across the globe. In the midst of a historic time in the media industry, Bloomberg Media is growing its global footprint and reach through new innovations from Originals to New Economy Forum. 

Bloomberg has a rare opportunity for a motivated, hardworking Part-Time Producer to launch a weekend morning news program on Bloomberg Television & Radio. The ideal candidate for this role will have experience line producing, booking guests, writing scripts, creating graphics, and collaborating across platforms. They will also have a working knowledge of TV and radio operations, including control room experience, preparing graphics and video for broadcast, mixing and editing digital audio, and directing anchors. This weekend show will air live on both video and audio platforms, requiring a unique skillset that is adaptable and able to work across a variety of mediums. Responsibilities include pre-production of video, graphic and audio elements, booking guests, directing on-screen content in a live control room, and editing video and audio for social media and on-demand consumption. Part-Time Producers are expected to create and maintain rundowns, build graphic elements that add editorial value, and write headlines that support and highlight on-screen content.

The ideal candidate for this role will have strong editorial experience, work efficiently and effectively to execute new ideas and use creative production techniques to produce compelling content.


We’ll trust you to:

  • Identify and book high-profile guests
  • Create and edit broadcast scripts
  • Write accurate, compelling headlines under tight deadlines
  • Communicate and coordinate with reporters across the newsroom
  • Direct show anchors, audio engineers, video ops and producers from the control room
  • Write and produce original packages and podcasts
  • Build and maintain rundowns with related video and graphic elements
  • Create a variety of graphics, including charts, headshots and maps
  • Build video assets, including photo montages, pre-taped interviews, SOTs and B-roll
  • Be creative, visualize new ideas and implement them

You'll need to have:

  • Exceptional editorial and production skills
  • Knowledge of TV and radio control room operations, including fundamentals of broadcast switchers and graphics
  • Audio and Video editing experience, including proficiency with Adobe Audition and Adobe Premiere
  • Experience working with high-profile talent and guests
  • Ability to write accurate news copy and headlines quickly
  • Proficiency with newsroom software systems such as ENPS, and agility with Windows
  • Knowledge of lighting, audio, graphics and studio blocking
  • Availability to work weekends
  • Ability to adjust working schedule as business needs require


If this sounds like you:


Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg News is seeking a reporter to help drive our agriculture coverage in the Americas and break news on the latest market developments. You’ll take on a crucial beat focused on soft commodities such as coffee, cocoa and sugar. Your reporting will span market movements, global trading trends, government policy, corporate strategy, farmer sentiment, and consumer and environmental issues. The ideal candidate will have a natural curiosity about how the agricultural sector operates — from farms to boardrooms — and a keen sense of how developments ripple across global markets and economies.

Agriculture is making major headlines as Donald Trump's policies reshape global trade, while US farmers are getting government bailouts as they struggle with weak crop prices and stiff competition from growing powerhouse Brazil. You’ll be responsible for delivering agenda-setting journalism that captures this upheaval — from scoops and breaking news to deeply reported enterprise pieces.

Working alongside colleagues in the Americas and across Bloomberg’s global network, you’ll stay on top of news affecting commodities futures, corporate moves and M&A, regulation and policy — and help bring clarity and insight to our global audience.

To be considered, please submit your application by Friday, February 13.

We’ll trust you to:
  • Monitor and explain market moves on major commodities, writing with precision and insight for sophisticated readers.
  • Generate original story and project ideas that vividly illustrate how commodities markets influence traders, farmers, corporations, and consumers.
  • Interpret and analyze the effects of tariffs on markets and trade.
  • Break news on issues including policymaking and environmental developments.
  • Connect the dots to pitch ambitious feature stories that span Bloomberg's platforms and make our content accessible to a diverse and business-savvy audience.
  • Collaborate closely with colleagues across teams, bureaus and continents to deliver a global perspective to our readers.

You’ll need to have:
  • Ideally some experience in a real-time news environment
  • A proven track record reporting and writing about business
  • Demonstrated success in building your own sources to break news
  • An ability to write quickly and clearly under deadline pressure
  • Demonstrated continuous career growth and initiative within an organization
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

We’d love to see:
  • Familiarity with journalism across platforms, including digital, video, podcasts and data visualization
  • Preferably experience covering agriculture or other commodities

Working alongside colleagues in the Americas and across Bloomberg’s global network, you’ll stay on top of news affecting commodities futures, corporate moves and M&A, regulation and policy — and help bring clarity and insight to our global audience.
To be considered, please submit your application by Friday, February 13.
We’ll trust you to:
Monitor and explain market moves on major commodities, writing with precision and insight for sophisticated readers.
Generate original story and project ideas that vividly illustrate how commodities markets influence traders, farmers, corporations, and consumers.
Interpret and analyze the effects of tariffs on markets and trade.
Break news on issues including policymaking and environmental developments.
Connect the dots to pitch ambitious feature stories that span Bloomberg's platforms and make our content accessible to a diverse and business-savvy audience.
Collaborate closely with colleagues across teams, bureaus and continents to deliver a global perspective to our readers.
You’ll need to have:
Ideally some experience in a real-time news environment
A proven track record reporting and writing about business
Demonstrated success in building your own sources to break news
An ability to write quickly and clearly under deadline pressure
Demonstrated continuous career growth and initiative within an organization
Strong communication and collaboration skills
We’d love to see:
Familiarity with journalism across platforms, including digital, video, podcasts and data visualization
Preferably experience covering agriculture or other commodities

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
We are seeking a collaborative and experienced journalist to serve as an editor in our Finance & Investing Americas group. This is a dynamic and fast-paced assignment, shaping stories on the biggest banks and investment firms on the global stage. You'll work with some of the top reporters in the newsroom to chronicle the fortunes being made and lost on Wall Street, profile the people driving the decisions, and spell out the impact on consumers, markets and the political landscape.

This role will combine a mix of breaking news stories and enterprise features; speed, clarity and accuracy are a must. We'll rely on you to jump on fast-moving stories and deliver meaningful context that helps our audience make sense of market-moving developments in real time. You will also team up with reporters on longer-term projects, collaborating closely to shape ideas, guide reporting, and produce compelling storytelling that's fair, complete, insightful and resonant across platforms.

We'll trust you to:
--Quickly shape accurate, fair, detailed and captivating coverage
--Work closely with reporters to bring the best out of their notebooks
--Think beyond simple copy changes to tell powerful narratives that encompass print, visuals, audio and video
--Possess an intuitive understanding of our audience across formats and platforms

You'll need to have:
--At least 5 years in a real-time financial journalism newsroom
--A strong work ethic and the ability to stay calm under pressure
--Deep knowledge of financial markets and the key firms that shape them
--A proven track record of collaborating with colleagues

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg News is one of the biggest financial and business news organizations in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis on financial markets, from intraday coverage through in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It's what keeps us inventing and re-inventing, all the time.

Bloomberg Television is seeking a freelance Desk Producer to join the US broadcast news desk from our headquarters in New York. This is a fast-paced, news-driven role suited for a journalist who thrives on tight deadlines, collaboration, and has sharp editorial judgment.

The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in coordinating live hits, turning newsworthy sound from interviews and events, and ensuring timely and compelling content delivery across Bloomberg’s TV, Radio and multimedia platforms. You’ll work hand-in-hand with field crews, producers, and reporters to respond to breaking news, business developments, and major global events.

You’ll bring a deep interest in business, economics and geopolitics, with the ability to spot what matters—and act quickly. You’ll also be someone who enjoys building strong working relationships across teams, and who thrives balancing multiple priorities under pressure.

We'll trust you to:
  • Coordinate daily newsgathering efforts, liaising with bureaus, field crews, and reporters to line up live hits and coordinating rolling coverage
  • Cut newsworthy soundbites and segments from live interviews, press conferences, panels and events, quickly and with editorial accuracy
  • Make editorial decisions in real time, helping shape our on-air narrative and content
  • Collaborate closely with Bloomberg’s producers, anchors, correspondents, and the wider editorial team to prioritize the right coverage
  • Maintain a strong awareness of market-moving news and political and economic developments across the Americas
You’ll need to have:
  • 3–5+ years of experience in broadcast journalism, news desk production, or digital video production
  • Excellent editorial judgment with a track record of responding effectively to breaking news
  • A collaborative approach and excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Flexibility to work early shifts as needed
  • A solid grasp of US business, politics, and financial markets
  • Experience using video editing systems to cut and turn around fast-moving content is a bonus

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The April Analytics & Sales program is a unique opportunity to develop a comprehensive understanding of our Bloomberg products and clients in the wider context of financial markets. Following our comprehensive training program, you will apply your knowledge by assisting our clients first in the Analytics department and then grow to the Sales department.

In our Analytics business, you will provide 24/7 support for Bloomberg Professional Service users all over the world and across multiple industries. Reaching us via our Helpdesk using the 'Instant Bloomberg' chat system, clients access unparalleled customer service where we answer their questions and help them maximize the value of Bloomberg's products. On any given day we respond to over 12,000 queries in more than 15 languages. From educating a portfolio manager on Bloomberg’s risk management solutions to helping a trader use our functionality to discover new sources of market liquidity the variety of problems we solve is immense.

Bloomberg is constantly innovating, and Analytics plays a key role in ensuring clients are educated on new products and enhancements by proactively working closely to upskill them through technology and delivering on-site training and seminars. We also work in conjunction with Sales to deliver strategic initiatives, supporting product roll-out and onboarding clients. We want to ensure our clients are making the most of our service and using tools and features that allow them to work smarter.

As you deepen your knowledge, you will progress to our Sales department. In Sales, we are the face of Bloomberg for our clients. Consultative and entrepreneurial, we manage client relationships, whilst striving to continually grow our revenue by identifying new business opportunities. We spend our time with our clients, understanding their business goals and outpacing their expectations. Guided by curiosity and purpose, we work to understand their workflows and present them with the most appropriate solutions across our range of enterprise offerings.


What’s in it for you?

You will start by completing our comprehensive Analytics & Sales training program, covering all aspects of the financial markets: industry principles, market players and asset classes - while teaching you all there is to know about the functionality and analytical tools Bloomberg has to offer!

You will first join our Analytics teams, delivering exceptional customer support to our clients by providing fast and accurate solutions to their queries, while continuing to develop your knowledge through asset class and workflow specialist training.

Equipped with a deep understanding of our products and how our users utilize them, you will then progress into our Sales team positioning the value of our services, building client relationships, and growing accounts.

There are multiple opportunities to further your career across the departments or the company and in time take on a leadership role.


Who you are?

You understand the drivers behind market moving stories and events. You are a solution-finder, with a real passion for providing exceptional customer service in a fast-paced environment. With a desire to build a career in a client-facing role, you understand the importance of credibility and building relationships!


You’ll need to have:

  • Ability to start a full-time role in the New York office April 6, 2026
  • A Bachelor’s degree (or above) or relevant work experience 
  • Ambition for a client-facing career with focus on relationship management and sales 
  • Demonstrated interest in the financial markets and the aspiration to work in the financial services industry
  • Strong multitasking abilities, critical thinking and problem-solving skills 
  • The ability to learn and adapt quickly in a fast-paced dynamic environment 
  • Interest in innovative technologies and their potential to enhance workflows and efficiencies 
  • Exceptional communication skills (both written and verbal) 
  • Legal authorization to work full-time in the United States and will not require visa sponsorship now or in the future (U.S. citizen, U.S. permanent resident/green card holder, refugee, asylee)
  • Willing and able to travel around the United States to meet the business needs of our clients
  • Flexibility to occasionally work weekends or on bank/public/federal holiday (weekday off in lieu)


We’d love to see:

  • Demonstrated practical exposure to Python or other coding languages preferable 
  • Previous experience in client relationship management 
  • Beginner to intermediate experience with Excel and/or VBA 

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/.

Bloomberg LP has built a significant media business spanning television, digital, magazine, radio and live event platforms across the globe.

We are seeking a Promo Producer & Editor to join the Bloomberg Television Promo Strategy team for a 6-month contract in New York. This role is for a creative powerhouse capable of
owning the entire lifecycle of a promo—from initial script to final motion graphics—to highlight our global newsroom’s key programming, events, and interviews.

  • Work well under pressure in a fast-paced newsroom environment, be able to pivot and react as news events evolve.

  • Work with various programs throughout your shift including the Bloomberg Terminal, editing software, newsroom programs and distribution tools
  • Understanding and excitement for financial news, politics and general news

  • 5 years of on-air promotion, creative agency work, or news media experience
  • Advance knowledge of the Adobe Creative Cloud, specifically Premiere and After Effects
  • Availability to work onsite in our New York office 4–5 days per week
  • A strong reel or portfolio showcasing high-end promo work

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg Media is looking for an individual with a proactive attitude who is focused, flexible, and proficient in several aspects of broadcast operations, and who can work collaboratively in a live control room and studio environment in a viz/graphics operator capacity. We’re looking for someone who can take initiative and thoroughly follow a live broadcast conversation to accurately match elements on-screen. They will be required to work with operations, on-air talent, engineering, and editorial teams, as well as their global counterparts to ensure high-quality visual production on an early morning, weekend (part-time) basis.

We'll trust you to:
  • Participate in pre-show meetings with editorial and technical teams to align show vision.
  • Move quickly and accurately under pressure in a fast-paced live broadcast environment to deliver a high-quality visual product.
  • Operate a live broadcast graphics rundown, firing lower-third and full screen graphics to various engines while communicating with control room crew and editorial colleagues for a 3-hour production.
  • Proactively change graphics to accurately follow topic changes and breaking news developments, working quickly to match relevant graphics with the on-air conversation as they become available.
  • Communicate with Team Leads to report on issues and faults that will impact global counterparts.

You'll need to have:
  • Bachelor’s degree or 2 years of experience working in a live TV environment.
  • 2 years of experience operating within Vizrt ecosystem or with relevant live graphics software (Xpression, Chyron).
  • An ability to complete tasks with a high level of accuracy under tight deadlines in high pressure situations in live broadcast environment.
  • Familiarity with ENPS or other relevant broadcast news rundown software
  • A strong desire to work as part of a team in a highly collaborative environment.
  • Ability to manage multiple streams of information simultaneously while operating live graphics system.
  • Early morning weekend availability is required.

If this sounds like you, apply today! We're eager to speak with you.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Our team


The Custom Data team helps clients to bring their firm’s private datasets into the Bloomberg ecosystem. It lets them link proprietary data stores directly to the Terminal and across our Enterprise suite, so teams can collaborate on the same live data, tailor workflows end-to-end, and embed custom analytics at every stage of the investment cycle (from idea generation through execution and post-trade reporting).

For buy-side firms like mutual funds, hedge funds and pensions, Custom data transforms the Terminal from a solo research tool into a shared intelligence platform.

The Custom Data platform delivers a managed infrastructure encompassing the end-to-end lifecycle of proprietary institutional data.

Key Capabilities

  • Metadata and Access Management: Offers tools to define metadata for proprietary data and manage access to govern data access.

  • Ingest Pipelines: Provides both interactive and batch ingest pipelines to facilitate the transfer of data from the client environment into the Bloomberg ecosystem.

  • Rich Key Structure: Enables clients to store data against a combination of one or more financial attributes.

  • Auditing Capabilities: Ensures the transparency and 'paper trail' necessary for regulatory compliance and internal data integrity.

  • APIs for Integration: provides standardized Read APIs that seamlessly embed data within Bloomberg's ecosystem, including the Terminal, execution platforms, and risk workflows.

  • Data Extraction: Supplies Data and Audit feeds to facilitate the extraction of client-provided data outside the Bloomberg ecosystem.

System Scale and Performance:

  • The system processes in excess of 250 million daily requests, comprising 150 million metadata requests and 100 million read queries.

  • It serves approximately 65 billion data points across interactive, reporting, batch, and screening applications.

  • The platform manages data for 11,000 firms, encompassing 365,000 unique fields.

  • It maintains stringent latency requirements to support real-time Bloomberg Terminal workflows.

We’ll trust you to:

  • Design and implement features in the product while adhering to strict latency requirements.

  • Write maintainable and production-quality code.

  • Contribute to system design and refactor Python and C++ services to follow clean, single-responsibility principles.

  • Evaluate next-generation storage solutions.

  • Modernize Custom data integration with standard Bloomberg APIs.

  • Own observability from metrics to dashboards, defining clear SLIs and SLOs.

  • Design tools to improve team oncall/operational experience.

  • Partner with other enterprise teams in Bloomberg  to evolve the future of Custom data at Bloomberg.

  • Mentor junior engineers in the team on best engineering practices.

You'll need to have:

  • 4+ years of experience in backend engineering, ideally with Python 

  • Strong system design and debugging skills in production environments

  • Familiarity with distributed messaging or stream-processing frameworks (Kafka preferred)

  • Familiarity with relational and noSQL datastores at Bloomberg (Cassandra preferred)

  • A strong product mindset paired with genuine empathy for client needs

  • A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience

We’d love to see:

  • Familiarity with Python  standards and tooling 

  • Background in distributed systems like Kafka, Redis, Cassandra, or HBase

  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, or system observability

  • Exposure to containerized environments using Docker or Kubernetes

Our team


The Custom Data team helps clients to bring their firm’s private datasets into the Bloomberg ecosystem. It lets them link proprietary data stores directly to the Terminal and across our Enterprise suite, so teams can collaborate on the same live data, tailor workflows end-to-end, and embed custom analytics at every stage of the investment cycle (from idea generation through execution and post-trade reporting).

For buy-side firms like mutual funds, hedge funds and pensions, Custom data transforms the Terminal from a solo research tool into a shared intelligence platform.

The Custom Data platform delivers a managed infrastructure encompassing the end-to-end lifecycle of proprietary institutional data.

Key Capabilities

  • Metadata and Access Management: Offers tools to define metadata for proprietary data and manage access to govern data access.

  • Ingest Pipelines: Provides both interactive and batch ingest pipelines to facilitate the transfer of data from the client environment into the Bloomberg ecosystem.

  • Rich Key Structure: Enables clients to store data against a combination of one or more financial attributes.

  • Auditing Capabilities: Ensures the transparency and 'paper trail' necessary for regulatory compliance and internal data integrity.

  • APIs for Integration: provides standardized Read APIs that seamlessly embed data within Bloomberg's ecosystem, including the Terminal, execution platforms, and risk workflows.

  • Data Extraction: Supplies Data and Audit feeds to facilitate the extraction of client-provided data outside the Bloomberg ecosystem.

System Scale and Performance:

  • The system processes in excess of 250 million daily requests, comprising 150 million metadata requests and 100 million read queries.

  • It serves approximately 65 billion data points across interactive, reporting, batch, and screening applications.

  • The platform manages data for 11,000 firms, encompassing 365,000 unique fields.

  • It maintains stringent latency requirements to support real-time Bloomberg Terminal workflows.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg LP has built a significant media business spanning television and OTT, digital, magazine, podcast and radio, and live event platforms across the globe, and Bloomberg Media has become the indispensable source of information for the world’s most influential business leaders of today and for the next generation of leaders changing how we work and live.

At Bloomberg Media Studios, we confront these questions every day. As the global studio at the heart of Bloomberg Media Group, we develop creative solutions for brands that leverage Bloomberg’s mission, intelligence, and equity for Bloomberg’s core audiences.

We have an exciting opportunity for an Executive Editor to join the team. You'll be a proven creative leader who can work closely with clients to develop and present creative content solutions, help lead a creative team with high-level video and design capabilities, leverage relationships to build creative partnerships in the Middle East and Africa, and create buzz in the region about Bloomberg Media Studios and our work for clients.

The Executive Editor will help lead a creative studio that includes full-time staff with design and video leads. The Executive Editor will augment that team with a talented and diverse group of freelancers and vendors that can contribute to ideation as well as execution of projects. The Middle East & Africa Studio will serve many different markets, and the Executive Editor is responsible for developing relationships with on-the-ground talent in each and every market.

The Executive Editor ensures that Bloomberg Media Studios content solutions fulfills our brand position of thought leadership powered by proprietary data. The Middle East & Africa Executive Editor connects regularly with the Global Creative Head and the Global Executive Editor to share best practices and ensure that Bloomberg Media Studios maintains a consistent global voice while understanding the unique qualities of the Middle East & Africa region.

The Executive Editor will also have strong relationships with sales, strategy and data science leadership and will work collaboratively with these teams in client presentations and developing new business.

We are passionate about developing innovative ideas and committed to working for a company that places purpose at the center of its business, and understands that creativity depends on a healthy, balanced, and supportive work environment.

We’ll trust you to:

  • Partner with key stakeholders to build a world-class creative studio in Dubai that will increase Bloomberg Media Studios’ presence in the MEA region and create buzz around our creative work on behalf of clients.
  • Generate innovative ideas across all existing and emerging platforms and inspire colleagues to create world-class, pioneering work and content
  • Demonstrate deep knowledge of the MEA region, as well as a sound understanding of the energy, finance and technology themes and issues important to our clients and our audience
  • Be a proven creative innovator in terms of applying new technologies like AI to elevate work and improve efficiency.
  • Manage the work but also be equally comfortable in taking a hands-on approach
  • Develop data- and insight-driven concepts and be part of the creative process from sales strategy to concepts to execution
  • Autonomously own a large project from kickoff to completion, often balancing multiple projects at once
  • Oversee and provide thought leadership in the assessment of existing properties for content value, relevance, aesthetics, branding and overall experience
  • Collaborate with cross-functional team on implementation feasibility to ensure conceptual ideas are realizable
  • Build confidence with clients through compelling presentation of content ideas. Independent thinking and effective oral and written presentation skills are required
  • Establish key creative partnerships in the region to produce the highest quality work

You’ll need to have:

  • 8-10 years of conceptually driven copyrighting (with strong video storytelling)
  • Creative or content/publisher/agency/consultancy experience at management level
  • Knowledge of Middle East & Africa business landscape and experience working with clients and vendors in the region
  • Great presentation and time management skills
  • Strong editorial judgment
  • Proven skills in presenting, client partnership and visual communication
  • Knowledge of the capabilities of modern web technologies and desire to stay at the forefront as new technologies emerge
  • Broad knowledge of social media, digital communications and the use of AI in media
  • Advanced knowledge of video, brand development, digital marketing and the creative process
  • Strong ability to provide clear creative direction and provide timely, helpful feedback to improve creative processes and to keep work on budget and schedule

If this sounds like you:

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional

Life at Bloomberg is many things, but it’s never dull. We're a truly global business with a truly diverse workforce. We pride ourselves on being open, inclusive and collaborative, and provide a work environment that inspires our employees to be their best. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive healthcare coverage, and programs to support you and your family through different life stages, from parental leave to generous retirement savings plans.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg News is one of the biggest financial and business news organizations in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis on financial markets, from intraday coverage through in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It's what keeps us inventing and re-inventing, all the time.

From GDP and inflation to central bank policy and employment figures, Bloomberg’s economic coverage helps investors, policymakers and business leaders understand what’s happening, and what’s next.

We’re looking for an Economic Data News Editor in Tokyo to join our Asia-Pacific Economic Data News team. This is a unique role at the intersection of journalism, economics, and technology, where you’ll cover the numbers that move global markets.

This role offers the chance to make a direct impact in one of Bloomberg’s most visible functions. Whether you’re a journalist building data skills, a data professional moving closer to news, or a product specialist interested in how information reaches users — you’ll be shaping how millions of people understand Japan’s economy. You’ll also be working at the forefront of AI and automation in real-time news.

We'll trust you to:
  • Report on key economic indicators with speed, accuracy, and insight
  • Survey economists to compile forecasts for major releases across Asia
  • Work closely with reporters, data analysts, product managers, and technologists to improve coverage and processes
  • Use and experiment with AI tools and automation to make reporting faster and richer
  • Find new ways to collect, process, and present data for real-time insights
  • Share ideas that help Bloomberg explain macroeconomic trends to a global audience
You'll need to have:
  • At least 3 years of experience in journalism, economics, finance, data analysis, or product development
  • A working knowledge of Excel VBA
  • Fluency in written and spoken English and Japanese
  • Ability to stay calm and precise under deadline pressure
  • Curiosity about how economies work, how data drives decisions, and how new technologies like AI can improve reporting
  • Evidence of steady career growth within an organization
We'd love to see:
  • Familiarity with the Bloomberg Terminal
  • Experience in real-time or financial news environments
  • A passion for telling stories through numbers
Life at Bloomberg is many things, but it’s never dull. We’re a truly global business with a truly diverse workforce. We pride ourselves on being open, inclusive and collaborative, and provide a work environment that inspires our employees to be their best. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive healthcare coverage, and programs to support you and your family through different life stages, from parental leave to generous retirement savings plans.

If this sounds like you:

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: www.bloomberg.com/professional

ブルームバーグ・ニュースは、世界有数の金融・ビジネスニュースメディアです。徹底した市場分析に基づき、時宜を得た、高品質で正確なニュースを提供しています。革新の精神を信条とし、常に成長を続けながら、投資家との信頼関係を築いています。

GDP（国内総生産）やインフレーション、中央銀行の政策、雇用統計など、ブルームバーグの経済報道は、投資家や政策立案者、ビジネスリーダーが「今何が起きているのか」を理解し、「次に何が起こるのか」を予測する手助けをしています。

現在、東京を拠点とする経済指標担当ニュースエディターを募集しています。

ジャーナリズム、経済分析、そしてテクノロジーの革新性を融合させた、ユニークなポジションで、日本をはじめアジア太平洋地域の主要経済指標をリアルタイムで報道、市場を動かすチームの一員として活躍していただきます。

ブルームバーグのクライアントにとって不可欠な主要な経済指標など各種データの分析や解説、エコノミストへの調査、情報の整理・編集など多岐にわたる役割を担っていただきます。

データ分析のスキルを磨きたい記者、ニュースの現場に興味のあるデータ専門家、ユーザーへの情報伝達に関心のあるプロダクトスペシャリストなど、これまでの経歴や経験に関わらず、市場や読者に直接影響を与えることができます。また、人工知能（AI）や自動化技術を活用した最先端のニュース報道にも携わっていただきます。


主な業務内容
  • 経済指標ニュースを迅速かつ正確に編集・報道し、分析・解説・視点を提供する
  • アジア各国の主要経済指標について、エコノミストへの調査を行い予測をまとめる
  • 記者、データアナリスト、プロダクトマネージャー、テクノロジーチームと連携し、報道内容および業務プロセスを改善する
  • AIツールや自動化技術を活用し、より早く深みのある報道を実現する
  • 市場を動かすリアルタイムな分析・洞察を発信するため、新たなデータの収集・処理方法を見出す
  • マクロ経済の動向を世界中の読者により分かりやすく伝えるための提案をする

応募資格
  • ジャーナリズム、経済・金融・データ分析、またはプロダクト開発の分野で3年以上の実務経験がある方
  • Excel VBAの実務知識がある方
  • 英語・日本語双方での高い言語運用能力がある方
  • 締め切りのある環境で落ち着いて正確に業務を進められる方
  • 経済の仕組みやデータが意思決定に与える影響を理解し、またAIなどの最新技術の活用により報道の迅速性や正確性をどう高められるかに関心のある方
  • 組織内で着実なキャリア成長を明示している方

歓迎スキル
  • ブルームバーグ端末（Bloomberg Terminal）の使用経験
  • リアルタイム報道または金融ニュース分野での業務経験
  • データから洞察を引き出し、数字を通してストーリーを伝えることに情熱を持っている

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg News is one of the world’s leading financial and business news organizations, delivering breaking news and in-depth analysis that global investors rely on. Our Japanese language newsroom plays a critical role in providing timely, insightful coverage of Japan’s economy, government and financial policy for a broad and highly engaged audience.

We are seeking an experienced editor to join our Japanese language macroeconomics and government team in Tokyo. This role sits at the heart of our coverage of Japan’s politics, fiscal policy and central bank decisions — stories that shape public debate and move global markets.

As an editor, you will not only ensure accuracy and speed, but also actively shape coverage by proposing compelling story angles based on reader interest, market relevance and the evolving news cycle. You will work closely with reporters to develop ideas, refine focus and deliver impactful journalism under constant deadline pressure.

We’ll trust you to:
  • Edit and publish high-quality Japanese-language news stories on Japan’s macroeconomy, government and monetary policy with speed, accuracy and strong news judgment
  • Proactively propose story angles and approaches to reporters, helping shape coverage that reflects reader interest, policy significance and market impact
  • Present stories in a way that resonates with readers, including sharp headlines, strong leads and clear context
  • Report and break news independently when required, leveraging your own sourcing and reporting network
  • Anticipate upcoming policy events and potential news developments, and plan coverage accordingly
  • Operate effectively in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment while maintaining composure and editorial rigor
  • Collaborate across teams, including working with English-language content when relevant, to ensure comprehensive and timely coverage
You’ll need to have:
  • At least 5 years of experience in Japanese-language journalism, including reporting and editing for publication
  • Demonstrated ability to propose and develop strong story angles, working with reporters to turn complex policy issues into compelling news
  • Strong editing skills with a clear understanding of audience interests and how to package news effectively
  • Solid knowledge of Japan’s politics, fiscal policy and the Bank of Japan’s monetary policy framework
  • A strong work ethic, sound judgment and the ability to perform calmly under sustained pressure
  • An understanding of how political, fiscal and monetary policy developments affect financial markets
  • Fluency in written and spoken Japanese
  • Working-level English; the ability to translate or edit English-language stories into Japanese is a strong plus
Life at Bloomberg is many things, but it’s never dull. We’re a truly global business with a truly diverse workforce. We pride ourselves on being open, inclusive and collaborative, and provide a work environment that inspires our employees to be their best. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive healthcare coverage, and programs to support you and your family through different life stages, from parental leave to generous retirement savings plans.

If this sounds like you:

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: www.bloomberg.com/professional

Learn more about our office and benefits:
Tokyo | www.bloomberg.com/tokyo
