title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast. While keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration throughout countless volunteer projects; we also help network with the communities around us. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen. We want people who will enjoy working in this environment and feed off the energy. 

 

What’s the role? 

Facilities Operations is accountable for consistent, right-sized, and data-driven operations of our global space portfolio in line with agreed standards, ensuring every site operates safely, sustainably and efficiently. We balance risk, cost, and experience while continuously maintaining and improving our offices. We know our sites, spaces, and environments intimately, combining data and user insight to anticipate operational needs and own the employee and visitor (or workplace) experience. 

We partner with the wider facilities expertise (Design, Capital, Real Estate, Infrastructure Teams) to advocate for our sites and drive informed on-ground decisions. 

As the Facilities Site Manage, you will play a critical role in ensuring Bloomberg's facilities reflect its culture of excellence and innovation. You will be responsible for our commercial office in Pune. You will oversee facilities operations, lead operational budget planning, support multi-year capital planning, drive sustainability initiatives, and use metrics and data integrity to continuously improve services. By collaborating closely with internal teams, business stakeholders, vendors and building management, you will help shape an exceptional workplace for employees and guests alike. 

 

We will Trust You To: 

 

Vendor & Building Management Partnership: 

  • Partner with all Workplace Operations departments including Infrastructure and Workplace Experience to deliver a strong vendor partnership within office operations. 
  • Establish beneficial and lasting partnership with building management and landlord to ensure overall excellent building operation & maintenance, and drive key discussion and alignment that benefit Bloomberg operational and business goals. 
  • Monthly operational review and quarterly QBR with 3rd party providers to ensure operational excellence and high-quality performance throughout all levels of facilities operations. 
  • Monitor vendor performance and partner with vendor leadership team to address any issues, strengthen the partnership, and provide adjustments to ensure high-quality service delivery. 
  • Proactively integrate sustainability principles (SOG’s), including energy efficiency, waste reduction, and water conservation, into all facilities operations and vendor contracts. 

 

Stakeholder Engagement: 

  • Establish constructive relationship with business stakeholders to ensure facilities service standard and goals align with business needs.
  • Be in touch with stakeholders and employees' feedback and drive continuous improvement and excellent change management.
  • Influence with facilities expertise and enable business & office communities for collective decision making for the office and communities.  

  •  

Annual Capital & Operational Planning: 

  • Lead operational budget planning and support the multi-year capital planning process, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and financial accuracy to plan, execute, and oversee various projects to enhance our facilities. 
  • Coordinate with internal teams, including design and capital projects to build and manage the multi-year capital plan to prioritize projects and allocate resources effectively. 


Program Continuous Improvement: 

  • Lead initiatives to continuously improve facility operations and maintenance processes - including continuous review of SOPs supporting global SLAs and regional execution.
  • Use metrics and data-driven insights to monitor performance and enhance operational efficiency. Support global implementation and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and enhance operational excellence and hit management committee metrics. 
  • Foster a culture of continuous improvement among the facilities team to ensure office facilities are safe, functional, and well-maintained. 
  • Oversee the successful delivery of facilities routine maintenance and repairs and manage emergency response procedures to ensure compliance with internal BCP, relevant laws, regulations, and safety standards. 

 

Budget Management: 

  • Oversee development and management of annual budget for Pune, ensuring cost-effective operations and on-budget/on-time delivery. 
  • Support vendor partners in development of financial reports and forecasts for senior management. 
  • Liaison with CFO team across the region for operations related to all facilities budget, opex and capex planning. 

 

Drive partnership and collaboration with our business partners: 

  • Partner with all Facilities Office teams including Infrastructure, Capital Project, Design, and Global Real Estate, to advocate for the needs of the site, and deliver the right-sized solutions. 
  • Collaborate effectively with the above partner teams to ensure a robust support for the expected growth of the Pune office – from the capital project support, providing the right spaces for the Pune business, to offering creative operational solutions to the growing business and space portfolio. 


You'll need to have: 

  • Bachelor's degree in Facilities Management, Business Administration, or a related field. 
  • Minimum 7 years of experience in facilities management, including vendor management and project oversight. 
  • Excellent leadership, communication and negotiation skills 
  • Strong organizational and time management abilities. 
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. 
  • Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills. 
  • Commitment to sustainability and energy efficiency practices. 
  • Experience managing complex projects with measurable success. 
  • Familiarity with workplace technologies and tools that support operations and sustainability initiatives. 
  • Business proficiency in English and Hindi to liaise with vendors and stakeholders


If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional

Why Bloomberg?
We’re individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We’re interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential.

Learn more about our office and benefits:

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg News is one of the biggest financial and business news organizations in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis of financial markets and big business, from daily coverage through to in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It's what keeps us inventing and re-inventing.

We run a Chinese-language news service (CBN), with journalists in more than 10 bureaus across Asia, Europe and the US breaking news and curating stories that resonate with Chinese-speaking audiences. Our reporting is available on the Bloomberg Terminal, and through podcasts and newsletters.
We are seeking an experienced editor for CBN. Based in New York or Washington DC, the successful candidate will join a dynamic team that produces markets-focused content for Chinese-reading clients around the globe.

The role involves monitoring, translating, writing and editing compelling stories that resonate with a Chinese-reading audience. It goes beyond straight translation work, with members of the team encouraged to add value by applying news and editorial judgement to the content they produce. While the primary focus will be on Chinese-language stories, the candidate will also be expected to work closely with counterparts across the newsroom, including those working in English. The successful candidate will also embrace Bloomberg’s cutting-edge AI capabilities to enhance speed, accuracy and consistency across the translation and editing workflow.

We'll trust you to:
- Provide accurate, fast and comprehensive English-to-Chinese news translations in a high-speed and high-pressure environment- Demonstrate outstanding news judgement on stories related to global markets, economic and political trends- Create content, write and edit copy designed to provide insight for Chinese-reading traders, analysts and money managers- Leverage Bloomberg’s cutting-edge AI features and newsroom tools to facilitate translation, editing and story production, while applying strong editorial oversight and accountability
- Work effectively across multiple teams and platforms, including close collaboration with English-language colleagues

You will need to have:
- A Bachelor's degree or above
- Proven news judgement and a strong sense of urgency
- Minimum 3 years of experience working in journalism or the financial industry
- Solid knowledge and understanding of the economy and financial markets as well as the dynamics that move various asset prices
- Excellent translating, writing and editing skills in primarily Chinese language
- Fluency in Mandarin Chinese and English

description_html:
Companies are the backbone of the stock and bond markets. Bloomberg Intelligence ("BI") conducts in-depth research on small and midsize companies to help stock and bond investors effectively evaluate those companies. We analyze the unique attributes of emerging technologies, build models by extracting data from company filings and track how the business strategies and successes translate into financial results.

BI research is a combination of written analysis accompanied by interactive charting and analytics created from company reported data as well as industry and government data. Analysts review, check and curate this data into comprehensive and logically arranged dashboards to support their own research and to provide Bloomberg Terminal users a platform to view and analyze the data as well.

What's in it for you:
BI is looking for a highly motivated research analyst focusing on biotech to be part of the global healthcare team. A good understanding of science and biotech business models is a must. You will be entrusted to deliver high quality and timely content while also growing our data offering.

We'll trust you to:
• Leverage your knowledge of biotechnology companies to actively create industry and company investment research on a regular basis.
• Be a subject matter expert in drug development, preferably in the disease areas of immunology and inflammation.
• Monitor, interpret and react to major company developments, and identify macro themes and trends affecting investments.
• Work closely with the global healthcare team to coordinate and collaborate on analysis.
• Develop and maintain relationships with investors, industry and market professionals, investor relations personnel, and senior management at target companies.
• Participate and initiate marketing events like webinars and round-tables to commercialize research ideas.
• Work with Global Data teams to ensure data completeness and quality control for existing and new data sets of target companies.

You need to have:
• At least 4 years of experience with an advanced degree in a relevant science field, or commensurate experience.
• Experience interpreting financial statements and financial modelling.
• Knowledge of advanced concepts, practices, and procedures of finance and accounting.
• Exceptional primary research and writing skills.
• Self-starter, independent thinker and collaborative team player.
• Strong organization skills, and capable of handling multiple projects.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills.
• Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organization

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know the next steps!

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight, and we use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. And, to ensure the best experience for our 20,000+ employees across 176 offices globally, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are.

The Bloomberg Financial Solutions department of 5,000+ employees is at the forefront of ensuring success for our customers and employees alike. Our team comprises several key pillars: sales, service, operations, culture and brand. As a department, we are united by a common goal: We create meaningful relationships with clients by understanding their needs and delivering exceptional end-to-end support from sales and implementation, through their ongoing relationship with Bloomberg.

Our Team

Our Sales teams are industry renowned for their subject matter expertise and platinum service levels. You’ll have industry renowned training, not just when you join us, but continually throughout your career here. Just like we invest in our products, we invest in our people. It gives us the edge.

What's the role?
We have an exciting position as an Account Manager for our Mexico and Central American clients. You will be responsible for developing deep and trusted relationships with our clients, understanding their workflow and technology while successfully adding value to end users and prospects. You will utilize the local coverage approach to drive usage and retention while discovering enterprise opportunities.

We’ll trust you to:

* Creatively find ways to engage clients in person and remotely to increase value of the Bloomberg technology products.
* Strategically look across your coverage to determine gaps in client’s workflow to increase their usage -of Key Products and identify areas where they could be using other Bloomberg products.
* Proactively find and monitor at risk users to defend the Bloomberg business.
* Manage usage campaigns, both self-initiated with regards wider business targets as well as management driven initiatives.
* Develop understanding the Bloomberg Technology as part of the financial markets and have the ability to position our solutions.
* Show a strong level of Bloomberg customer type knowledge, by understanding how that player type makes money, does their job, and utilizes the technology.
* Be able to demonstrate functionality and workflows of applicable Bloomberg solutions that improve a specific customer type's need.
* Show an aptitude and growing knowledge about the markets in which your customers operates.
* Contribute innovative ideas that anticipate and address client needs.
* Collaborate internally to implement and execute value-added solution.
* Participate actively in new projects that drive departmental and firm-wide initiatives and goals.
* Seek out additional ways to demonstrate leadership and make an impact, such as mentoring, involvement in training, running campaigns, and active involvement in product enhancement.
You’ll need to have: * Fixed Income, Equity, FX, Portfolio Management or FI/FX Derivatives.
* Demonstrable ability to build and maintain relationships at all levels.
* Spanish language fluency.
* Knowledge of and interest in financial services and technology.
* A strong track record of presentation, training and communication skills.

We’d love to see:

* Knowledge or expertise on Bloomberg terminal-based solutions.
* A hunger to learn; to immerse yourself in role and be motivated to constantly improve your knowledge and skills.
* Ambition, critical thinking skills and a passion for collaboration

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg is a data company. Delivering timely insights to our clients requires extensive specialized databases and data augmentation pipelines, fusing data from a variety of structured and unstructured data stores. Curating quality insights requires collecting data from sources built on a variety of open source and home-grown solutions, from streaming real-time market data to long-term data storage. 

In this role within the CTO Infrastructure team, you will develop the vision for Bloomberg’s managed data services, supporting the next evolution of structured and unstructured data storage. You will define unified products and capabilities, and partner tightly with engineering teams to develop the architecture and deliver these products, directly serving business needs. You will bring your technical expertise to help bridge business needs and technology delivery. 

You’ll need to have:
- 10+ years of experience working on databases or unstructured data storage technologies as a developer. 
- Strong written and verbal communication skills.  
- A bachelor’s degree in systems engineering, electrical engineering or computer science, or equivalent. 
- A strong understanding of relational (SQL), non-relational (NoSQL) databases, from an operational, scale, and design perspective. 
- Ability to define and evaluate architectures for scalable, resilient, durable and high-performance data stores, including both geographically distributed on-premises and public cloud implementations.  
- Working knowledge of caching technologies, data access APIs, query languages, and data integration patterns. 
- Ability to work with or define SDKs or connectors for integration. 
- Familiarity with unstructured data storage technologies (such as Ceph with RADOS). 
- Knowledge of security and compliance controls, such as encryption at rest/in transit, access controls, integration into data governance regimes, and compliance standards. 
- Experience integrating security controls across diverse data storage technologies including secure by default configurations, Enterprise IAM (authentication & authorization), and encryption strategies in-transit (TLS) and at-rest (storage-level, TDE, and application/client-side methods). 
- Developer Experience Focus 
- User-centric approach, ability to synthesize user requirements and journeys for a wide variety of users (i.e. developers, data engineers, data scientists, etc.). 
- Define standards/policies, maturity levels and other guidelines to ensure consistency. 
- Focus on API-driven self-service enablement and management. 
- Product Management
- Ability to develop, refine and communicate a compelling product vision and roadmap based on customer and stakeholder input, aligning with customer needs, business goals and engineering capabilities. 
- Strong ability to translate technical features into business value; interface with engineering, operations, legal, security teams as well as executive stakeholders. 
- Able to communicate with empathy to understand pain points for users. 
- An understanding of the use of KPI frameworks (OKRs, success metrics) to drive product outcomes. DORA  
- Ability to collaborate with others to evolve the enterprise data maturity model through data classification, data governance frameworks, and data catalog technologies  
- Good insight into integrating reliability, robustness, resilience, security and scalability into a roadmap, alongside customer features and capabilities. Able to make the right trade-off between technical debt and new features. 

We’d like to see: 
- 2+ years of experience as an infrastructure technical product manager or similar role focused on product development and “go to market” strategies. 
- A strong philosophy of creating reusable, reliable and robust shared services. 
- Experience with automation technologies (i.e. Ansible, Chef, Salt, etc.) for managing infrastructure at scale, as well as resource management technologies (e.g. Kubernetes, OpenStack). 
- Industry/community involvement in databases and data storage, through open source contribution, standards development, academic journals, conference presentations, or the equivalent. 
- Understanding of observability tools for performance monitoring for a variety of user personas. 
- AI-Related Database Technologies & Tools, including but not limited to Vector DBs for RAG, indexing methods, inference, etc. 
- Data lifecycle management techniques and technologies.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Our Team:

Bloomberg’s Legal & Compliance Department plays a critical role in supporting our businesses and operations around the world. We move quickly and thoughtfully to help address a variety of complex issues that come with being the world’s leading financial news and information company. Our team is made up of talented and hardworking legal and compliance professionals who think creatively and work collaboratively in an open environment to deliver results, drive innovation, and solve difficult problems. We are committed to a workplace where all of our employees can thrive regardless of background, and where everyone feels empowered to make an impact. We also recognize the importance of giving back to our communities as evidenced by our award-winning pro bono program!

The Global Compliance, Legal and Risk teams provide coverage of Bloomberg's regulated entities and products, including support for Bloomberg's non-regulated products and services. We work to address regulatory and operational issues, ensure compliance with current/developing rules and regulations, and correspond with regulators. We are currently looking for an experienced individual to work within our Shared Risk and Compliance team.

What's The Role?

As the Global Exam Management and Regulatory Inquiries Officer, you will work with the Global Regulatory Engagement Lead, the Chief Risk Office and Global Compliance teams, and key Business colleagues. Your expertise will be instrumental in leading responses to regulatory examinations and inquiries and to help develop the global regulatory engagement program to ensure a successful outcome for Bloomberg and its regulated entities. In addition, as your understanding of Bloomberg products develops, you will support the firmwide risk management program and have the ability to identify, and escalate top and emerging risks to Senior Management and Risk / Compliance Management.

We'll Trust You To:

- Oversee regulatory examinations and inquiries from London alongside the Global Regulatory Engagement Lead, primarily focused on APAC and EMEA jurisdictions, and manage all aspects of the examination process, including but not limited to, engagement strategy, pre-engagement readiness, on-site reviews, post-engagement closure and lessons learned exercises
- Coordinate the collection and review of relevant documents and information requested
- Partner with subject matter experts to draft responses to regulatory examinations and inquiries, ensuring a consistent and evidence-based narrative
- Prepare senior managers and subject matter experts for interviews and meetings with regulatory examiners
- Collaborate with teams across Bloomberg, including legal, finance, risk, engineering, and the business to ensure alignment and consistency in regulatory responses.
- Maintain regulatory engagement data and prepare and produce management information and reporting on the global regulatory engagement program
- Assist with the development of the global regulatory engagement program, including working with internal stakeholders to develop systems and technology solutions for the program
- Contribute to risk assessment and testing programs to help assess potential regulatory risks and develop strategies to mitigate them
- Proactively monitor dynamic regulatory environment to anticipate impact on Bloomberg and its regulated entities and implement lessons learned strategies

Support the Global Regulatory Engagement Lead and the Head of Risk and Compliance Shared Services, by:

-Strengthening the regulatory exam and inquiries framework
-Presenting directly to senior management on regulatory exams and inquiries
-Managing ad hoc assignments as directed by the Global Regulatory Engagement Lead and Global Head of Shared Risk and Compliance

You’ll Need To Have:

-Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Law, Business or related field; Master’s degree preferred
-10 years* of experience in Regulatory Affairs, Compliance, and/or Risk Management, preferably at a banking or a financial services organization or at a financial services regulator
-Substantial expertise in successfully delivering Regulatory Exams and Inquiries globally across various regulatory regimes
-Understanding of regulatory risk management, internal controls, root cause analysis, financial products, and services
-Strong verbal and written communication skills
-Proven senior stakeholder management skills
-Ability to work in a dynamic environment, building and maintaining a network of contacts, and coordinating with several partners across our company
-Enthusiastic, self-motivated, and effective under pressure
-The ability to work creatively and efficiently, to assist with building a program that’s deeply practical, risk-focused, and conscious of business and control partners’ needs
-Strong team player skills in order to guide organizational change and collaborate with key partners across various levels

*Please note we use years of experience as a guide but we certainly will consider applications from all candidates who are able to demonstrate the skills necessary for the role.

We'd love to see:

-Experience interacting directly with APAC and EMEA regulators
-International experience, especially in Europe or Asia
-Knowledge of financial markets and products including financial technology, trading platforms and operations

If This Sounds Like You:

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this:
https://www.bloomberg.com/company/

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg runs on data. Our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In Data, we are responsible for delivering this data, news and analytics through innovative technology - quickly and accurately. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes - all while providing platinum customer support to our clients.
 
Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) data is increasingly crucial for our clients – providing deeper intelligence than conventional financial analysis alone. Climate change, regulatory pressures, the importance of human capital, and diversity are just a few critical factors global investors consider to best identify emerging risks and opportunities. At Bloomberg, ESG data is displayed alongside fundamental data, backed by news for context, and used to power a growing suite of Sustainable Finance products.

Our Team:
As a team, we are responsible for managing and enhancing ESG-related content for the Bloomberg Terminal and Enterprise products, including company-reported and normalized metrics, key analytical ratios, industry-specific metrics, and proprietary scores. Joining the Data department means that you are a part of one of the world's leading sources of data, providing accurate, immediate insights for financial market professionals. You will enhance your product knowledge, learn about our clients and their needs, and build relationships throughout the company, all while helping our clients integrate ESG risk and opportunity analysis into their workflows.

The Role:
The Sustainable Finance Data team is looking for a highly motivated individual with a passion for sustainable finance, ESG data, quality, and technology to strengthen our data products by driving the implementation of robust data quality strategies and assurance practices. As a Senior Data Management Professional, you will help develop our business outcome-based data strategies to optimize the value of data for our customers and improve data operations. You will apply your problem-solving skills to design and refine quality control processes, ensure data integrity, and support automation of validation workflows to scale effectively. Additionally, you will measure and articulate the impact of your initiatives using business intelligence tools and data quality metrics. This role offers the opportunity to lead global quality initiatives, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and mentor junior colleagues developing in data quality and stewardship.


We’ll trust you to:
  • Define and execute a comprehensive strategy to achieve best-in-class data quality for ESG data, with a strong emphasis on as-reported disclosures and point-in-time accuracy
  • Conduct data profiling and apply statistical analysis to measure, monitor, and enhance data quality across key ESG data sets and products
  • Collaborate with domain experts in Data, as well as colleagues in Product, Enterprise and Engineering, on implementation scalable, data-driven quality solutions
  • Lead initiatives to improve data quality across global datasets, incorporating regional assurance frameworks with a focus on APAC market nuances and local reporting standards
  • Apply a subject matter expertise in as-reported ESG data structures, ensuring accuracy across point-in-time series, disclosure timelines, and evolving regulatory requirements
  • Provide insights and recommendations to enhance decision making capability in business planning, process improvement, and solution management
  • Educate and empower colleagues in industry principles of data quality, in order to elevate awareness, appreciation and application of best practices more broadly
  • Keep up with the industry trends, standards, and innovation in the data quality domain and ESG data standards to continuously refine strategies and maintain competitive edge
  • Work in a fast-paced, multifaceted, and collaborative setting

You’ll need to have:
  • Bachelors degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance, Economics, Environmental Science, or a related field — or equivalent professional qualifications
  • Business proficiency in Korean (written and verbal) as you will cover Korean data content
  • Proficiency in data analysis and profiling using tools including Python, SQL, and PowerBI
  • 4+ years of experience in data analyst or data engineering capacity. For example data management, data quality assurance, or data governance within the finance or technology industry
  • Demonstrated experience developing data quality metrics, reporting frameworks, and governance processes as part of larger data architecture initiatives
  • Demonstrated knowledge of data management principles, including data modeling, ETL processes, and workflow design
  • Foundational understanding of statistics and the ability to interpret data to inform business decisions and craft compelling narratives
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong attention to detail, and effective problem-solving abilities
  • Proven ability to manage multiple global projects in parallel and collaborate effectively with cross-functional stakeholders
  • A strong ability to combine technical skills with business insight to improve data quality and operational outcomes
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skill in English
  • Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organization

We’d love to see:
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of the Sustainable Finance market and sustainability related topics, with preference for experience working with a range of disclosure frameworks and standards, including but not limited to TCFD, ISSB, GRI
  • Experience profiling datasets and coming up with necessary requirements
  • Good understanding of data modeling concepts
  • Experience manipulating and wrangling large datasets
  • Familiarity with use cases of advanced statistical methods such as Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Natural Language Processing
If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are!

Define and execute a comprehensive strategy to achieve best-in-class data quality for ESG data, with a strong emphasis on as-reported disclosures and point-in-time accuracy
Conduct data profiling and apply statistical analysis to measure, monitor, and enhance data quality across key ESG data sets and products
Collaborate with domain experts in Data, as well as colleagues in Product, Enterprise and Engineering, on implementation scalable, data-driven quality solutions

Apply a subject matter expertise in as-reported ESG data structures, ensuring accuracy across point-in-time series, disclosure timelines, and evolving regulatory requirements
Provide insights and recommendations to enhance decision making capability in business planning, process improvement, and solution management
Educate and empower colleagues in industry principles of data quality, in order to elevate awareness, appreciation and application of best practices more broadly
Keep up with the industry trends, standards, and innovation in the data quality domain and ESG data standards to continuously refine strategies and maintain competitive edge
Work in a fast-paced, multifaceted, and collaborative setting
You’ll need to have:
Bachelors degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance, Economics, Environmental Science, or a related field — or equivalent professional qualifications
Business proficiency in Korean (written and verbal) as you will cover Korean data content
Proficiency in data analysis and profiling using tools including Python, SQL, and PowerBI
4+ years of experience in data analyst or data engineering capacity. For example data management, data quality assurance, or data governance within the finance or technology industry

Foundational understanding of statistics and the ability to interpret data to inform business decisions and craft compelling narratives
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong attention to detail, and effective problem-solving abilities
Proven ability to manage multiple global projects in parallel and collaborate effectively with cross-functional stakeholders

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg runs on data. Our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In Data, we are responsible for delivering this data, news and analytics through innovative technology – quickly and accurately. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes - all while providing platinum customer support to our clients.

The Team
The Private Markets & Foundational Data team is responsible for building and maintaining Bloomberg’s core private markets datasets, covering private companies, funds, private credit, securities, deals and transactions and the entities and structures that connect them. The team operates at the intersection of domain expertise, data architecture, and product enablement, supplying authoritative data that is consumed across Bloomberg products, analytics, and client workflows.

Private Markets data is inherently complex and less standardised than public markets data. Company structures evolve quickly, ownership can be opaque, and data must be sourced and reconciled from multiple providers and internal systems. As Bloomberg continues to expand its private markets coverage, the team is focused on modernising data structures, strengthening metadata and semantic alignment, and ensuring that private markets data integrates cleanly into Bloomberg’s broader data ecosystem.

What’s the role?
The Private Markets Data Modeller is responsible for the structural coherence and consistency of data models across all Private Markets datasets. The role ensures that logical data models, field definitions, classifications, and metadata are well designed, aligned, and scalable as coverage grows and new use cases emerge.

Reporting directly to the Head of Private Markets Data, this role works horizontally across the department, partnering with Data, Product, and Engineering teams to guide modelling decisions and resolve inconsistencies. While not directly responsible for building ontologies or knowledge graphs, the role works closely with Bloomberg’s central Semantic Modelling team to ensure that data structures and relationships can be cleanly represented in semantic models and metadata systems.

Day to day, the role combines hands-on data modelling with stakeholder engagement and oversight, translating product and client needs into durable data structures that support downstream analytics, interoperability, and long-term data health.

We’ll trust you to:
  • Create, manage and govern Private Markets data taxonomies and classifications with the goal of fully onboarding and aligning our data in Bloomberg's metadata management systems including semantic models
  • Collaborate with subject matter experts within the Private Markets Product and Data teams to identify relevant client use cases and model datasets to enable alignment within Private Markets Data and across other Bloomberg datasets
  • Update and maintain data implementation configurations and work to align these configurations against taxonomies and classifications
  • Develop and maintain documentation related to design, data model and dictionaries
  • Create tools and processes to monitor and maintain metadata inventories to ensure they are of high quality, timely and accurate
  • Work with counterparts within Data, Product and Engineering to enable implementations that utilize centralized metadata stores and classifications
  • Balance the best of technical and product knowledge to craft solutions for customers
  • Provide mentorship and guidance to junior team members and contribute to their professional development

You’ll need to have:
*We use years of experience as a guide but will consider all candidates who can demonstrate the required skills.
  • 4+ years experience using technical skills such as programming, data modeling, and statistical methods to solve problems
  • Collaboration skills to work across partner groups through Data, Engineering and Product teams across the globe
  • Data design skills for organizing data considering both product need, client usability and engineering objectives
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences
  • Project management skills with the ability to prioritize and adapt to tasks accordingly
  • Demonstrated ability to drive results, meet tight deadlines, and manage multiple priorities and stakeholders

We’d love to see:
  • Exposure to the Bloomberg Terminal, Bloomberg API’s or Enterprise Data products.
  • Solid understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) methodologies.
  • Experience with semantic web technologies and W3C semantic standards.
  • Knowledge of graph technologies and ontology languages and standards such as OWL, RDF, SKOS, and SHACL.
  • Understanding of Data Governance and Data Management, supported by industry certifications (e.g. DAMA CDMP, DCAM, etc.).
  • Familiarity with Private Market Data including but not limited to Private Credit, Companies & Funds

Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are!

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough — we work hard, and we work fast, while keeping up the quality and accuracy we’re known for. It’s what keeps us inventing and reinventing. Our culture is open, collaborative, and focused on elevating one another. Here, you can do incredible work — the kind of work that has a real impact across the company. It’s up to you to make it happen. 

The Team 
The newly established HR Enterprise Enablement and Governance Team sits at the center of the HR Enterprise organization, connecting the dots across Global People Services, Employee Relations, Benefits, Position Management, and Immigration. This team exists to strengthen alignment, create clear ownership for cross-functional priorities, and elevate operational excellence across HR. 

We are the hub that drives shared strategies, consistent execution, and visibility across enterprise-wide initiatives. Our remit spans project management, product oversight, data and insights, and policy/process governance. This team brings together work that touches all areas of HR — ensuring we deliver greater consistency, transparency, and effectiveness. 

What’s the role? 
We’re looking for a highly skilled HR professional who will own the end-to-end lifecycle of HR knowledge and documentation, with a strong focus on content strategy, governance, and digital employee experience. This individual will own the creation, governance, maintenance, and evolution of HR policies, guides, and process documentation, ensuring content remains accurate, scalable, and usable across global HR audiences.

They will ensure HR documentation is structured, searchable, and optimized for digital delivery, including intranet platforms, HR systems, and employee-facing AI tools, with accountability for accuracy, usability, and readiness for cyclical HR events. In addition, this role will define documentation standards, knowledge architecture, and content frameworks used across shared HR platforms to ensure consistency, scalability, and long-term sustainability.

You’ll work across multiple HR groups — including GPS, Benefits, Immigration, Employee Relations, and more — to translate complex HR topics into simple, consistent, and accessible guidance. The ideal candidate brings both HR expertise and strong content development skills, ensuring documentation reflects our standards for accuracy, tone, and usability. 

We’ll trust you to: 
  • Own the full lifecycle of HR documentation, including creation, governance, maintenance, and retirement of policies, process guides, toolkits, and FAQs
  • Translate complex HR, legal, and operational content into clear, actionable guidance designed for employee self-service and digital consumption
  • Partner with HR subject matter experts (HRBPs, GPS, Legal, CoEs) to validate and update content as processes evolve 
  • Create and maintain a documentation governance strategy, including ownership models, version control, review cycles, and approval workflows 
  • Ensure seasonal and cyclical HR events (e.g., performance reviews, compensation cycles, internships, and benefits enrollment) are reviewed and refreshed on a recurring basis 
  • Establish templates and tone standards to drive consistency across HR documentation 
  • Identify content gaps and propose improvements to enhance HR efficiency and the employee experience 
  • Manage documentation integration and accuracy within the employee-facing AI tool to ensure a seamless and intuitive user experience 
  • Advise on optimal documentation solutions and structures for shared HR platforms to enable scalability and ease of navigation 
  • Collaborate with HR Tech and Communications teams to publish and structure content on internal platforms (e.g., intranet, Workday Journeys, knowledge bases) 
  • Maintain an organized, well-structured library of documents with clear taxonomy and metadata for easy access 
You’ll need to have: 
  • 8+ years of experience in HR operations, HR communications and policy documentation, or related HR functions 
  • Proven experience owning documentation governance and content lifecycle management in complex, matrixed organizations
  • Strong understanding of HR processes and lifecycle events, including cyclical activities such as performance management, compensation, benefits enrollment, etc. 
  • Demonstrated experience developing and maintaining content across multiple HR systems or platforms. 
  • Exceptional writing, editing, and organizational skills with a focus on accuracy, clarity, and usability 
  • Ability to collaborate effectively across HR disciplines (HRBPs, GPS, Legal, other CoEs) and influence documentation standards across diverse teams 
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to manage competing priorities, drive accountability, and deliver to deadlines 
  • We’d love to see: 
  • Experience leading or contributing to cross-functional documentation initiatives in a large, global organization 
  • Familiarity with AI tools, digital knowledge bases, or employee self-service platforms and how content interacts within them 
  • Knowledge of content taxonomy, metadata, and search optimization for enterprise documentation 
  • Background in instructional design, UX writing, or change management communications 
  • Comfort creating visual content such as process maps or decision trees to complement written documentation 
We’d love to see: 
  • Experience leading or contributing to cross-functional documentation initiatives in a large, global organization  
  • Familiarity with AI tools, digital knowledge bases, or employee self-service platforms and how content interacts within them  
  • Knowledge of content taxonomy, metadata, and search optimization for enterprise documentation  
  • Background in instructional design, UX writing, or change management communications  
  • Comfort creating visual content such as process maps or decision trees to complement written documentation

  •  Define project scope, goals, timelines, and deliverables in partnership with HR leaders and subject-matter experts
  •  Develop detailed project plans and ensure resources are allocated in line with priorities
  •  Support change-management and communication efforts to ensure smooth adoption of new processes, tools, and ways of working
  •  Analyze outcomes and key metrics to evaluate effectiveness and identify opportunities to streamline or scale
  •  Champion operational excellence by modeling consistent, repeatable project methodologies

  •  Proficiency with project management methodologies and tools (e.g., Smartsheet, MS Project, Jira, Asana)
  •  A flexible, calm, and positive presence under pressure
  •  Ability to quickly understand stakeholder needs and organizational context

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.

As a Talent Delivery Specialist, you are a key employee-facing ambassador of Bloomberg’s Talent team, helping bring our Talent initiatives to life in ways that inspire individual, team, and organizational growth. You will play a pivotal role in connecting employees to meaningful learning experiences by translating strategy into action—making the implicit explicit—and delivering programs that help our employees and leaders develop the skills they need to succeed at Bloomberg.

You’ll work in close collaboration with content leads and program managers to ensure experiences are engaging, scalable, and relevant within the Bloomberg context. Your work will be grounded in a strong understanding of our business and a commitment to continuous improvement, with a focus on delivering high-quality, high-impact experiences.

We'll Trust You To:
Drive a Learning and Growth Culture
  • You understand that development doesn't happen in a vacuum. With a strong appreciation for the 70/20/10 development model, you help employees see how formal learning connects with on-the-job experiences and social learning. You encourage a culture of curiosity and learning agility—promoting openness to new ideas, experimentation, and self-directed growth.
Employee Engagement & Representation
  • Serve as a visible, trusted, and approachable representative of the Talent team. You’ll be the face of our programming—clearly communicating opportunities for growth, fostering employee connection to development, and championing the value of our Talent and Inclusion portfolio in support of career growth at Bloomberg.
Facilitation & Activation
  • Bring our Talent Development portfolio to life for all levels of employees – from those starting out in their careers to senior leaders – by adapting content to reflect Bloomberg’s business culture, employee needs, and real-time dynamics. You’ll create resonance and relevance by tailoring delivery to match the moment—activating development through interactive experiences, relationships, and reflection.
Subject Matter Expertise
  • You’ll bring research-backed insights into your facilitation and interactions, helping participants understand the why behind the what, and reinforcing the practical applicability of content.
Feedback Gathering & Insights Sharing
  • Collect real-time feedback and qualitative insights from program participants, surfacing key themes, sentiment, and potential gaps. You’ll provide a feedback loop—bringing the voice of the employee back to content leads and program managers to inform decisions and fuel program evolution.
Collaboration with Content Leads
  • Work closely with content creators to ensure seamless, high-quality delivery. Share participant observations, engagement patterns, and facilitation feedback to support content refinement and delivery excellence.
Business Partnership & Network Activation
  • Leverage your knowledge of the Bloomberg business and your internal network to position Talent as a critical business enabler. Help connect the dots between development efforts and strategic business goals—surfacing opportunities for programming to deepen its impact.
Continuous Improvement Mindset
  • Embody a mindset of growth and adaptability. You will proactively identify ways to improve delivery, streamline processes, and scale what works—always with the goal of elevating the employee experience and strengthening outcomes.
Facilitate and debrief developmental assessments
  • Use your facilitation and coaching skills to deliver high-quality assessment debriefs e.g. psychometric assessments on a one-to-one basis as well as in group settings, underpinned by certifications where relevant. If you don’t have them already, we’ll support you to get accredited.
You'll Need to Have:
  • 10+ years of progressive experience in learning & leadership development, talent management, or organizational development.
  • Proven track record facilitating programs in areas such as leadership development, change management, diversity & inclusion, communication skills.
  • Demonstrated experience facilitating programs for a diverse range of seniority levels, from entry-level to executive leadership.
  • Strong presence and public speaking abilities underpinned by exceptional interpersonal and communication skills; able to build rapport and establish credibility with participants and stakeholders at all levels, engage both skeptical and enthusiastic learners, manage group dynamics, address challenging questions, and foster active participation.
  • Skilled at using storytelling, real-world examples, and interactive exercises to enhance learning, leveraging a range of facilitation techniques (e.g. brainstorming, role-playing, case studies, simulations).
  • Proven ability to effectively facilitate both small (e.g. workshops, team coaching) and large group sizes.
  • Extensive experience in both in-person and virtual facilitation, demonstrating proficiency with relevant platforms and interactive tools, e.g. breakout rooms, polls, whiteboards, and annotation tools.
  • Track record of successfully adapting facilitation styles and content to resonate with culturally diverse audiences across various geographies.
We'd love to see:
  • Background in coaching (e.g. ICF certification) or experience leading coaching circles/group coaching.
  • Certification in specific assessment tools (e.g. Insights Discovery, CliftonStrengths, Situational Leadership, Hogan).
  • Experience designing or adapting programs using adult learning theory, instructional design frameworks, and learning technologies.
  • Familiarity with enterprise LMS systems.
  • Experience working in complex, matrixed, and/or multinational organizations.
  • Comfort with ambiguity and a fast-paced, evolving organizational environment.
Does This Sound Like You?
Apply if you think we're a match. We'll be in touch to let you know what next steps are.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg News is one of the biggest financial and business news organizations in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis on financial markets, from intraday coverage through to in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time.

The Japanese-language website has been revamped, creating more opportunities than ever for our journalism to reach a broader audience.

We are seeking a reporter to lead coverage of the semiconductor industry and electrical equipment companies. You will collaborate with reporters in Tokyo and other bureaus to jointly produce breaking news and analytical pieces on corporate activities and industry developments.

We'll trust you to:
  • Be passionate about breaking news
  • Be a self-driver with excellent news judgment and the ability to develop sources across the industry as needed to ensure we are competitive on the biggest stories
  • Be persistent and flexible enough to build various types of sources at each company on your beat
  • Use your creativity to spot underlying themes or new trends in the industry
  • Collaborate with colleagues across teams, groups, regions, and platforms, including working hand-in-hand with English-language reporters and editors

You'll need to have:
  • At least 5 years of experience working in business journalism including writing for publication in Japanese
  • A solid understanding of how Japanese companies operate and basic knowledge of the semiconductor industry
  • Passion for career growth and willingness to embrace change
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with various stakeholders
  • A strong work ethic; and the ability to work in a high-pressure environment
  • Fluency in written and spoken Japanese; working level English would be an advantage
  • Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organization

Life at Bloomberg is many things, but it’s never dull. We’re a truly global business with a truly diverse workforce. We pride ourselves on being open, inclusive and collaborative, and provide a work environment that inspires our employees to be their best. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive healthcare coverage, and programs to support you and your family through different life stages, from parental leave to generous retirement savings plans.

If this sounds like you:

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: www.bloomberg.com/professional

Learn more about our office and benefits:

Tokyo | www.bloomberg.com/tokyo

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
At Bloomberg, our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In Data, we’re responsible for delivering this data, news, and analytics through innovative technology - quickly and accurately.

The Content Acquisition (CA) team is an integral part of the Data department. We are responsible for managing, acquiring, and integrating content and data from exchanges, brokers, sell-side, buy-side, and other types of providers to drive the value of the Bloomberg Terminal and downstream enterprise products. We lead the governance, cost, and quality of the data we acquire, and we collaborate with the wider company to develop our data acquisition strategies ensuring we are aligning with the agendas of our key partners.

Within CA, our Client Service team is responsible for acquiring and managing content which is then made available to our client base. For clients, who use Bloomberg daily, having the ability to access this content in one place makes their workflow more efficient and helps them make more informed decisions. For the content providers, being able to deliver their content to a place where their clients actively operate, ensures greater market presence, and returns on their distribution effort.


The Role:

We have an exciting opportunity for an individual to join the Client Service team as a Technical Account Manager, based in the New York office. Your role will be vital in supporting new and existing content partners; you will be handling incoming queries and technical issues, as well as proactively working with our partners to ensure their OTC pricing content is delivered in an accurate, timely and effective manner. To do this, you will need to build strong and lasting relationships with these institutions, have a deep understanding of the technology they use, their goals and challenges and offer outstanding support to them. You will work closely with Relationship Managers and other business areas to set company strategy around contributed content and ensure your account strategy is aligned with it.


We'll Trust you to:

  • Build strong and collaborative relationships with the OTC pricing content providers by having a deep understanding of the technology they use, their data goals and challenges to offer outstanding services
  • Work closely with a global team of motivated account managers, technical specialists, relationship managers and product managers to better understand our clients' data needs and key market trends and develop your account strategy
  • Optimize data ingestion workflows by understanding the data infrastructure internally and externally to help our content providers maintain and improve data quality and optimize content dissemination
  • Become a true domain expert in OTC pricing data by using business intelligence to help spot trends, identify gaps and areas for data acquisition and data content improvements

You'll Need to Have:

  • Exceptional customer service skills, with the ability to handle and prioritize multiple client queries and projects simultaneously
  • Ability to handle and support key accounts, helping them maintain and improve custom systems related to content dissemination
  • Confidence to lead strategic technical and business relationships
  • Drive and passion to develop your own ideas and strategies for your accounts
  • Good interpersonal skills and a desire to work directly with customers
  • A proactive demeanor with the confidence to challenge the status quo and a real desire to improve practices and processes
  • Experience in finding technical solutions to help automate or improve our content partners’ data workflows and find efficiencies, for example improving data creation and distribution capabilities
  • Keen interest and understanding of financial markets, including demonstrated experience of at least one of the asset classes e.g. Equities or Derivatives or Fixed Income etc.

We'd Love to see:

  • Knowledge of FIX Connectivity and the following programming languages: Python, SQL and VBA
  • Experience in using business intelligence to identify gaps and trends, or opportunities for product enhancements
  • Experience in data analytics tools; business intelligence tools or similar
  • Interest in or experience of using data analytical tools to find opportunities for product and content improvements
  • Prior experience working as an Account Manager in a tech-focused organization

Does this sound like you?


Apply! If we believe that you're a good match, we'll get in touch to let you know the next steps.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg LP has built a significant media business spanning television, digital, magazine, radio and live event platforms across the globe. In the midst of a historic time in the media industry, Bloomberg Media is growing its global footprint and reach through new innovations from Bloomberg Originals, Bloomberg TV+, and Bloomberg Businessweek, among others.

We are looking for a Master Control Transmissions Operator to join our Global Broadcast Operations team. We’re looking for someone who takes pride in their work, thrives under high stakes, and brings a calm presence to a fast paced live environment. This is an opportunity to be part of a team that keeps broadcasts running 24/7 and ensuring they are of the highest quality. If you are an expert broadcast professional who thrives in a fast paced, high tech environment, we want to hear from you.

What You’ll Do:

Own the Control Room: Take charge of live broadcast operations, ensuring detailed coordination of guest shots, IFB setup, and routing of all inbound and outbound feeds.

Global Video Management: Be responsible for critical live video signals including Bloomberg Terminal and web streams, maintaining consistent quality and minimal disruptions.

Maintain Broadcast Integrity and Excellence: Partner with internal and external teams globally to ensure broadcast and playback content is transmitted consistently. This includes confirming content is synchronized with the broadcast log. Maintain a high level of technical and communication standards.

Innovate the Transmission Process: Apply innovative technology like Live-U, Fiber/IP solutions and advanced broadcast systems to open up the boundaries of what’s possible in real time news transmission.

What You’ll Bring:
Shown Expertise: You have experience in broadcast operations and live television, preferably within high-pressure environments.

Technical Mastery: You are proficient with industry standard technologies such as Live-U, fiber/IP solutions, RTS panels, satellites and more.

Critical Thinking and Problem Solving: You can troubleshoot and resolve technical issues quickly and accurately under tight deadlines. You have an outstanding eye for detail.

Communication Skills: You can collaborate optimally with all team members including talent, producers, and crew, to keep operations running efficiently.

What’s in it for You:

Work with the Best: Join a global leader in media innovation, collaborating with top talent in broadcast operations, engineering, and production. Your work will have a direct impact on delivering critical, real-time news to a global audience.

Career Growth: With Bloomberg’s global reach, there are endless opportunities to advance, develop new skills, and broaden your expertise across multiple media platforms.

Shape the Future: Be at the forefront of evolving broadcast technology in one of the most multifaceted industries in the world.

Dynamic Environment: You’ll be part of a high-performance culture that values creativity, precision, and continuous improvement.

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or birthing parent/parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

description_html:
Bloomberg Media is looking for an individual with a proactive attitude who is focused, flexible, and proficient in several aspects of broadcast operations, and who can work collaboratively in a live control room and studio environment in a jib camera operator capacity. They will be required to work with operations, on-air talent, engineering, and editorial teams, as well as their global counterparts to ensure a high-quality visual production on a part-time basis. 

We'll trust you to: 
• Participate in pre-show meetings with editorial and technical teams to align show vision. 
• Move quickly and accurately under pressure in a fast-paced broadcast environment. 
• Collaborate with the technical team and editorial personnel to ensure a quality visual presentation to our audience 
• Read, follow, and execute all relevant tasks outlined in a live news broadcast rundown 
• Operate and frame a 9ft Jimmy Jib Triangle Pro camera in a studio space for a 3-hour production. 
• Communicate with Team Leads to report on issues and faults that will impact global counterparts. 
• Be able to assist in the lifting of set pieces up to 50 lbs. 

 You'll need to have: 
• Bachelor’s degree or 2 year of experience working in a live TV environment 
• Experience with multicamera robotic systems in a fast-paced live show environment 
• Experience with operating a 9ft jib underslung in a studio space 
• Experience with Sony HDC Cameras • Ability to follow a live rundown (knowledge of ENPS preferred but not required) and ability to adapt to adjustments in real time • Flexibility to work early mornings and weekends 
• Strong organizational + communication skills & attention to detail 
If this sounds like you, apply today! We're eager to speak with you.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
What's the role? 

You'll be the primary technical interface into Bloomberg for some of our largest clients, the trusted advisor they turn to when making major technology and data sourcing decisions. You'll form deep, lasting partnerships at multiple levels, and serve as the advocate for your customer within Bloomberg as well as the advocate for Bloomberg with your customer. 

 As a member of the Technical Account Management (TAM) team you will collaborate closely with your colleagues across our Enterprise Data and Enterprise Services divisions. You'll enable our customers to gain maximum benefit from their partnership with Bloomberg by creating joint strategy sessions focused on the evolution of their technology and how our products and services become integral to their journey. Through listening to our client’s needs and investing heavily in our products and people, we have reached a genuinely exciting point in the evolution of our delivery and content offerings. Driving organizational & technology change across both client and internal environments needs to be a core part of your wheelhouse. You need to enjoy planning, strategy and co-designing solutions with clients. 

Ideally, you will have honed these skills in pre-sales, management consulting or professional services. Your skills will be vital in helping clients become comfortable with our offerings, working closely with Sales to achieve this. Your strong understanding of our clients and their use of our products will also enable you in providing input to our product management teams, helping shape the future direction of our products. 

 
We'll trust you to: 

Handle pre-sales duties by: 

•  Partnering with the account team, including Sales and Product Specialists, to identify and provide technical qualification of sales opportunities 

•  Understanding client technical strategy and roadmap, matching Bloomberg solutions to requirements 

•  Providing design and analysis on proposed requirements for implementing and supporting new products based upon a thorough analysis of client feedback 

 
Project Management needs to be second nature: 

•  Forming a comprehensive and achievable integration plan in collaboration with clients for integration into target applications across multiple regions 

•  Leading the engagement, leveraging the necessary internal resources to ensure a successful delivery of the agreed solution 

 
Manage assigned accounts effectively by: 

•  Developing account plans with clear goals against which you will execute 

•  Building and maintaining a strategic relationship with your client base with frequent interactions to ensure you have a strong pulse on client’s technical activities and future plans 

•  Providing technical subject matter expertise across the Enterprise Data Technology product portfolio 

•  Ensuring a consistent, cohesive and comprehensive level of service delivery into your accounts, including but not limited to leading steering committee and regular service review meetings 

•  Forging deep relationships across the client's technology teams within both the vertical IT and business silos (Equities, FICC etc.) and horizontal functions (CTO, Architecture, Infrastructure, Sourcing etc.) 

•  Attaining a deep and extensive understanding of your client's architecture, infrastructure and application environment 

 
You’ll need to have: 

•  Experience in a client facing role in financial services or a financial technology company 

•  Knowledge of financial market data products, delivery services, APIs and protocol technologies 

•  Experience working in a consultative sales or strategic account management role where you have been a part of or led client engagement 

•  Pre-sales experience and commercial awareness 

•  A passion for data delivery, content analysis and as much attention to detail as the ability to look at the bigger picture 

•  Demonstrable experience in leading a technology engagement or in taking a technical product to market 

•  Curiosity with a track record of challenging yourself in roles, technology and learning 

•  An ability to express your career diversity and passion for success 

•  An ability to build senior relationships and leverage those relationships to expand footprint 

•  Awareness of trading applications and systems 

•  Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organisation 

•  Strong presentation and communication skills in English 

•  The ability to travel

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through teamwork. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do outstanding work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.
Our Team
 Bloomberg’s Risk, Legal, & Compliance Departments play a critical role in supporting our businesses and operations around the world. We move quickly and thoughtfully to help address a variety of complex issues that come with being the world’s leading financial news and information company. Our team is made up of talented and hardworking professionals who think creatively and work collaboratively in an open environment to deliver results, drive innovation, and solve difficult problems. We also recognize the value of diversity and inclusion and the importance of giving back to our communities, as evidenced by our award-winning pro bono program.
 The Global Risk and Compliance Shared Services (RCSS) team provides coverage of Bloomberg's regulated entities and products, including support for Bloomberg's non-regulated products and services. We work to address regulatory issues, ensure compliance with current and developing rules and regulations, and correspond with regulators. We are currently enhancing our Risk Assurance and Testing Oversight (RATO) team and seeking an experienced professional to work with our Global Head of RATO.
What's The Role?
 As a Risk Assurance and Controls Testing Officer on our RATO team, you will collaborate with Risk colleagues and key Legal, Compliance, Audit, and Business partners to deliver a comprehensive controls testing program. The role includes enhancing standards around risk assurance and controls testing activities, as well as annual planning, development of testing scopes, testing of controls, and reporting of testing results. Responsibilities also include managing and tracking issues identified. You and the RATO team will be responsible for centralizing, enhancing, and globalizing these disciplines in a manner that builds on the work done by current Risk Management subject matter experts in each country and region.
We'll Trust You To
  * Support the Global Head RCSS, the global Chief Compliance Officer, the global Chief Risk Officer, and Bloomberg’s business by:
  * Acting as a global thought-leader and team player on risk assurance
  * Enhancing standards and risk management best practices around assurance and controls testing, including through tools, automation, and artificial intelligence
  * Coordinating or conducting relevant controls testing on a risk-focused basis
  * Managing stakeholders throughout the assurance lifecycle
  * Presenting directly to senior management on results
  * Managing ad hoc assignments as directed by the Global Head of RATO
You'll Need To Have
  * 10+ years of experience in Compliance, Audit, and/or Risk Management within regulated financial institutions or technology companies
  * Expertise in risk assurance, controls testing, and associated control remediation
  * Understanding of regulatory and operational risk management, internal controls, and root cause analysis
  * Strong verbal and written communication skills
  * Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment, build and maintain networks, and coordinate with multiple partners
  * Self-motivated and effective under pressure
  * Ability to design practical, risk-focused programs aligned with business and control partner needs
  * Strong collaboration skills to drive organizational change and influence across levels
We'd Love To See
  * Strong background in data governance, management, and quality
  * Understanding of central functions and corporate services, such as supply chain management
  * Knowledge of financial markets and products, including electronic trading platforms and related operations
  * Proven track record in information security, technology risk, and operational resilience
  * Hands-on work automating control testing regimes using advanced analytics and artificial intelligence
  * Expertise in designing and implementing key control indicators
  * Proficiency with QSEN or comparable dashboards for monitoring risk and controls
