title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The Base Layers team is responsible for designing, building, and operating a composable image build platform to derive secure, tested operating system and container images for Bloomberg's managed fleet. Our platform is the foundation for a variety of large-scale, mission-critical workflows, ensuring all machines and container workloads start from a verified, secure state.


Our stack leverages best-in-class open source technologies for infrastructure automation, CI/CD, and workflow orchestration. We focus on deep systems engineering, large-scale distributed architecture, and software development, with a strong emphasis on Linux and security hardening.


What You’ll Work On


  • Image Pipeline Design and Implementation – Architecting and building a composable, highly-reliable image and container base image building pipeline for both on-prem and cloud environments.

  • Secure Baselines and Hardening – Defining, implementing, and enforcing secure operating system and container baselines, including CIS-aligned controls, to reduce the attack surface across the fleet.

  • Tooling and Automation – Developing custom automation frameworks and developer-facing APIs on top of open source projects to streamline the image creation and testing lifecycle.

  • Provenance and Supply-Chain Security – Implementing image lineage, asset tracking, and SBOM generation to provide traceability across the image lifecycle and strengthen supply-chain security.

  • Testing and Verification – Integrating automated testing into the pipeline to ensure all derived images are fully tested, verified, and ready for deployment.

  • Image Visibility and Consumer Interfaces – Building user-facing tools and web interfaces to allow consumers to inspect base image states, metadata, provenance, and compatibility, enabling informed adoption and derivation decisions.

  • Upstream OSS Contributions – Collaborating with the broader open source community to enhance the tooling we rely on.


Why Join Us


  • Solve hard problems at scale: performance tuning, orchestration of massive workloads, and automation of global fleets.

  • Work in a hybrid environment that blends systems reliability engineering with software development.

  • See your work impact thousands of developers across Bloomberg and developers worldwide through open source.

  • Bring strong engineering principles and informed tool recommendations, helping evolve the platform for the benefit of the product and its users.

  • Be part of a team that values deep technical curiosity, collaborative problem-solving, and bold thinking.


What You’ll Need


  • 4+ years of professional software engineering experience working with an object-oriented programming language (Python, C/C++, Java, etc.)

  • A degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar field of study or equivalent work experience

  • Strong Linux/Unix systems background, including deep understanding of operating system internals, hardening, and configuration.

  • Experience designing and operating highly-available, large-scale systems.

  • Familiarity with foundational security concepts related to OS baselines and layers.

  • Familiarity with containerization technologies (Docker, Podman, Kubernetes, etc.) and their security implications.

  • A collaborative, pragmatic approach to problem-solving and building scalable solutions.


We’d love to see


  • Experience with image building systems (e.g., Packer, Kairos, or similar tools) and CI/CD platforms (e.g., Jenkins or equivalents).

  • Hands-on experience with configuration management, orchestration, or workflow systems (e.g., Chef, Ansible, Salt, Airflow or equivalents) in production environments.

  • Experience defining and enforcing secure operating system baselines or container layers.

  • Experience with one or more programming languages used for systems or product development (e.g., Go, React, Typescript, Ruby).

  • Experience contributing to or maintaining open source projects.

  • Strong interest in testing, observability, and reliability engineering practices.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg Marketing partners with forward-looking business leaders to seize and build opportunities and to drive difference. We use data to understand markets and audiences and creative ideas to build stories and brands. We build campaigns and work that captures attention and drives a reaction. We move fast, and our core approach is integrated and disruptive.

The Global Event Team is part of Marketing and is responsible for the strategy, planning and management of events for our clients, prospects, influencers and employees. We partner across Marketing and with our internal stakeholders globally to create events that provide our attendees with an enriched and integrated Bloomberg experience. The power of our data enables us to target the right audience at the right time to achieve the strongest outcomes.


What’s the role?
You will partner with the marketing and sales teams to develop, plan, execute and measure all events (virtual, hybrid and in person) across all Bloomberg businesses in the APAC region.


What will you do in this role?
You will work closely with the business to develop and implement strategic event programs that are targeted at our audiences and integrated with other marketing tactics. You will partner with internal marketing partners to ensure that our events are creative and coordinated with the various digital and social platforms. You will also ensure relevant post event analysis is done so that we can measure our events effectively which in turn will influence future decisions.

You will use the event production tools, platforms and programs within Bloomberg to deliver flawless virtual, hybrid and in-person events. You will manage the creative process, including invites, event production, audio visual requirements, speaker management, show calling, overall logistics and post event administration.

As many of our event programs have a virtual element, you will be expected to execute our virtual events on the chosen platform. You will also be expected to lead domestic and international projects with multiple stakeholders (across different geos and businesses) from inception to delivery. You will be encouraged to make sound independent decisions consistent with business.


Who are we looking for?
You have extensive experience with creating, planning and executing multi-faceted, complex integrated events (virtual, hybrid and in-person) within a company or agency, excellent project management skills, strong communication skills, and ability to present to all levels of management.


You’ll need to have:
  • At least 6+ years of events experience (either in an in-house corporate or agency)
  • Extensive experience planning and executing virtual and in person events across APAC.
  • Experience in providing event program strategic mentorship, including target audience experience mapping, event portfolio analysis and integration with other marketing tactics
  • Tech savvy: You always have your finger pulse of the latest technology and competitive trends.
  • Experience in integrating digital and social media tactics into key event programs and advocating for an integrated event experience approach
  • Ability to collaborate effectively across teams, regions and with vendors
  • Ability to multi-task in a time-pressured environment
  • Proficiency in written and spoken English. Highly articulate, polished, and able to present to all levels of management


We’d love to see:
  • Previous experience with tools like Eloqua, Notified Wordpress, Meeting Pulse, Cvent
  • Additional APAC language (Mandarin and/or Korean)


If this sounds like you:
Apply! We'll be in touch with next steps if you're a fit!


*Contract will be administered by third-party vendor as a dispatched worker arrangement with Bloomberg.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg runs on data, and in the Data team we're responsible for acquiring it, providing it to our clients and helping draw significant insights out of it. We collect, analyze, process, and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal and our Enterprise products - the facts and figures which ultimately move the financial markets. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to improve our systems, products, and processes - and all this while providing platinum customer support to clients.

Our Team:
The Portfolios Account Management Team sits within the Managed Investments & Benchmark division of the Data Department. As a team, we are responsible for sourcing proprietary portfolio holdings information, normalizing it and making it available within the Bloomberg Terminal and Enterprise products.
We source this information through establishing and maintaining strong relationships with fund houses globally, and other content partners in the funds industry. Within the Portfolios Account Management Team, we help our clients make quicker and more informed decisions by empowering them with the right tools to analyze holdings and provide them with visibility over the underlying investment of funds.

Joining the Data department means that you are a part of one of the world's leading sources of data, providing accurate, immediate insights for financial market professionals. You will enhance your product knowledge, work closely with our clients and understand their needs, and build relationships throughout the company, all while helping our clients get access to a market leading fund data platform.

What’s the role?
Bloomberg’s Portfolios Account Management Team is looking for a Senior Technical Account Manager to join its growing team. As part of the team, you will be responsible for building strong relationships with fund houses, engaging with them regularly, and sourcing their portfolio holdings. Your focus will be on APAC, where you will be responsible for a list of accounts, covering all fund types from Mutual Funds to ETPs. You will engage with fund houses, regulators and various other parties to ensure high visibility over their portfolio holdings.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight, and we use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. And, to ensure the best experience for our 20,000+ employees across 176 offices globally, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are.

We are looking for a dynamic and enthusiastic Executive Administrative Assistant to join our New York office, supporting a Senior leader in the Americas. If you thrive in a fast-paced and challenging environment, are highly proactive and organized, and excel at multi-tasking while managing shifting priorities, we would love to speak with you.

As the Executive Administrative Assistant, you will develop strong working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders, exercise sound judgment in a variety of situations, and demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills.

We’ll trust you to:

- Manage a broad range of administrative responsibilities, including travel itineraries, calendar management, expense processing, and maintaining accurate contact and organizational information
- Coordinate logistics for leadership meetings, events, and on-site activities, including collaboration with office operations and business partners
- Be forward-thinking by anticipating leaders’ needs
- Identify opportunities to improve efficiency and implement process enhancements proactively
- Interface professionally with all levels of employees, clients, and external guests
- Exercise discretion and maintain confidentiality at all times
- Prioritize competing demands and handle matters expeditiously, ensuring follow-through and successful completion of projects, often under tight deadlines

You’ll need to have:

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
- Strong problem-solving abilities with strategic and creative thinking
- Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills
- Comfort working in a fast-paced, “open door” office environment

We’d love to see:

- 5+ years of Executive Assistant experience supporting senior leaders
- Prior experience supporting Sales or commercial leadership
- Experience within financial services, media, or a global corporate environment

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg News is one of the biggest financial and business news organizations in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis of financial markets and big business, from daily coverage through to in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It's what keeps us inventing and re-inventing.

We're looking for a sharp and dynamic reporter to join our Asia Business team in Seoul, with a focus on corporate coverage. South Korea is home to some of Asia's most innovative companies, spanning industries from large-scale batteries to biotech and skincare.

Korea is navigating a series of significant economic shifts driven by demographic challenges, technological transformation and global market dynamics. The country’s rapidly aging population and declining birth rate are putting pressure on the labor market and long-term economic growth. In response, Korea is increasingly investing in automation, AI and robotics to maintain productivity.

From Hyundai Motor, one of the world's largest automobile manufacturers, to EV battery makers LG Energy and SK On and consumer goods powerhouses like Lotte, Amorepacific and APR, we're looking for someone who can bring the K-story to an international audience at a time when the country's influence on the world stage has never been greater.

We're particularly interested in a candidate who can deliver stories across the spectrum, from scoops and fast-paced breaking news to quick turnaround analysis and long-term features, while working collaboratively with other teams. Multimedia experience and data analysis skills are a plus, though not a requirement. Bloomberg reporters are expected to contribute to visual and audio platforms as well, while data-led journalism has always been a signature of the newsroom.

We'll trust you to:
  • Build a deep corporate network and accurately and independently break news
  • Work with editors to develop ideas while bringing your own perspective to add depth and value
  • Use data analysis to identify exclusive story ideas and innovate with story formats while promoting diversity of thought and representation throughout our coverage
  • Build relationships across the newsroom to ensure our coverage captures the context of local developments while resonating with global audiences

You'll need to have:
  • At least 3 years of recent experience in business journalism
  • Experience working in a real-time news environment with demonstrable success
  • Fluency in both written and spoken English and Korean
  • Write quickly under pressure, with precision and style
  • An ability to cover a local beat but also see the big picture, especially with regard to the macro environment in Asia
  • Flexibility and a love of fast-paced working environments and constant change 


Life at Bloomberg is many things, but it’s never dull. We’re a truly global business with a truly diverse workforce. We pride ourselves on being open, inclusive and collaborative, and provide a work environment that inspires our employees to be their best. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive healthcare coverage, and programs to support you and your family through different life stages, from parental leave to generous retirement savings plans.

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional

Learn more about our office and benefits:

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg Market Specialists provide practical guidance and industry expertise across markets to help clients maximize the value of their investments in our solutions and serve as their voice back to Bloomberg
.
For Bloomberg clients globally, who are positioning for a competitive edge across diverse markets and industry change, Bloomberg Market Specialists provide a practical and impartial view of the best practices, tools and workflows needed to take on intricate situations.

Armed with our partnership and expertise, clients can maximize the business value from their investment in Bloomberg solutions. Unlike similar teams at other vendors, Bloomberg Market Specialists have deep institutional knowledge about client workflows as the team partners with clients from pre-sale to present day to the future.

The Bloomberg Market Specialist team backs this up through being:
  • Asset Class or Workflow-Focused
  • Experienced
  • Client Centric
  • Future Oriented

Comprised of former traders, portfolio managers, sales representatives, analysts, and more, the team also plays a vital role in improving the knowledge of our sales force and are a dedicated source of client feedback for our product development teams.


We'll trust you to:
  • Apply your strong market experience, detailed knowledge of industry trends, and demonstrated technical skills to assist in generating revenue for our terminal business and suite of Enterprise solutions
  • Act in an advisory capacity to our clients concerning the challenges that they face and how they can use our products and technology to address them
  • Develop an in-depth understanding of the competitor landscape and how this affects both internal and external customers
  • Influence the direction of Bloomberg products through thought leadership, contribution to innovative ideas, and establishing relationships between Bloomberg's decision-makers and our clients
  • Establish your own roadmap of initiatives that align with the company's product, sales, and goals.
  • Maintain check-in points and self-report successes and challenges on these strategies
  • Participate actively in new projects that drive departmental and firm-wide initiatives and goals
  • Seek out additional ways to make an impact, such as mentoring, involvement in training, running campaigns, and active involvement in product enhancement


You'll need to have:
  • Extensive experience in equities either as an Analyst, or Portfolio Manager
  • A minimum of 10 years of practical experience working across financial services
  • A sound understanding of Fundamental Analysis: financial statements & ratios and company valuation metrics & models
  • Practical experience using the terminal, or similar product, and applicable asset class functionality
  • The business insight required to use your knowledge & experience to make good judgement and quick decisions to tangibly impact the commercial success of our business
  • Proven consultative sales skills, including competitive market research, lead generation, prospecting, business development and closing sales
  • The ability to convey complex ideas and solutions in a simple and concise way to audiences both large and small
  • A willingness to travel across EMEA (6-9 nights a month) as required in order to provide clients with a premier service
  • Outstanding presentation, training and communication skills in English


We’d love to see:
  • Fluency in one or more European language
  • An entrepreneurial & commercial mind set with the ability to identify and develop opportunities - for other groups within the company and to build strong external networks
  • Experience of python, capable of writing basic applications and discussing the process of building data-driven products
  • CFA charter-holder and/or MBA


What’s it like to work here?
We work hard. We are ambitious and set ourselves tough business goals. We are a meritocracy where everyone has a voice - not a job title! Working with people you trust, respect, and can collaborate with is more meaningful than titles or position. Things adapt quickly, and we want people who will enjoy working in this environment and feed off the energy. But it isn’t all about work. Giving back is one of our core values, and there are many ways to get involved in philanthropic initiatives from helping local school kids with their reading to helping clean up local parks and waterways.


If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg’s Multi-Asset Risk System (MARS) offers a comprehensive suite of risk management tools that delivers consistent, consolidated results across our clients entire firm. MARS is powered by Bloomberg’s world-class pricing library, market data and mortgage cash flow engine enables front office, risk, middle office, collateral managers and other financial professionals to analyze their trading and investment portfolios, manage and mitigate their exposure and ready themselves for any turn of events.


What's the role?

Bloomberg’s Risk Account Managers play an ever-increasing important role in the sustainability, branding and development of the MARS franchise. As a MARS account manager, you will be part of a dedicated portfolio risk sales team and expected to maximize customer retention and identify growth opportunities. You will be leading the vendor-client partnership, documenting customers’ business model and technological requirements for each business line / asset class [vertical] and monitoring how Bloomberg’s solutions are integrated with customers’ technology stack [horizontal]. Throughout your extensive interaction with our clients, you will be expected to identify market trends, competitor landscape and technological improvements, helping sales and product management teams reviewing long-term strategy and vision.


We'll trust you to:

- Strategically look across your coverage to determine gaps in client’s workflow to expand and deepen their usage of our Risk and derivatives Valuations solutions as well as across all Buyside Enterprise Solutions(AIM/PORT/RMS)

- Proactively find and monitor at-risk customers to defend the Bloomberg business

- Manage up-selling campaigns, both self-initiated to achieve business targets and management driven initiatives

- Articulate the features and benefits of Bloomberg enterprise level products in great detail, so that you can act as a partner for your customers.

- Contribute innovative ideas that anticipate, and address client needs

- Participate actively in new projects that drive the buy-side business and firm-wide initiatives

- Seek out additional ways to demonstrate leadership and make an impact, such as mentoring, involvement in training, running campaigns, and active involvement in product enhancement

You'll need to have:

- Previous account management experience buy-side risk management with an ambition and aptitude to move to a client facing role

- Consultative sales approach and experience building relationships with customers

- Excellent interpersonal skills

- Exemplary presentation, training and communication skills in English

- The ability for regular travel

- Good understanding of the global buy-side risk regulatory landscape

We’d love to see:

- Demonstrated experience on Enterprise risk solutions including API

- Passion about FinTech & RiskReg and curious about new business and technological trends

- Professional working proficiency of an additional European language

MARS is powered by Bloomberg’s world-class pricing library, market data and mortgage cash flow engine enables front office, risk, middle office, collateral managers and other financial professionals to analyze their trading and investment portfolios, manage and mitigate their exposure and ready themselves for any turn of events.
What's the role?
Bloomberg’s Risk Account Managers play an ever-increasing important role in the sustainability, branding and development of the MARS franchise. As a MARS account manager, you will be part of a dedicated portfolio risk sales team and expected to maximize customer retention and identify growth opportunities. You will be leading the vendor-client partnership, documenting customers’ business model and technological requirements for each business line / asset class [vertical] and monitoring how Bloomberg’s solutions are integrated with customers’ technology stack [horizontal]. Throughout your extensive interaction with our clients, you will be expected to identify market trends, competitor landscape and technological improvements, helping sales and product management teams reviewing long-term strategy and vision.
We'll trust you to:
- Strategically look across your coverage to determine gaps in client’s workflow to expand and deepen their usage of our Risk and derivatives Valuations solutions as well as across all Buyside Enterprise Solutions(AIM/PORT/RMS)
- Proactively find and monitor at-risk customers to defend the Bloomberg business
- Manage up-selling campaigns, both self-initiated to achieve business targets and management driven initiatives
- Articulate the features and benefits of Bloomberg enterprise level products in great detail, so that you can act as a partner for your customers.
- Contribute innovative ideas that anticipate, and address client needs
- Participate actively in new projects that drive the buy-side business and firm-wide initiatives
- Seek out additional ways to demonstrate leadership and make an impact, such as mentoring, involvement in training, running campaigns, and active involvement in product enhancement
You'll need to have:
- Previous account management experience buy-side risk management with an ambition and aptitude to move to a client facing role
- Consultative sales approach and experience building relationships with customers
- Excellent interpersonal skills
- Exemplary presentation, training and communication skills in English
- The ability for regular travel
- Good understanding of the global buy-side risk regulatory landscape
We’d love to see:
- Demonstrated experience on Enterprise risk solutions including API
- Passion about FinTech & RiskReg and curious about new business and technological trends
- Professional working proficiency of an additional European language

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg News is one of the biggest financial and business news organizations in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis on financial markets, from daily coverage through to in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It’s what keeps us inventing and re-inventing, all the time.

Bloomberg News is looking for an ambitious reporter to help drive our coverage of energy in the Middle East. The region occupies a crucial position in the global energy system, from the key role of Gulf countries in OPEC production and policy, to the surge in LNG investment by Middle East companies both at home and abroad. Oil and gas form the backbone of economic growth in the region, putting this industry at the center of power and influence in a fast-evolving global financial hub.

You will be expected to bring or develop a deep network of sources and extensive subject expertise, to deliver impactful scoops, insightful analysis and deeply reported features that lift the lid on the key companies, personalities and trades across the energy landscape.

This role can be based in Riyadh, Doha or Dubai.

We'll trust you to:

  • Build and maintain sources across the most important energy companies, traders, policymakers and investors active in the Middle East
  • Break news and deliver scoops that Bloomberg readers care about
  • Collaborate closely with colleagues across teams and geographies to write the biggest, agenda-setting stories that connect the dots on the interplay between energy, business, geopolitics and finance
  • Help contribute to our authoritative coverage of OPEC and OPEC+ and how the group's decisions impact global energy markets
  • Be an expert on the Middle East energy beat, using your deep knowledge and sourcing to spot trends and deliver the most impactful information to our readers

You'll need to have:

  • At least five years of experience as a reporter covering financial news
  • A proven track record of cultivating sources and breaking news
  • Strong writing skills, with the ability to write quickly, clearly and accurately under deadline pressure

We'd love to see:

  • Fluency in Arabic is preferred
  • Ability to translate complex issues into clear, compelling journalism for a global audience
  • Prior reporting experience in the Middle East or another geopolitically sensitive region
  • A clear understanding of how energy intersects with geopolitics, fiscal policy and regional power dynamics
  • The confidence to lead coverage during major market-moving events and periods of volatility

Life at Bloomberg is many things, but it’s never dull. We’re a truly global business with a truly diverse workforce. We pride ourselves on being open, inclusive and collaborative, and provide a work environment that inspires our employees to be their best. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive healthcare coverage, and programs to support you and your family through different life stages, from parental leave to generous retirement savings plans.

If this sounds like you:

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
At Bloomberg, our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In the Data division, we’re responsible for delivering this data, news, and analytics through innovative technology - quickly and accurately.


The Green Markets team provides critical data and insights including current product prices, market sentiment reports, and macro analysis on a variety of commodity markets. Green Markets’ analysts are industry renowned for their subject matter expertise and superior market research. By creating market transparency, Green Markets enables market participants to make more informed decisions.


Our team has an exciting opportunity for a US Plastic Resins Pricing Analyst. Your product focus areas in this role are Polyethylene “PE” (LDPE, LLDPE, HDPE); Polypropylene “PP”; Polyethylene terephthalate “PET”; Polystyrene “PS” and Expanded Polystyrene “EPS”; Polyvinyl chloride “PVC”.


We'll Trust You to:

  • Continually develop and manage a network of industry participants representing buyers and sellers of plastic resins
  • Regularly engage with and gather data from market participants to develop proprietary plastics resins price assessments for key US regional markets
  • Source market sentiment information, react to feedback from clients and company collaborators, and manage ad-hoc projects that are part of the overall product strategy
  • Uncover market trends and developments and synthesize this information to develop proprietary intelligence for use by a variety of market constituents
  • Develop high quality written market analysis on a weekly basis and contribute to regular communications of significant market events
  • Use your industry and market knowledge to play a central part in product marketing and sales

You'll Need to Have:

  • 3+ years of professional experience in analyzing, buying or selling plastics resins
  • Expert understanding of plastic resins and downstream products’ pricing dynamics, influences and mechanisms
  • Credible contacts in the plastics resins market and/or a strong understanding of the companies operating in this industry, including imported products
  • Superlative communication, interpersonal, networking and relationship development skills
  • Analytical and information gathering skills combined with the ability to develop conclusions on market pricing trends
  • A high level of motivation and strong work ethic
  • Bachelors degree minimum

We'd Love to See:

  • A passion for understanding the nuances of the global plastics industry
  • Interest in continuous learning and expanding industry knowledge base
  • Ability to assimilate and transform gathered market intelligence into narrative market reporting

Does this sound like you?


Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The Role:

Bloomberg Electronic Markets is seeking a Team Leader (TL) to lead our Rates Product group, spanning Interest Rate Derivatives, Government Bonds, Mortgages, Money Markets and Repo. This is a senior people-leader role with responsibility for shaping product strategy, developing talent, and advocating for the Rates business across Bloomberg and the broader industry.

As a Team Leader, you will manage and mentor a team of experienced Product Managers, empowering them to define and execute strategies across the Rates product suite. You will foster a high-performance, collaborative culture while helping individuals grow their impact, skills, and careers. Working closely with Engineering, Sales, Trading Solutions, and senior stakeholders, you will translate market structure evolution and client needs into a clear product vision and roadmap.

In this role, you will also serve as the senior representative of Bloomberg’s Rates business, engaging directly with key clients, industry participants, regulators, and senior Bloomberg leadership. You will help communicate product strategy, gather market insight, and ensure Bloomberg remains a trusted and influential partner in the evolving electronic trading landscape.

We’ll Trust You To:

• Lead, coach, and develop a team of Product Managers, with a strong focus on talent development, accountability, and career progression
• Set strategic direction for the Rates product suite and ensure alignment with broader Electronic Markets business objectives
• Secure and allocate engineering resources to deliver top priority product deliveries
• Engage directly with key clients, senior industry professionals, regulators, and senior Bloomberg leadership to represent product strategy and gather market insight
• Advocate for the Rates business internally and externally, balancing client needs, regulatory considerations, and commercial priorities
• Collaborate with senior stakeholders across Engineering, Sales, and Trading Solutions to define priorities and drive execution
• Build a culture of ownership, collaboration, and continuous improvement across the team
• Anticipate market and regulatory trends and guide the team in building innovative tools that meet current and future clients’ needs

You’ll Need to Have:
• 10+ years’ experience in Financial Technology with previous leadership experience
• Proven understanding of financial markets, investment management
• Domain expertise in Interest Rate Products and workflows
• Experience with business processes including Electronic Trading, Trade Capture, Pricing, Risk, P&L/Accounting and Regulatory
• Detail-oriented and deep analytical skills, being able to find patterns and communicate them effectively
• Excellent written and oral communication skills
• Excellent presentation skills including written, graphical, and verbal
• Strong credibility with clients, industry participants, regulators, and internal leadership

We’d Love to See:
• Highly motivated leader who works well across various internal groups and teams
• Strong sense of ownership, prioritization, and delivery in fast-paced environments

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.

What’s the Role?
At Bloomberg Finance we are committed to providing world-class support to our business partners by providing insight on business performance, financial oversight and thought leadership.

We are seeking a Senior Finance Specialist to support Bloomberg’s Buyside business, partnering closely with senior stakeholders to drive strategic insight, decision-making, and execution. This role sits at the intersection of finance, strategy, and data, requiring a proactive self-starter who thrives in ambiguity and can translate complex datasets into clear, actionable insights.

The successful candidate will act as a trusted advisor, using financial and commercial acumen to influence outcomes, identify opportunities, and support the continued growth and evolution of Bloomberg’s Buyside offering.

We’ll Trust You To:
• Serve as a strategic finance partner to the Buyside leadership team, providing insight and challenge to support key business decisions
• Analyze complex financial and operational data to identify trends, risks, and opportunities, delivering succinct and impactful insights
• Drive initiatives end-to-end, from problem definition through analysis to execution and follow-through
• Operate effectively in ambiguous and fast-moving environments, bringing structure, clarity, and direction
• Develop clear narratives and recommendations for senior stakeholders, distilling complexity into actionable outcomes
• Take ownership of ad hoc strategic projects, proactively identifying areas for improvement or growth
• Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Sales, Engineering, and other Finance teams to ensure alignment and impact

You'll Need to Have
• 7+ years of financial experience
• Bachelor’s degree in Finance or related fields
• Experience partnering with senior business partners to assist in decision making
• Ability to work with large amounts of data, while succinctly summarizing conclusions for management
• Outstanding verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
• Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize multiple tasks are required
• Flexibility to work in a fast-moving environment
• Superior Microsoft Excel skills (VBA a plus)
• Team player with ability to deal with changing priorities

We'd Love to See:
• Experience in financial services or a financial data provider industry a strong plus
• Flexibility to work in an entrepreneurial and fast-moving environment
• High curiosity level and desire to learn
• Familiarity with the Bloomberg terminal is useful, but not required
• Experience with Enterprise software applications e.g. SAP
• Experience with data visualization applications e.g. Tableau or Qlik

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight, and we use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. To ensure the best experience for our 20,000+ employees across 176 offices globally, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are.

The Bloomberg Financial Solutions department of 5,000+ employees is at the forefront of ensuring success for our customers and employees alike. Our team comprises of several key pillars: sales, service, operations, culture and brand. As a department, we are united by a common goal: We create meaningful relationships with clients by understanding their needs and delivering outstanding end-to-end support from sales and implementation, through their ongoing relationship with Bloomberg.

Our Team
Bloomberg Marketing partners with forward-looking business leaders to seize and create opportunities and to drive difference. We use data to understand markets and audiences and creative ideas to build stories and brands. We create campaigns and work that captures attention and drives a reaction. We move fast, and our core approach is integrated and pioneering.

What’s The Role?
The marketing team is looking for a highly motivated marketer who will lead our marketing efforts for our sell-side solutions targeting banks and brokers globally. This will involve building relationships with key stakeholders across the sales and product teams to develop and execute strategic multi-channel marketing programs aligned to the objectives of Bloomberg's financial solutions businesses.

You will collaborate with internal marketing colleagues, including our in-house agency, globally to build these strategic and effective programs and handle execution to the highest standards. You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, able to lead a high volume of projects and demonstrate a passion for our brand.

We’ll Trust You To:
• Build trusted relationships with key stakeholders to determine priorities, and develop, execute, optimize and assess enablement program
• Work with our sales & product colleagues to find synergies across their priorities and the Financial Solutions business
• Manage campaign execution from strategic planning to implementation through all functional marketing areas as well as internal & external agencies
• Work closely with regional marketing managers globally to ensure the solutions/audiences you are responsible for are supported with well-informed and innovative marketing programs that optimally deliver a return on our marketing investment
• Run your own workload and prioritize multiple requests from various parts of the business
• Become an advocate for the Bloomberg brand to ensure all marketing activities are aligned and support the overall brand
• Work across multiple teams to deliver the best results
• Adapt, learn quickly and be resourceful
• Be innovative and creative to bring new ideas to the team

You’ll Need To Have:
• 7+ years of experience working as a marketing professional
• Successful track record in B2B and/or B2C marketing
• Demonstrable ability to partner with the business and internal marketing teams
• Strong project management and problem-solving skills with an ability to create project plans and manage through seamless execution
• Proven leadership and relationship management skills

We’d Love To See:
• Entrepreneurial mindset and an ability to adapt and learn a new market or industry
• Ability to influence and collaborate with all levels and departments
• No fear of failure

What’s It Like To Work Here?
We work hard. We are ambitious and set ourselves tough business goals. We are a meritocracy where everyone has a voice - not a job title. Working with people you trust, respect, and can collaborate with is more important than titles or positions. Things move fast, and we want people who will enjoy working in this environment and feed off the energy. But it isn’t all about work. title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg News is one of the biggest financial and business news organizations in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis on financial markets, from daily coverage through to in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It’s what keeps us inventing and re-inventing, all the time.

Bloomberg News is seeking a well-sourced, experienced and collaborative reporter to lead coverage of the intersection of money and power in the United Arab Emirates, home to more than $2 trillion in sovereign wealth.

Dubai and Abu Dhabi are locked in an intensifying rivalry to become the Middle East’s preeminent financial and business hub. Dubai is positioning itself as a center for private wealth and global finance, while Abu Dhabi’s sovereign wealth funds, state-backed firms and royal family–linked conglomerates are deploying vast resources to pursue marquee deals, reshape industries, diversify the economy and expand the country’s influence on the world stage.

This role calls for a reporter with strong news judgment and deep sourcing who can consistently work across and break news on a wide range of topics, including sovereign wealth funds, opaque private investment firms, major mergers and acquisitions, and the influx of international capital into the UAE.

Beyond daily news, the reporter will anchor and contribute deeply reported enterprise stories on themes such as private credit, alternative investments, and the evolving ties between the Middle East, Wall Street and global investors. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, works seamlessly with colleagues across regions, and brings ambition, rigor and curiosity to one of the most consequential finance beats in the world.

This role can be located in our Dubai or Abu Dhabi bureaus.

We'll trust you to:

  • Deliver exclusive interviews and original reporting on the most powerful figures and institutions shaping the region’s financial ambitions.
  • Collaborate with colleagues across deals, energy and government to break news and deliver a global perspective to our audience
  • Generate smart enterprise pieces, and make sure the team owns the biggest stories
  • Boost the profile of the team internally and externally as well as expand our contributions to TV, radio, podcasts, magazines, newsletters, the website and social media

You will need to have:

  • At least five years of experience as a reporter covering business news
  • Strong writing skills, with a particular focus on accuracy, precision and speed
  • A track record in breaking news and developing sourcing

We'd love to see:

  • Knowledge of regional wealth funds, politics, deals and financial markets
  • Be innovative and think creatively about ways to make our content accessible to a diverse audience of business-savvy readers

Life at Bloomberg is many things, but it’s never dull. We’re a truly global business with a truly diverse workforce. We pride ourselves on being open, inclusive and collaborative, and provide a work environment that inspires our employees to be their best. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive healthcare coverage, and programs to support you and your family through different life stages, from parental leave to generous retirement savings plans.

If this sounds like you:

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
At Bloomberg, we build the systems that move global markets.

The mission of Application Frameworks at Bloomberg is to deliver a seamless, industry-aligned, and fully supported application platform that enables a delightful Terminal experience.

Within Application Frameworks, the Terminal Backend Connectivity team is responsible for the critical infrastructure that allows the Terminal to communicate seamlessly and securely with our backend systems. From authentication and routing to load balancing and system resilience, our technology ensures that every interaction on the Terminal is fast, reliable, and secure.

Our Impact

Every click, search, and command on the Bloomberg Terminal flows through our infrastructure.
Our systems handle over 250 billion messages daily and support millions of concurrent application executions, enabling traders, analysts, and decision-makers to access real-time data and insights.

We don’t just build software, we build the backbone that keeps global finance running.
Our work combines deep technical challenges with an understanding of financial markets to meet the needs of our clients.

The Team

You’ll join a group of collaborative, curious, and highly skilled engineers who thrive on solving complex problems at scale. We work together to design resilient systems, debate architectural decisions, and continuously improve our platforms.

Our core stack is C++, supported by Go, Python, and Shell scripting.

What You’ll Do

  • Design, develop, and maintain software that powers the communication layer of Bloomberg Terminal
  • Write high-quality, performant, and reliable code
  • Collaborate with engineers across teams and disciplines to deliver solutions end-to-end
  • Continuously research, experiment, and adopt best practices to improve performance and reliability
  • Keep up-to-date with emerging trends in technology and continuously evolve to meet market needs
  • Approach every problem with a solution-first mindset and deliver technology that empowers our clients

What We’re Looking For

  • 4+ years of professional experience developing in C++
  • Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design principles
  • Experience with network programming and distributed systems
  • Familiarity with monitoring, logging, and metrics tools, and an understanding of service-level management (SLM)
  • A collaborative and ownership-driven attitude
  • Curiosity and passion for building technology that delivers real-world impact

Bonus Points If You Have

  • Experience with load balancers and/or reverse proxies in a  large-scale infrastructure
  • Familiarity with libnghttp2, libcurl, and openssl

Why Bloomberg

Working at Bloomberg means joining a company where technology drives everything we do. You’ll be surrounded by talented engineers who are passionate about building reliable, high-performance systems and you’ll see your work directly shape the experiences of our global clients.

If you’re excited about building the systems that power the world’s financial markets, we’d love to meet you.

description_html:
Bloomberg LP has built a significant media business spanning television, digital, magazine, radio and live event platforms across the globe. In the midst of a historic time in the media industry, Bloomberg Media is setting out to become the indispensable source of information for the world's most influential business leaders.

We’re seeking an operations and data associate to join our innovative Bloomberg Live team. In this role, you’ll work closely with the Head of Audience and Global Events Team to execute the Qatar Economic Forum to provide strategic reports to key Forum stakeholders as well as Bloomberg leadership.  

We’ll trust you to:

  • Assist in creating reports and decks for senior leadership and Forum stakeholders
  • Monitor and oversee the registration data and progress for all participants of the Qatar Economic Forum
  • Follow up with and re-confirm those who have not completed their registration
  • Review registration submissions for accuracy  
  • Be comfortable with large data sets and processing sensitive information
  • Act as a liaison between Bloomberg and partner entities to provide up-to-date real time reports on RSVPs, declines and VIP status

  • Work with counterparts to maintain precise and accurate data for various exclusive moments at the Form

  • Experience working with Salesforce, registration or lead generation systems
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and Google Products, in particular, strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight, and we use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. And, to ensure the best experience for our 20,000+ employees across 176 offices globally, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are.

The Bloomberg Financial Solutions department of 5,000+ employees is at the forefront of ensuring success for our customers and employees alike. Our team comprises several key pillars: sales, service, operations, culture and brand. As a department, we are united by a common goal: We create meaningful relationships with clients by understanding their needs and delivering exceptional end-to-end support from sales and implementation, through their ongoing relationship with Bloomberg.


Our Team

Bloomberg’s Multi-Asset Risk System (MARS) is a comprehensive suite of risk management tools that delivers consistent, consolidated results across our client’s entire firm. Powered by Bloomberg’s world-class pricing library, market data and mortgage cash flow engine, MARS enables front office, risk and collateral professionals to analyze their trading and investment portfolios, manage and mitigate their exposure and ready themselves for any turn of events.

What's the role?

Due to the significant growth of MARS solutions to clients, we are looking for a dedicated Account Manager to work with all sell-side MARS clients, including Banks, Dealers, Mortgage REITS and Regulators. This role will be important to develop a long-term relationship with the accounts from a risk perspective, operate as a point of contact for enterprise clients, generate upselling opportunities to existing clients and help to run the renewal pipeline. This role will involve coordination across multiple teams including Risk Sales, Risk ADSK, TOMS, AppSpecs and Core Sales as we look to drive the Bloomberg Sell-side well-rounded solution.


We will trust you to:

-Strategically look across your coverage to identify gaps in client’s workflow to increase their usage of the terminal and enterprise products

-Proactively find and supervise at-risk Clients to defend the Bloomberg business

-Lead usage campaigns, both self-initiated to achieve business targets and management driven initiatives

-Develop a sound understanding of Bloomberg’s MARS products, how they integrate with financial markets and have the ability to position our solutions appropriately

-Demonstrate a strong level of Bloomberg customer type knowledge, by understanding how that player type makes money, does their job, and utilizes technology

-Be able to demonstrate functionality and workflows of applicable Bloomberg solutions that improve a specific customer type's need

-Contribute innovative ideas that anticipate and address client needs

-Participate actively in new projects that drive departmental and firm-wide initiatives

-Seek out additional ways to demonstrate leadership and make an impact, such as mentoring, involvement in training, running campaigns, and active involvement in product improvement


You'll need to have:

-Ability to engage at a senior level with sell-side clients

-Ability to engage and collaborate with other teams internally

-Outstanding presentation, training, and communication skills

-Working knowledge across a broad range of asset classes including Derivatives, Mortgages and Bonds, including ability to understand valuation models and market data.


We’d love to see:

-A focus on the MARS range of solutions already, either through advocacy or direct involvement in risk opportunities.


What’s It Like To Work Here?

We work hard. We are ambitious and set ourselves tough business goals. We are a meritocracy where everyone has a voice - not a job title. Working with people you trust, respect, and can collaborate with is more important than titles or position. Things move fast, and we want people who will enjoy working in this environment and feed off the energy. But it isn’t all about work. Giving back is one of our core values, and there are many ways to get involved in philanthropic initiatives from helping local school kids with their reading to helping clean up local parks and waterways.

What is Bloomberg?: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/stories/what-is-bloomberg/

View our Benefits: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/careers/working-here/employee-benefits/united-states/?tactic-page=588601

Does This Sound Like You?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know that the next steps are.

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Bloomberg provides reasonable adjustment/accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable adjustment/accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable adjustment/accommodation include but are not limited to making a change to the application process work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. description_html:
Smarter, Faster, and as always - First. That's our philosophy. Bloomberg Media empowers global business leaders with breaking news, expert opinion and proprietary data distributed on every platform, across every time zone. Like our products and solutions - our teams are agile, dynamic, and innovative. We work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy for which we're known. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We challenge each other. And through our countless volunteer projects, we help bring out the best in our communities as around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.

Bloomberg is looking for a Sr PM that will lead vision , roadmapping and execution of our Video Advertising Products.

At Bloomberg Engineering & CTO Finance, we are committed to providing world-class support to our business partners in Engineering and CTO by providing insight on business performance, financial oversight and thought leadership. We are looking for a specialist to join our larger finance team supporting the CTO commercial businesses. As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to deliver a unique blend of financial and operational analysis, financial modeling, and reporting and business support in a fast-paced and cutting-edge business. Your financial oversight will involve developing of commercial strategy including market analysis, product pricing models, revenue forecasts and cost analysis. Your ability to develop relationships with stakeholders across the organization and strong analytical and communication skills will help you be successful in this role.


We’ll trust you to:

  • Own the revenue model and forecast (Run Rate, bookings→billings→revenue, revenue waterfall); deliver quarterly and annual outlooks, ad-hoc scenarios, and risk/opportunity ranges.
  • Size markets and prioritize opportunities: Total addressable market analysis and market segmentation
  • Develop and maintain KPIs and business metrics
  • Manage FP&A requirements in adherence to corporate requirements and processes, including monthly, quarterly, annual and ad hoc reporting

  • A BA/BS in Finance or related field
  • Ability to identify problems, understand the root cause, make recommendations and drive to a solution
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence outcomes of issues and projects Experience carrying out complex work with autonomy and make decisions within scope of responsibilities
  • Team player who can work across multiple departments and levels within the company

We’d love to see:
  • Experience in Strategy Consulting (market studies related to market sizing, competitive landscape, commercial opportunity) or Revenue FP&A is a strong plus
  • Degree in a quantitative subject: Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics
  • Flexibility to work in an entrepreneurial and fast-moving environment
  • Familiarity with the Bloomberg terminal is useful, but not required
  • Experience with Enterprise software applications e.g. SAP and data visualization applications e.g. Tableau or Qlik

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The Engineering Risk & Resilience team partners across Bloomberg Engineering to identify, understand, and reduce the risks that matter most to how we build and operate technology. Our work sits at the intersection of engineering, risk management, and regulation, with a simple goal: help engineering teams do the right thing with minimal disruption to product development.

We design practical, engineering-owned risk management solutions to address technology risk. This often means working across Engineering, Security, and Technology Product Owners; collaborating closely with Legal, Compliance, and Risk; engaging Product and Data teams on technology risk considerations; and translating complex regulatory expectations into approaches that engineers can actually use. We care deeply about mitigating risk, and we’re equally diligent about minimizing unnecessary process and bureaucracy.

The Role

We’re looking for an experienced Technology Policy Writer to help shape and document Bloomberg’s technology standards. In this role, you’ll take newly refreshed controls and turn them into clear, usable standards that articulate what’s required and how it applies, in language that resonates with technologists.

This is a hands-on writing and synthesis role, ideal for someone who enjoys making complex technology risk concepts understandable, aligning disparate requirements into a coherent structure, and building trust with engineers and risk partners alike.

You’ll work closely with the Global Head of Policy, engineering leadership, Risk and Compliance partners, and subject matter experts across the organization to draft, socialize, and publish documentation. Your work will help ensure Bloomberg’s technology standards meet regulatory expectations, support operational resilience, and remain practical to implement at scale.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead the development and drafting of technology risk and compliance standards covering areas such as change management, recovery and continuity, and security.

  • Translate regulatory obligations and internal control requirements into clear, actionable standards that support policy objectives.

  • Produce well-written, easy-to-digest standards documents that faithfully reflect underlying controls while remaining accessible to engineers.

  • Ensure strong traceability between controls, policies, standards, and regulatory requirements, maintaining alignment with Bloomberg’s Common Control Framework structure and language.

  • Map and realign industry standards and regulatory frameworks (e.g., NIST, DORA) to internal controls to support compliance and auditability.

  • Act as a trusted partner to engineers, risk professionals, compliance managers, and senior leaders, facilitating the flow of information and informed decision-making.

  • Contribute, as needed, to broader Engineering COO initiatives aligned with the team’s mission.

What You Bring

  • 10+ years of experience writing technology documentation, policies, or standards in a technology company, ideally a cloud provider, SaaS company, or regulated environment.

  • Strong understanding of risk management concepts with prior experience in a first- or second-line role.

  • Exceptional written communication skills, with a proven ability to simplify complex technical and risk concepts into clear, practical guidance.

  • Strong analytical judgment and problem-solving skills, with the confidence to work independently in ambiguous or evolving situations.

  • A track record of effectively engaging stakeholders at all levels, from engineers to senior leadership.

  • An inclusive, collaborative mindset that values diverse perspectives and actively seeks feedback.

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Technology, Information Systems, or a related discipline (or equivalent practical experience).

  • Comfort working across multiple technology domains, leveraging existing documentation and frameworks rather than specializing narrowly in one area.

We’d Love to See

  • 10+ years of experience in technology risk, compliance, policy development, or risk management within a financial institution, technology company, or regulatory body.

  • Deep subject matter expertise in at least two of the following areas: information security, technology operations, or business continuity management.

  • Experience building or shaping policy programs, setting direction, and executing against a longer-term strategy.

If this role aligns with how you think about technology, risk, and good writing and you want to make a meaningful, organization-wide impact we’d love to hear from you.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg delivers critical information in a world where information matters. We give influential decision makers in business, finance, and government an aggressive edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of news, people, and ideas. To do that, we need a constant flow of ideas, energy, innovation - which is where you come in. At Bloomberg, you will have the opportunity to go above and beyond and to take risks. Be a part of an organisation that is entering new markets, launching new ventures, and pushing boundaries. Our ever-expanding array of technology, data, and news & media services nurtures innovation and empowers clients - and offers nearly limitless opportunities for career growth. 

 

We have an exciting new opening to join the Bloomberg Product Oversight (BPO) team in Singapore. For this role, we are looking for a professional who can assist our clients in understanding the appropriate Bloomberg solutions for their workflow. Our team dives deep into the very roots of our clients' workflow to gain a comprehensive understanding of their businesses. 

 

What is the role? 

 

You will align clients’ workflow and data consumption with the appropriate contractual framework and Bloomberg offering, protecting both our clients and our organisation. You will do this by proactively analyzing existing client profiles to understand our clients' business, workflow and ensure suitable use of our product offerings, while also mitigating business risks. 

 

Using a highly consultative and analytical approach, you'll examine client data workflows, content licensing frameworks, and strategic initiatives, working closely with a wide variety of individuals, including but not limited to end users, senior market data managers, C-level executives, as well as internal partners including Sales, Product Managers, and Legal. With such close proximity to our clients, you will be at the forefront of being able to understand business and product gaps, providing these insights to our management to better improve our offerings. 

 

We’ll trust you to: 

  • Analyze existing client profiles and Bloomberg product workflows to identify possible risks from third parties and non-compliant processes 
  • Work closely and collaboratively with clients to ensure proper usage of Bloomberg products for their workflows, in line with respective product agreements 
  • Identify gaps in our product offering and provide feedback to management and product managers to further enhance our product suite 
  • Manage projects such as the development of internal tools to enhance visibility of product usage and risk analysis across our client and user base 

 

You'll need to have: 

  • Minimum 5 years experience working in the finance industry 
  • Demonstrated experience communicating across multiple stakeholder groups with strong written and verbal communication skills in English 
  • Capital markets knowledge with a good understanding of buy-side & sell-side workflows for at least one asset class (eg Fixed Income, Equities, Foreign Exchange, Commodities) 
  • Demonstrated experience in a role that has interacted with external clients, such as a customer support or sales role 
  • Demonstrated experience conducting research or analysis handling large sets of data 
  • Demonstrated experience collaborating with internal teams (e.g. Sales, Product Managers, Legal), including influencing across all levels 
  • Demonstrated experience understanding the needs of clients and building a strategy or solution to service identified needs 
  • Proven ability to excel and prioritize in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment 
  • Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organisation
  • Bachelor’s degree or degree-equivalent qualifications

 

We'd love to see: 

  • Hands-on experience using the Bloomberg suite of products 
  • Business proficiency in Mandarin or Japanese

 

If this sounds like you: 

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional 

 

Why Bloomberg? 

We’re individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We’re interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential. 


Learn more about our office and benefits: 

Singapore | www.bloomberg.com/singapore

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Our Team:

We protect Bloomberg.
The Bloomberg Information Security Office team is dedicated to making our products and technologies as secure as possible through design, development, and operation. We report into the Chief Information Security Office while working closely with regulated businesses, key lines of business, and development/engineering across Bloomberg L.P. Our colleagues depend on us to help design, run, and improve our most important security programs.

What's in it for you:

The Bloomberg BISO team focuses on identifying opportunities to improve the security of Bloomberg, our products and services, and the security of our customers’ data. In this role, you will be the owner, manager, and developer of multiple security programs, each with unique challenges and in a global setting. You will be responsible for setting strategic direction, evangelizing security and compliance efforts, and influencing the direction of Bloomberg L.P.’s business efforts all in a day’s work.

We'll trust you to:

• Develop a deep understanding of your business domains, keeping abreast of new technologies, regulatory changes, and industry best practices as you design, lead, and oversee the information security programs for your lines of business.
• Work with stakeholders to effectively manage cyber risk including consulting on security controls, mitigation strategies, and incident response planning and management.
• Foster cross-functional relationships between teams to improve all aspects of our security program.
• Define and develop management information, including key risk indicators, program maturity indicators, and key performance indicators for use in reporting.
• Establish and review information security policies and procedures in your line of business.
• Become a trusted voice to senior management, report on the status of information security programs to boards and various governance forums.
• Lead in the development and delivery of scenario testing such as Tabletop Exercises and Threat Led Penetration Testing.
• Lead remediation efforts and support transformational change initiatives across the broader organization.

We'd love to see:

• 7+ years of experience in information security, cyber security risk management, data security and cyber security regulation.
• Demonstrated ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to achieve success in a complex global setting.
• Proven delivery of complex projects involving cross-functional teams.
• Ability to proactively identify and manage cyber security risks to deliver services and meet business objectives in a secure and compliant way.
• Strong technical knowledge in key cyber security domains such as cloud security, network security and architecture, application security, secure software development lifecycle (SSDLC) and vulnerability management.
• Proven experience in delivering Threat Led Penetration Tests such as CBEST or equivalent TLPT regimes.
• Good knowledge of key technologies such as Operating Systems, Software Development Build Pipelines and Processes, Security Tooling, O365 Suite, and Business Intelligence Tools.
• Experience with industry standards such as NIST CSF and ISO 27001.
• Knowledge and experience with Regulation pertaining to Information Security such as DORA, Operational Resilience, UK CTP Regime, GDPR.
• Excellent written and oral communication skills.
• Demonstrated ability to perform under pressure and consistently meet program deadlines.
• An industry recognized certifications such as CISSP, GIAC, CISM, ISO 27001 Lead Implementor/Auditor.

If This Sounds Like You:

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at: [1] https://www.bloomberg.com/company/what-we-do/

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg’s Fixed Income Pricing group provides gold standard pricing services to the financial markets.  Our solutions include products like BVAL, IBVAL Front Office, CBBT and BGN.  We price over 2.9 million securities across all fixed income asset classes, including thinly traded and hard-to-price fixed income securities. Our customers rely on us to understand markets and analyze complex structures which allow them to make thoughtful investment decisions, which ultimately creates more value for the investor.  Our mission is to drive greater transparency, liquidity and safety in global fixed income markets. 


To produce this pricing data, we absorb billions of data points from hundreds of financial markets every day. We pipe this data through pricing algorithms which employ quantitative and machine learning techniques. This process produces the high-quality pricing that the market and our customers need. We also develop applications that provide intelligent analytics and transparency for these prices. 


Bloomberg's Evaluated Pricing (BVAL) business is a market leader in fixed income pricing and the pricing provider to Bloomberg Indices. BVAL prices multiple times daily for clients across buy side, sell side and custodial clients. Mutual funds, money managers, hedge funds, internal pricing groups, and auditors rely on BVAL to establish fair and independent fixed income asset valuations. We are known for:   

- Transparent methodologies that aid clients in the full investment lifecycle   

- Pricing data provided how and when clients want it   

- Legendary customer support    


BVAL Fixed Income Evaluators are capital markets experts responsible for employing relevant, innovative, and leading-edge valuation models that leverage Bloomberg’s in-house analytics to provide high-quality data for the front office, middle office, and operations. The current team consists of a high performing group of professionals with extensive and varied experiences, including former traders, portfolio managers, and research analysts. We are seeking a valuation specialist for the BVAL GSAC (Governments, Supranationals, Agencies, and Corporates) team.

 

We’ll expect you to:

- Design and support valuation models and systems to provide clients with evaluated prices for High Yield    Corporate Bonds.

- Work closely with other BVAL team members, Business Development, and Engineering to develop innovative models and enhance our product offering. 

- Assist clients who use BVAL prices for NAV, P&L and/or risk analytic purposes. 

- Discuss markets, complex valuation models, and pricing questions with colleagues and clients.  

- Collaborate with multiple groups across reporting lines and support downstream product including sales and business to identify and implement workflow improvements and operational efficiencies.

An outstanding new opportunity has arisen for an experienced Compliance advisory professional to join the APAC Compliance team (on a temporary contract).
