title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.

What is the role?
Talent Acquisition Coordination plays a critical role in our Talent Acquisition strategy and the success of our recruitment efforts. You will be joining a team that is passionate about building inclusive interview processes and diverse teams.
As a coordinator, you will be responsible for creating a positive and memorable experience for each candidate through all stages of our interview process. You will manage interview scheduling and logistics for exciting roles across businesses and office locations. You will contribute to the team through interesting cross-functional projects that can impact our Talent Acquisition strategy. We will encourage you to be innovative and propose process improvements that will further streamline our candidate journey and experience.

We will trust you to:
• Manage a high volume of interview scheduling and oversee interview logistics
• Partner with other coordinators, recruiters, and sourcers
• Recommend best practices as it pertains to interviews and candidate experience
• Build and manage relationships with internal partners across businesses
• Oversee workflows across our applicant tracking system (and CRM and Events platform, where applicable) and ensure candidate pipelines operate efficiently
• Support with researching, planning, and organizing logistics for recruitment events

You will need to have:
• At least one year of work experience
• Experience working in a collaborative and fast-paced environment
• Excellent prioritization and organizational skills with incredible attention to detail
• Effective communication skills and previous success in building and maintaining relationships with internal and external stakeholders
• Interest in developing a career within HR and Recruitment

We would love to see:
• Prior experience as a recruitment coordinator or similar role
• Prior experience with an applicant tracking system (ATS) and other relevant HR software (such as iCIMS, Greenhouse, Avature, Workday, etc.)
• Knowledge of Recruitment and HR concepts, policies, and procedures
• Enthusiastic approach to improving process efficiency

As a department, we are united by a common goal: We create meaningful relationships with clients by understanding their needs and delivering exceptional end-to-end support from sales and implementation, through their ongoing relationship with Bloomberg.

Our Team
As part of our Enterprise Services, Tradedesk is the first line of defense and the first line of offense. We are the domain experts. We are a group of highly technical individuals who provide high-level support for Bloomberg’s sell-side and buy-side clients, working alongside Enterprise Sales and Product to influence client usage patterns, ensure accurate responses to our multi-asset analytics inquiries, gather feedback, mentor and educate new employees and develop them into future specialists with deep product knowledge.

What's the role?
Our Tradedesk team is aligned to our industry leading sell-side Fixed Income Trading Solution (FIT) that delivers global order, execution and position management tools for front-office professionals as well as middle and back office operations. As part of this team you'll provide solutions to help bring exceptional service to our existing clients as well as on-boarding new clients. You'll need to be comfortable with building a detailed knowledge of our order management systems and technology solutions.
There are multiple opportunities to further your career across the department or the company, becoming a Subject Matter Expert within the team, or progressing into an Enterprise Relationship Support role.

We'll trust you to:
Focus on the 3 core areas below:
  • Client Service - At Bloomberg we pride ourselves on focusing on customer experience, providing our clients with the fastest and most knowledgeable solutions. You will have an adaptable approach, using your product knowledge and acquired client intel to build and maintain credible relationships with your clients, create clear and up-to-date documentation of client needs, and actively communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Product and Domain Expertise - You’ll know your customers’ business, our competitors, and Bloomberg’s product offerings. Keeping up to date with market trends whilst understanding the impact on our clients is essential. You will develop your knowledge of our products and customers' workflows, sharing and building this knowledge across your team.
  • Business Impact - This is the value-add brought to internal stakeholders, including Product, Sales, Implementation and Engineering. You'll be involved in generating leads and contributing to sales campaigns, prioritising product enhancement requests for our Product and Engineering teams, and providing valuable customer intelligence that drives product improvements and sales performance.

You’ll need to have:
  •  3+ years experience working in Financial Services or Financial Technology, specifically within financial markets, with hands-on exposure to trading products such as fixed income, foreign exchange (FX), and related instruments
  •  Experience in customer service roles, interacting with both internal and external clients 
  •  Business Proficiency in Mandarin language to support Mandarin-speaking clients
  •  Experience covering Fixed Income financial technology solutions
  •  Knowledge and/or working experience around electronic trading
  •  Knowledge of sell-side markets and an understanding of the full trade life cycle of OTC instruments
  •  Ability to communicate well at all stakeholder levels (technical contacts, product managers, traders, executive team etc.)
  •  The ambition to take ownership and become a proactive collaborator with strong multi-tasking and prioritization skills
  •  Ability to assist with product testing and project management work
  •  Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organisation 
  •  Fluency in both written and spoken English 
  •  Bachelor’s degree or degree-equivalent qualifications 

We’d love to see:
  • Knowledge of connectivity protocols such as FIX, TNP, XML
  • Interest in technology and coding skills

Bloomberg is committed to improving the communities, cities and countries in which we work, and we support various initiatives including hiring and developing local talent. So, we may prioritise candidates with legal authorisation to work full-time in Singapore for this role, who do not require Bloomberg to sponsor their work authorization.

If this sounds like you: 
Apply if you think we’re a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this:http://www.bloomberg.com/professional 

Learn more about our office and benefits:
Singapore | http://www.bloomberg.com/singapore

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Our Team

The BSKT platform is Bloomberg’s primary market solution and the world’s first system for negotiation, ticketing, and routing Exchange Trade Fund (ETF) creation and redemption orders. BSKT is available to most counterparties in the ETF space, including ETF issuers, market makers, authorized participants, and custodians. We are engaged in a variety of exciting projects to support different workflows globally, grow the primary market community, capture and centralize the ETF ecosystem on BSKT, and establish downstream connectivity to 3rd party portals. 


We’ll trust you to

  • Build high quality software in a fast-paced, client-driven environment

  • Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and clients to design, architect, and develop software components from the ground up

  • Take ownership of and responsibility for the full software development life cycle of your project

  • Mentor others in the design and implementation of production-quality systems and advocate for best practices on the team


Tech Stack

  • Languages: Python (primary), C++, and Javascript/Typescript for the UI

  • Databases: Relational Database, PostgreSQL 

  • Messaging: Kafka, RabbitMQ, IBM MQ

  • APIs: REST APIs, Postman

  • Monitoring/Alarming: Humio, Grafana


You’ll need to have

  • 2-3+ years of experience working with an object-oriented programming language such as C/C++, Python, Java, or Javascript

  • Knowledge of best practices for testing, automation, and CI/CD

  • A Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience


We’d love to see

  • Commitment to building quality software through code reviews, tests, and engagement

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment using agile methodologies

  • Enthusiasm to lead, share new ideas, and drive processes with the team

  • Interest and passion for understanding our product and working with product managers and clients

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Description and requirements

As a Senior Software Engineer - you will be a critical member of the team responsible for the full lifecycle of our global network infrastructure that supports Bloomberg’s core products and services. This includes building and maintaining a network that is scalable, reliable and robust. Our network is vast, connecting several large-scale Data Centers and over a hundred edge sites. It connects Bloomberg to hundreds of thousands of our clients, over 1,500 global exchanges and trading venues over private connectivity, Internet and Public Cloud.  

This is a unique opportunity to help build robust, highly scalable solutions that will power the future of how Bloomberg automates network infrastructure. You'll be trusted to design and work on tooling that builds on automation best practices and principles.  
 
We’ll trust you to 
  • Develop and maintain software tools to manage a large-scale, multi-vendor network with an emphasis on automation, telemetry, and model-driven infrastructure as code. 
  • Automate the full network lifecycle—including provisioning, configuration, observability, testing, troubleshooting, and capacity planning. 
  • Collaborate with architecture and design teams and the CTO office to implement new technologies that ensure scalability, efficiency, and operational resilience. 
  • Develop tools and platforms that enhance the observability, reliability, and performance of the production network. 
  • Enhance existing monitoring and observability frameworks, integrating intelligent alerting and self-remediation capabilities to reduce manual intervention and improve incident response. 
  • Define and measure service-level objectives (SLOs) to track infrastructure performance and reliability. 
  • Write software utilizing orchestration systems to automate tasks and interact with other systems. 
  • Provide mentorship to junior engineers and promote software engineering best practices throughout the team. 
  • Practice and promote the use of a modern software development lifecycle. 
You need to have
  • Extensive  experience as a Software, Network Production, or System Reliability  Engineer. 
  • Experience with building, maintaining and continuously enhancing automations needed for scalability & efficiency in running the Network Infrastructure.
  • Experience in infrastructure Automation and orchestration Frameworks e.g. Ansible, Airflow, Terraform, Chef, Salt. 
  • Proven experience with object-oriented programming languages preferably in Python.
  • A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Engineering, Mathematics, a similar field of study or equivalent work experience. 
We'd love to see
  • Experience managing and automating network devices at scale such as Juniper, Nokia, Arista, Cisco, Whitebox etc.  
  • An understanding of various Network architectures across Internet, Public Cloud, Private Networks, DWDM and Optical Networking, Data Centre builds and design fundamentals. etc. 
  • Experience with network modelling 
  • Eagerness to learn new technologies and mentor others 
  • Experience with Telemetry: Splunk, Grafana, Humio 
  • Experience with continuous integration and deployment tools 
  • Experience implementing, maintaining and troubleshooting MPLS, BGP, OSPF, IGMP, PIM related internal and external network routing issues in a production environment 
  • Knowledge with messaging queues such as Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Our core product, The Bloomberg Terminal, is used by financial professionals around the world. It's continuously being developed and improved by a large number of engineers that are experts in their field. Our team is part of a group of engineers who create the product infrastructure for application teams at Bloomberg.

The Bloomberg Terminal is a modern JavaScript based application. Implemented using a combination of open-source software such as Chromium, V8 and Node.js as well as our own software implemented primarily in TypeScript and C++.

As we evolve the technology behind the Bloomberg Terminal we face the challenge of how to automate the user interface to imitate human users. We are the engineering team responsible for choosing the right technologies, developing solutions and tooling for end-to-end testing of the Bloomberg Terminal. We do so to help our Engineering and QA partners assure the quality of our software, adequately test for errors and regressions as well as permit error reproduction.

We're looking for an engineer with a passion for creating the tools to make engineering life easier and improving the workflow of their peers and themselves.

If you're an experienced engineer who's comfortable creating complex multi-language software, then we'd love you to join the team!

We’ll trust you to:
  • Develop the fundamental tools to automate the Terminal
  • Work predominantly with TypeScript and sometimes C++, C#, Gherkin and more
  • Work with Chromium/Webkit via the Chrome Devtools Protocol
  • Implement a Chrome Devtools Protocol service
  • Open the Terminal to be automated via existing OSS solutions
  • Be on the cutting edge of shaping the developer experience
You’ll need to have:
  • Demonstrated experience working with an object-oriented programming language (TypeScript, Python, Java, etc.)
  • JavaScript/TypeScript development experience at scale (preferably Electron or Node.js)
  • A Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience
  • An understanding of Computer Science fundamentals such as data structures and algorithms
  • Prior contributions to system design and architecture and scaling fault-tolerant systems
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
We’d love to see:
  • Experience with Behavior Driven Design / Test Driven Development
  • Experience in writing MCPs

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg’s Legal and Compliance Department plays a critical role in supporting our businesses and operations around the world. We move quickly and thoughtfully to help address a variety of complex issues that come with being the world’s leading financial news and information company. Our team is made up of talented and hardworking professionals who think creatively and work collaboratively in an open environment to deliver results, drive innovation, and solve difficult problems. We also recognize the value of inclusion and the importance of giving back to our communities as evidenced by our award-winning pro bono program. 

 

The Asia Pacific (APAC) Bloomberg Compliance team is part of the Global Compliance Department and provides compliance coverage of Bloomberg's regulated entities and products and support for Bloomberg's non-regulated products and services. As part of the Legal and Compliance organization, the Compliance team ensures that Bloomberg’s activities and its employees adhere to applicable regulations and standards. 

 

What's the role: 

An outstanding Team Leader opportunity has arisen for an experienced Compliance advisory professional with management experience to join the APAC Compliance team. Based in Hong Kong, you will take this critical role leading the North APAC Compliance coverage with a broad remit including support of Bloomberg's electronic trading business.  You will have responsibility for leading a strong team of Compliance professionals as well as gowning the regulatory compliance program in Hong Kong. 

 

We'll trust you to: 

  • Provide Compliance advisory coverage of the firm’s electronic trading services and products, including providing advice, handling regulatory reporting, coordinating risk assessments and testing, and dealing with Compliance related queries, alerts and incidents 
  • Provide oversight, guidance and support to compliance advisory covering North APAC and trade surveillance team members  
  • Act as the primary contact for the local regulators and be responsible for managing the relationships 
  • Represent the Compliance team to participate in, and work with other business and support functions on, major business proposals and regulatory change initiatives 
  • Provide Compliance advice to the business and support functions to ensure Compliance with regulatory and company requirements and standards 
  • Assist to implement and maintain the firm’s Compliance program, including policies and procedures 
  • Prepare and deliver Compliance training addressing employee needs and Compliance requirements as well as enhancing employee awareness and knowledge of regulatory requirements and sensitivities 
  • Coordinate internal audits and regulatory inspections, including responses to regulatory inquiries and surveys 
  • Implement appropriate Compliance controls and tools, including working with Compliance technology support and other internal functions to make enhancements and address any gaps identified 
  • Work closely with second-line risk partners to identify, manage, and report on Compliance and regulatory risks 
  • Assist in other compliance projects and initiatives relevant to the APAC Compliance team 

 

You'll need to have: 

  • A minimum of 10 years of relevant compliance experience covering electronic trading and financial markets, particularly in relation to currencies, fixed income, equities, commodities and/or related derivatives 
  • Experience in regulatory engagement with the Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong and the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, including managing regulatory inquiries, surveys, and inspections 
  • Demonstrated experience in drafting policies, procedures and manuals as well as preparing reports for regulatory bodies and internal management 
  • Strong understanding of financial regulations 
  • Proven team leadership experience 
  • Ability to work well in a team with diverse stakeholders and possess strong technical skills to work in a fast pace, technology driven environment 
  • Strong organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills 
  • Ability to effectively multi-task and prioritize 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English 
  • Strong presentation and communication skills 

 

We'd love to see: 

Fluency in Mandarin Chinese or Korean (verbal and written) 

 

If this sounds like you: 

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: 

www.bloomberg.com/professional 

 


Why Bloomberg? 
We’re individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We’re interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential. 

 

Learn more about our office and benefits:  
Hong Kong | www.bloomberg.com/hongkong 
 

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.  
 

Bloomberg provides reasonable adjustment/accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable adjustment/accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable adjustment/accommodation include but are not limited to making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you would prefer to discuss this confidentially, please email AMER_recruit@bloomberg.net (Americas), EMEA_recruit@bloomberg.net (Europe, the Middle East and Africa), or APAC_recruit@bloomberg.net (Asia-Pacific), based on the region you are submitting an application for.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg runs on data. Our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In Data, we are responsible for delivering this data, news and analytics through innovative technology - quickly and accurately. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes - all while providing platinum customer support to our clients. 

The Team: 

For over 40 years, Green Markets has improved the performance of companies across fertilizer product value chains. By creating market transparency, Green Markets enables fertilizer professionals to make more informed decisions and improve company performance. 

Green Markets is expanding its fertilizer market coverage in the APAC region.  The business is seeking a high-energy fertilizer market professional to join its team of pricing analysts that cover global fertilizer market prices. 

The Role: 

The APAC Fertilizer Market Pricing Analyst continually develops and manages an existing network of industry participants representing buyers and sellers of fertilizer, as well as market intermediaries. Following specific guidelines, the analyst regularly engages with and gathers data from market participants to develop high-confidence, proprietary price assessments for fertilizer products within defined regional markets. 

The successful candidate will be a highly motivated individual with the ability to develop a strong network within the fertilizer industry to undertake price discovery and ascertain market developments.  The role requires communicating with market participants, learning/knowing/uncovering market trends and developments, and synthesizing this information to develop proprietary pricing intelligence and market reports to be used by a variety of market constituents. 

You will be responsible for sourcing market sentiment information, reacting to feedback from clients and company stakeholders, and managing ad-hoc projects that are part of the overall product strategy. Your industry knowledge will also play a central part in the marketing of any product launch. 

A secondary role is to report on industry news in support of our global coverage. 

Markets to be covered include nitrogen, phosphate and potassium fertilizers in relevant markets that can include China, India, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam, Brunei and Indonesia. 

We’ll trust you to: 
  • Manage and further develop a proprietary network to source fertilizer prices and gauge market sentiment 
  • Work within a well-defined pricing discovery process provided to you by Bloomberg that includes: 
  • Use of salesforce automation software that simplifies and organizes network development; provides activity tracking using established methods and best practices 
  • Use of a source and pricing data tracking tool to organize data and provide transparency of network/source feedback 
  • Operate within established ethical guidelines to be provided 
  • Obtain current market prices and provide written market sentiment narrative on fertilizer products 
  • Submit short-format articles of fertilizer industry news for publication following established processes, formats and style 

You’ll need to have: 
  • 3+ years of professional experience in analyzing, buying or selling fertilizer products in the APAC region
  • Expert understanding of fertilizer pricing dynamics, influences and mechanisms 
  • Credible knowledge of the fertilizer market and/or a strong understanding of the companies operating in this industry 
  • Superlative communication, interpersonal, networking and relationship development skills 
  • Analytical and information gathering skills combined with the ability to develop written conclusions on market pricing trends 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skill in English

We’d love to see: 
  • A passion for understanding the nuances of the global fertilizer industry 
  • Interest in continuous learning and expanding fertilizer industry knowledge base 
  • Ability to assimilate and transform gathered market intelligence into narrative market reporting 

Contract duration: 12 months - with the possibility of renewal based on business needs
Weekly Schedule: 3 days per week

Contract will be administered by third-party vendor as a dispatched worker arrangement with Bloomberg. 
 
If this sounds like you: 
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: http://www.bloomberg.com/professional 


Bloomberg is committed to improving the communities, cities and countries in which we work, and we support various initiatives including hiring and developing local talent. So, you'll need to have legal authorization to work full-time in Singapore, without Bloomberg sponsoring your work authorization, to be considered for this role.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg runs on data. Our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock - from around the world. In Data, we are responsible for delivering this data, news and analytics through innovative technology - quickly and accurately. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes - all while providing exceptional customer support to our clients.

Our Team:
The Global Data Analytics Team is the frontline customer service provider for Bloomberg's Data clients. We deliver knowledgeable and dedicated service to our customers addressing data related inquiries. We liaise with data’s domain based teams to help confirm and support data related inquiries through the "ADSK" system. We solve complex problems and provide accurate and timely solutions in order to consistently surpass the expectations of our clients.
The team is structured into domain based teams across three asset classes with Equity, Fixed Income and Multi Asset teams across the globe with generalists across each group. These teams are directly aligned to domain based ADSK groups and partners among Data’s departments, Companies, Securities, Managed Investment and Benchmarks, Content Acquisition, and the Data Management Lab teams.

What’s the role?
Our Data Analysts are the front line of customer service for Data supporting both internal and external clients. In this role your core responsibility will be supporting Bloomberg clients through our Help Desk, which will allow you to develop general financial markets understanding and knowledge of the inner workings of Bloomberg's customer service technology. You will also use your project management skills and problem solving abilities to assist in the implementation of strategic solutions to improve client experience and team workflows and procedures. We are a large team that interacts with all areas of the business, therefore the ability to effectively connect with partners in different regions and roles is essential.

We'll trust you to:
  • Leverage your customer service skills to provide exceptional customer service to Bloomberg clients via our Help Desk (ADSK)
  • Use your customer service skills and subject matter expertise to educate and inform our clients
  • Build and maintain relationships with key internal and external Stakeholders (such as Enterprise Support, Analytics, and Data Product Teams)
  • Use problem solving and data analysis skills to find insights that assist in the implementation of strategic solutions to improve the client experience
  • Enhance customer operational performance by using Help Desk resources
  • Actively seek out opportunities for self-improvement, keeping up with new product training and process knowledge
  • Make independent decisions to resolve customer issues with strong problem solving skills

You’ll need to have:
  • Up to 3 years of work experience in the financial services industry, including exchanges, market data providers, financial technology or financial institutions
  • Experience working in a customer service roles where you're interacting with both internal and external clients, eg customer support or helpdesk roles
  • Business proficiency in Japanese or Korean language to cover Japanese or Korean-speaking clients
  • Proven written and verbal communication skill in English
  • A bachelor's degree or higher in relevant data technology or financial field, or degree-equivalent qualifications
  • Proven ability to multitask effectively, remain professional under pressure, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to take a logical approach and apply critical thinking to resolve complex or time-sensitive issues
  • Comfortable working both independently and collaboratively within multidisciplinary teams, demonstrating self-motivation and adaptability
  • Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organisation

We’d love to see:
  • Proficiency in another Asian language as this role will require coverage across Asia
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite & Google Drive
  • Proficiency in data analytics tools such as QlikSense, or Tableau
Bloomberg is committed to improving the communities, cities and countries in which we work, and we support various initiatives including hiring and developing local talent. So, we may prioritize candidates with legal authorization to work full-time in Singapore for this role, who do not require Bloomberg to sponsor their work authorization.

If this sounds like you: 
Apply if you think we’re a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: http://www.bloomberg.com/professional

Learn more about our office and benefits:
Singapore | http://www.bloomberg.com/singapore

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg Buyside Enterprise Solutions delivers a comprehensive suite of integrated tools encompassing order management, portfolio management, and performance and risk analytics. Our solutions empower global investment professionals by streamlining their investment workflows, from defining investment universes to executing optimal portfolio strategies and precisely measuring risk and performance across all asset classes.

Within this broader offering, our Portfolio & Risk Analytics solutions specifically provide clients with sophisticated tools to assess portfolio risks, attribute performance, and implement robust investment strategies with confidence and precision.


What’s the role?
As a Portfolio & Risk Analytics Account Manager, you will lead and grow relationships with key buy-side clients in Belgium and Luxembourg. You will drive revenue growth by identifying and delivering opportunities to expand Bloomberg’s Buyside solutions across existing client workflows. Collaborating closely with internal partners, you will ensure successful client onboarding, adoption, and ongoing satisfaction.


We'll trust you to:
Client Relationship Management:
 * Build and maintain deep, strategic relationships with senior partners, including C-suite executives.
 * Act as a trusted advisor, understanding client objectives and aligning Bloomberg solutions to their strategic goals.
Strategic Management:
 * Identify and develop commercial strategies tailored to each client to drive revenue growth.
 * Communicate client narratives and strategic opportunities to senior management internally.
Commercial:
 * Recognize and quantify new revenue opportunities and build actionable sales pipelines.
 * Implement effectively on upselling and cross-selling Bloomberg's full suite of Portfolio & Risk Analytics products.
Market Intelligence:
 * Develop comprehensive understanding of the buy-side industry, client-specific challenges, and competitive dynamics.
 * Represent Bloomberg at industry conferences, conveying thought leadership and industry insights.
Cross-team Collaboration:
 * Coordinate with internal teams, including Implementation, Product, and Engineering, to deliver integrated solutions.
 * Advocate for client requirements internally, ensuring alignment with Bloomberg’s product development roadmap.


You'll need to have:
 * Minimum 4 years of relevant experience in financial services, fintech, or related industries.
 * Consistent record in account management, relationship building, and revenue growth.
 * Expertise in buy-side workflows, portfolio management, performance attribution, and risk analytics.
 * Exceptional communication, presentation, negotiation, and consultative selling skills.
 * Willingness to travel regularly within Europe.
 * Business fluency in French


We would love to see:
 * CFA, FRM, or CAIA certification.
 * Hands-on experience with Bloomberg Query Language (BQL), Python, or SQL.
 * Familiarity with European regulatory frameworks (e.g., UCITS, AIFMD).


If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch to let you know the next steps but in the meantime feel free to browse this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/product/portfolio-risk-analytics/

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg Market Specialists provide practical guidance and industry expertise across markets to help clients maximize the value of their investments in our solutions and serve as their voice back to Bloomberg.

For Bloomberg clients globally positioning for a competitive edge across diverse markets and industry change, Bloomberg Market Specialists provide a practical and impartial view of the best practices, tools and workflows needed to take on intricate situations.

Armed with our partnership and expertise, clients can maximize the business value from their investment in Bloomberg solutions. Unlike similar teams at other vendors, Bloomberg Market Specialists have deep institutional knowledge about client workflows as the team partners with clients from pre-sale to present day to the future.

The Bloomberg Market Specialist team backs this up through being:
  • Asset Class or Workflow-Focused
  • Experienced
  • Client Centric
  • Future Oriented

Comprised of former traders, portfolio managers, sales representatives, analysts, and more, the team also plays a vital role in improving the knowledge of our sales force and are a dedicated source of client feedback for our product development teams.


We'll trust you to:
  • Apply your strong market experience, detailed knowledge of industry trends, specific workflows and demonstrated technical skills to assist in generating revenue across our current or future products - Act in an advisory capacity to our clients concerning the challenges that they face, and how they can use our products and technology to address them
  • Build upon an in-depth understanding of the competitor landscape and how this affects both internal and external customers
  • Influence the direction of Bloomberg products through thought leadership, contribution on innovative ideas, and establishing relationships between Bloomberg's decision-makers and our clients
  • Establish your own roadmap of initiatives that align with product, sales, and goals of the company. Maintain check-in points, and self-report successes and challenges on these strategies
  • Participate actively in new projects that drive departmental and firm-wide initiatives and goals
  • Seek out additional ways to make an impact, such as mentoring, involvement in training, running campaigns, and active involvement in product enhancement


You'll need to have:
  • Extensive experience in Private Markets – specifically across deal-related workflows in Private Equity or Venture Capital or external parties facilitating private market deals
  • A sound understanding of the private markets deal lifecycle: workflows, critical data points, qualitative inputs and the role and needs of various player types
  • Experience in Private Equity or Venture Capital deal making, either at a GP, LP or related service provider, would be beneficial
  • Practical experience using the Bloomberg Terminal, or similar product and workflow tools, across public and/or private markets
  • The business insight required to use your knowledge & experience to make good judgement and quick decisions, to tangibly impact the commercial success of our business
  • The ability to convey complex ideas and solutions in a simple and concise way to audiences both large and small
  • A willingness to travel across EMEA as the need arises to provide clients with a premier service
  • Outstanding presentation, training and communication skills


What’s it like to work here?
We work hard. We are ambitious and set ourselves tough business goals. We are a meritocracy where everyone has a voice - not a job title! Working with people you trust, respect, and can collaborate with is more meaningful than titles or position. Things adapt quickly, and we want people who will enjoy working in this environment and feed off the energy. But it isn’t all about work. title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
As an SME for load balancing, you will be a critical member of the team responsible for the full lifecycle of our global network infrastructure that supports Bloomberg’s core products and services. This includes building and maintaining a load balancing environment that is scalable, secure, reliable and robust. Our network is vast, connecting several large-scale Data Centers and over a hundred edge sites. It connects Bloomberg to hundreds of thousands of our clients, over 1,500 global exchanges and trading venues over private connectivity, Internet and Public Cloud.  

This is a unique opportunity to help build robust, highly scalable solutions that will power the future of how Bloomberg automates network infrastructure. You'll be trusted to design and work on tooling that builds on automation best practices and principles.  

We’ll trust you to

  • Develop and maintain software tools to manage a large-scale, multi-vendor network with an emphasis on automation, telemetry, and model-driven infrastructure as code.

  • Automate the full network lifecycle—including provisioning, configuration, observability, testing, troubleshooting, and capacity planning.

  • Collaborate with architecture and design teams and the CTO office to implement new technologies that ensure scalability, efficiency, and operational resilience.

  • Develop tools and platforms that enhance the observability, reliability, and performance of the production network.

  • Enhance existing monitoring and observability frameworks, integrating intelligent alerting and self-remediation capabilities to reduce manual intervention and improve incident response.

  • Define and measure service-level objectives (SLOs) to track infrastructure performance and reliability. 

  • Write software utilizing orchestration systems to automate tasks and interact with other systems. 

  • Provide mentorship to junior engineers and promote software engineering best practices throughout the team. 

  • Practice and promote the use of a modern software development lifecycle. 

You need to have

  • 4+ years of engineering experience in an infrastructure role or equivalent work experience.

  • Extensive experience as a Software, Network Production, or System Reliability  Engineer especially in the Load Balancer space.

  • Experience with building, maintaining and continuously enhancing automation needed for scalability & efficiency in running the Network Infrastructure.

  • Experience in infrastructure Automation or orchestration Frameworks e.g. Ansible, Airflow, Terraform, Chef, Salt.

  • Proven experience with object-oriented programming languages preferably in Python.

  • A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Engineering, Mathematics, a similar field of study or equivalent work experience.

We'd love to see

  • Experience managing and automating network devices at scale such as Juniper, Nokia, Arista, Cisco, Palo Alto, F5, Whitebox, Broadcom,  etc

  • Experience with virtualization and containerization

  • Eagerness to learn new technologies and mentor others

  • Experience with software load balancers.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg runs on data. Our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In Data, we are responsible for delivering this data, news and analytics through innovative technology - quickly and accurately. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes - all while providing platinum customer support to our clients.

The Role:

As a BNEF Data Engineer, you'll help grow Bloomberg's renewable projects databases to further deliver an industry-leading data product offering. You will be responsible for developing essential elements of our data product, including its data model, data pipelines, and data quality specifications. You will be expected to monitor market and industry trends to influence Bloomberg's best practices, tools, and technical infrastructure for data lifecycle management. Our Data Engineer possess a unique combination of technical skills, subject-matter-expertise in the energy industry, good communication skills and ability to build relationships with various partners such as Engineering and Product teams to propose, develop, and implement solutions for our clients. You'll collaborate closely with both our Data counterparts and the BloombergNEF Product team in Princeton, New York, London and Asia.


We'll trust you to:
  • Design and manage workflow configurations for critical functions such as data acquisition, worklist management and quality control
  • Utilize technical expertise to assess and apply statistical methods, programming, and machine learning to enhance data quality, derive insights, and extract valuable information
  • Perform incident management, from troubleshooting and root cause analysis to overall problem management
  • Partner with a wide variety of team members from Engineering to Sales on product development
  • Analyze internal processes to find opportunities for improvement, as well as devise and implement innovative solutions
  • Synthesize customer feedback to shape data strategies and create an execution roadmap
  • Ensure the data product meets the needs of stakeholders and seamlessly integrates with other data products
  • Stay updated on market, industry, and dataset developments related to your area of support
  • Make well-informed decisions in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
  • Report on results of on-going operations and projects, as required

You’ll need to have:
  • A Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a relevant STEM field, or equivalent professional work experience
  • 3-5 years of data management experience, for example improving data quality, accuracy, efficiency or timeliness
  • Experience in Data Profiling/Analysis using tools, such as Python, SQL, Excel
  • Experience using Analytical/Dashboarding applications, such as Qlik Sense, Tableau, Splunk
  • Previous work, internship and/or academic experience in data analysis, information technology and/or renewable energy
  • Strong passion for data and the overall energy transition movement
  • The ability to think creatively and provide out of the box solutions with an eagerness to learn and collaborate
  • A proven track record of successful project management skills and ability to prioritize tasks accordingly
  • Interest and/or experience in client and partner management
  • Familiarity with data processing paradigms and associated tools and technologies
  • Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organization
  • Strong presentation and communication skills in English

We’d love to see:
  • Previous work experience with the Bloomberg Terminal or Bloomberg Market Concepts (BMC) certification
  • Experience in semantic structures or data modelling
  • Strong aptitude for problem solving particularly to modify and enhance processes and workflows
If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg runs on data. Our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In Data, we are responsible for delivering this data, news, and analytics through innovative technology—quickly and accurately. We apply problem-solving skills to identify workflow efficiencies and implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products, and processes.

Our Team
The Company Financials team provides our clients with fast and accurate market-moving data so they can stay on top of their game: broker estimates, financial filings, and any other dataset that is useful to understand financial performance in the markets. Our products run on intelligence and industry-specific insights provided by the industry teams. We combine financial modeling, industry expertise, data management, and technical skills to curate critical metrics and drive insights from our data.

We are dedicated to crafting a best-in-class financial analysis and modeling product while constantly looking to enhance and expand our existing offering through a deep understanding of the markets we operate in, the sectors we cover, and our clients current and future needs.

What’s the Role?
As a Data Management Professional within the Foundational Support team, you will support the creation of scalable, high quality data workflows that underpin the delivery of accurate, fit-for-purpose datasets. Your work ensures that our foundational data processes not only meet accuracy and timeliness expectations but also evolve to support innovation, automation, and new commercial opportunities aligned with Bloomberg’s strategic goals.

You will play a pivotal role in validating end-to-end workflow orchestration, enhancing incident response and prevention frameworks, and embedding knowledge management and governance practices to strengthen data quality, transparency, and scalability across the Company Financials ecosystem.

We’ll trust you to:
  • Own validation and optimization of dataset workflows and tooling to drive scalability, data quality, and process efficiency
  • Lead feasibility assessments and proof-of-concept initiatives to evaluate and implement new tooling, automation, and dataset enhancements
  • Drive root cause and impact analyses through data profiling and analytical assessment to identify systemic risks, design preventive measures, and embed long-term resiliency into data workflows.
  • Partner cross-functionally with Product, Data, and Engineering teams to ensure alignment with strategic objectives, measurable ROI, and quality of workflow tooling release.
  • Establish and maintain governance frameworks to ensure critical operational and dataset knowledge is structured, discoverable, and embedded into workflows for sustainable knowledge management.
  • Develop best practices and process documentation that enable consistency, auditability, and scalability across onboarding and workflow execution.

You’ll need to have:
  • 4+ years of professional experience in data quality management, or data governance
  • Strong coding proficiency in SQL and Python for data analysis and workflow optimization idea generation
  • Familiarity with ETL processes, data pipelines, and workflow design
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, QlikSense, Power BI, or similar) to communicate quality insights
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong project management skills and ability to prioritize and adapt to tasks accordingly with a customer focused mentality
  • Powerful collaboration skills to work across departments and regions, excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a solutions-oriented mindset
  • Comfort working in a dynamic, evolving environment, balancing long-term strategy with immediate operational needs

We would love to see:
  • Industry-recognized data management certifications (e.g., DAMA, CDMP, DCAM)
  • Experience with company financials data and financial statements
  • Hands-on knowledge of data governance and quality frameworks, including metadata management and regulatory considerations
  • Knowledge of software testing and QA methodologies with experience in both manual and automating testing processes
  • Familiarity with modern data infrastructure and architecture (APIs, pipelines, cloud platforms), with exposure to AI/ML or LLM-based enrichment solutions for anomaly detection and automation
  • Experience using Bloomberg Terminal and Company Financials products
  • Exposure to Agile methodologies

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Our Team:

Bloomberg’s Change Orchestration team manages products for orchestrating software and infrastructure changes across Bloomberg’s over hundred thousand hosts and devices. The platform you will help build aims to be THE one stop shop to drive automated infrastructure changes quickly, safely, and with stakeholder buy-in. Our mission is to make datacenter-scale changes safe and cheap to deploy.

Our team and extended team are a friendly, supportive group with deep roots in the internal Go community. We love readability and simplicity in code, believing very complex products can only be built on the back of very simple reusable components.

What we’re working on:

We already manage large-scale initiatives such as operating system upgrades across tens of thousands of hosts and network devices, and are onboarding additional workflows like cluster-specific network policy updates. You will be instrumental in growing this product into a highly generalized, self-service platform. This next-generation platform will reduce the engineering overhead for new automation from months to mere weeks. 

Your Role:

Our main technical challenge: Generalization with Guardrails. How do you build a platform that can automate anything (generalization) while ensuring it can never accidentally break everything (guardrails)? We need a technical lead to design the abstractions that unify our vast infrastructure while architecting the systemic safety mechanisms that make dangerous, high-impact changes a risk-free, low-touch operation.

You will be a technical lead who:

  • Mentors and coaches other engineers and contributes to a strong culture of code quality and simplicity

  • Leads the technical design and end-to-end delivery of multi-person, cross-team projects

  • Drives platform architecture, defining abstractions and long-term technical direction for the team

  • Balances long-term vision with near-term delivery on high-visibility projects

You’ll need to have:

  • 4+ years of professional software engineering experience in Go

  • A Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience

  • Proven ability to deliver complex features with an emphasis on code simplicity and operational reliability

  • Experience leading multi-person technical projects, in partnership with other teams

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

We’d love to see:

  • Experience leading a team and mentoring software engineers

  • Experience in Postgres and / or React

  • Experience building and architecting distributed applications

  • An interest in infrastructure automation

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg’s Enterprise Data business delivers trusted, high-quality data and analytics that power critical workflows across banks, asset managers, hedge funds, insurers, and corporations. Within Enterprise Data, the Risk & Investment Analytics (RIA) team develops data-driven solutions that quantify emerging and complex risks. Our products, including Liquidity Assessment (LQA), Market Implied Probability of Default (MIPD), and new digital asset-related datasets, combine Bloomberg’s proprietary data with clear, robust calculations and models to support institutional risk and investment teams.

What is the role?

We are seeking a Product Manager to define and deliver new digital asset-focused data and analytics within the RIA suite. This role centers on the growing intersection of digital assets and traditional instruments, such as tokenized securities, ETFs with crypto exposures, and corporates with digital asset holdings.

You will identify and assess new datasets, design decision-useful calculations, and partner with engineering, data scientists, and our global data team to build robust enterprise data solutions. You will engage closely with institutional clients to understand evolving workflows, including how they use AI-powered interfaces to consume data. Internally, you will also help identify areas where AI can streamline analysis and improve product development.

This role suits someone with strong digital asset expertise, product judgment, commercial awareness, and the ability to work across technical and client-facing teams.

We’ll trust you to:

  • Shape the product vision for digital asset products within the Risk & Investment Analytics suite
  • Drive commercial strategy by assessing market opportunities and leading go-to-market plan
  • Identify and prioritize new data sources and define requirements for ingestion, modeling, and validation
  • Develop new classifications, rules-based logic, and calculations that clarify digital asset exposure, liquidity, and market dynamics
  • Engage with institutional clients to understand workflows and translate needs into clear product roadmaps and specifications
  • Work closely with Engineering, Quant Research, Global Data, and other partners to operationalize prototypes into scalable production systems
  • Identify how AI-driven consumption patterns (e.g., agentic workflows, MCP interactions) should inform product design, and where internal AI can enhance analysis and development processes
  • Manage roadmap planning, backlog prioritization, and cross-team alignment around digital asset initiatives
  • Communicate product direction to clients, leadership, sales, and internal partners, and incorporate feedback into roadmap updates

You’ll need to have:

  • 5+ years of product management or related experience in digital assets, financial data, or risk analytics
  • Strong understanding of digital asset market structure, tokenization of real-world assets, and institutional use cases
  • Familiarity with statistical analysis, data modeling, or quantitative workflows
  • Technical fluency in prototyping and data analysis (Python preferred)
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with engineering, quantitative teams, and commercial stakeholders
  • Solid understanding of Bloomberg data and institutional client needs

We’d love to see:

  • Background in commercial strategy, product marketing, or P&L ownership
  • Experience integrating on-chain data, off-chain vendor datasets, or blockchain-native signals
  • Familiarity with AI-driven data consumption and tools that automate analysis of unstructured datasets
  • Understanding of regulatory developments affecting digital assets globally

Background in commercial strategy, product marketing, or P&L ownership

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
The Post Trade Implementation team delivers end-to-end implementation services for Bloomberg’s Transaction Cost Analysis (BTCA), Regulatory Reporting (BRRS), and Compliance (Vault) solutions. We work closely with clients to scope, integrate, and deploy these products within their existing operating environments, enabling effective transaction cost analysis, regulatory reporting, surveillance and data archiving.
We partner with Sales and Account Management during all phases of the Implementation process to ensure solutions meet client needs and collaborate extensively with Product, Engineering and Service to deliver a high-quality, efficient onboarding experience.

What’s the role?
We are seeking an Implementation Manager to support our BTCA and BRRS products in London. In this client-facing role, you will lead end-to-end implementations, manage complex projects against challenging timelines, and ensure successful delivery and onboarding for strategic clients.
You will act as the primary point of contact throughout the implementation lifecycle, coordinating across internal teams and client stakeholders to deliver outcomes to a high standard.

Key responsibilities
  • Lead and support end-to-end client implementations of Bloomberg Post-Trade and Regulatory solutions (BTCA & BRRS)
  • Work with Sales and Clients to gather requirements, define scope, and design implementation approaches aligned to their operational and regulatory needs.
  • Lead the implementation of new client engagements, managing timelines, dependencies and delivery in line with standard procedures
  • Manage technical and functional integrations, including data onboarding, validation, and configuration across client environments.
  • Partner with Sales and Account Management during pre-sales, integration, and on-boarding phases to ensure client expectations are clearly defined and met.
  • Act as a primary point of contact for clients during implementation, providing clear communication, progress updates, and issue resolution.
  • Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Service teams to escalate issues, provide feedback, and contribute to continuous product and process improvements.
  • Support governance, documentation, and best practices to ensure consistent, scalable, and high-quality delivery.

We’ll trust you to
  • Own complex, strategic client engagements as the day-to-day project management lead
  • Develop and drive detailed project plans to completion across internal teams and external vendors
  • Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate project risks and dependencies
  • Translate client business and regulatory requirements into clear implementation deliverables
  • Communicate clearly and consistently through client-facing and internal documentation
  • Promote standard methodologies for project management and implementation
  • Monitor delivery health using defined KPIs and governance forums, escalating issues where needed
  • Stay current on regulatory reforms, market structure changes, and Bloomberg product enhancements
  • Build and maintain strong, credible relationships with clients and internal partners

You’ll need to have
  • Proven experience managing complex projects in fast-paced, collaborative environments
  • Strong problem-solving skills with exceptional attention to detail
  • Hands-on project management experience across multiple internal teams, vendors, and clients
  • Experience supporting or working with trading, post-trade, and/or compliance workflows
  • An understanding of the trading lifecycle, sales/trader workflows and market terminology
  • An ability to translate business and regulatory requirements into clear, executable delivery plans
  • Strong data analysis and validation skills, including working with large datasets
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills
  • Excellent technical troubleshooting skills, with knowledge of CSV & FIX workflows
  • Comfort operating in ambiguous, evolving regulatory and client environments

We’d love to see
  • Experience in project management, implementation, or client delivery roles
  • Experience scoping engagements and gathering complex client and regulatory requirements
  • Proven success leading complex, client-facing engagements
  • Strong knowledge of Fixed Income, Equities, FX, and/or OTC markets
  • Experience working in fast-paced, cross-functional environments with multiple stakeholders

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg News is one of the biggest financial and business news organizations in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis on financial markets, from daily coverage through to in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It's what keeps us inventing and re-inventing, all the time.

Bloomberg News is seeking a journalist to lead our economics and government coverage across South Asia based in New Delhi. You will be responsible for shaping coverage across this vast region, leading a team covering everything from central bank policy moves and economic indicators to domestic political shifts and economic statecraft involving India, the US, China, Russia and other major powers.

You are comfortable headlining news as it breaks, quickfire editing, formulating coverage plans for set-piece political and economic events, spotting trends that shape the economic and political landscape, and directing a team of dedicated reporters and editors. You'll have big ideas, and the ability to implement them across a range of platforms, from the terminal to the web, magazines, podcast, video, blog and television.

We’ll trust you to:
  • Demonstrate strong editorial judgment and drive agenda-setting stories
  • Mentor, lead, motivate and inspire a team with a breadth of knowledge across Economics and Government, to deliver insightful and authoritative stories
  • Work collaboratively across regional bureaus, groups and platforms to drive coverage that captures the context of local developments and the wider impact for global markets, international investors and companies
  • Partner with the broader newsroom to write about themes such as climate change, inequality, labor markets, health, trade frictions, housing and the many other issues across the globe
  • Coordinate with peers around the world to make sure we're using the best of Bloomberg

You'll need to have:
  • At least 7 years of experience in business journalism
  • At least 3 years of experience working in a real-time news environment
  • Experience covering the economy, government or financial markets
  • Ability to spot trends, find holes in stories and work with reporters to deliver impactful news to our readers
  • Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organization with leadership experience valued
  • Proficiency in both spoken and written English

Life at Bloomberg is many things, but it’s never dull. We’re a truly global business with a truly diverse workforce. We pride ourselves on being open, inclusive and collaborative, and provide a work environment that inspires our employees to be their best. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive healthcare coverage, and programs to support you and your family through different life stages, from parental leave to generous retirement savings plans

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional

Learn more about our offices and benefits:
India | https://www.bloomberg.com/India

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg delivers critical information in a world where information matters. We give influential decision-makers in business, finance and government a competitive edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of news, people and ideas. To do that, we need a constant flow of ideas, energy, innovation, which is where you come in. At Bloomberg, you will have the opportunity to go above and beyond and to take risks. Be a part of an organization that is entering new markets, launching new ventures and pushing boundaries. Our ever-expanding array of technology, data, news and media services fosters innovation and empowers clients - and offers nearly limitless opportunities for career growth. 

 

What’s the role? 

Bloomberg Accounting Operations is seeking an enthusiastic and driven individual to join the Hong Kong Customer Financial Services department. As part of this fast-paced team, you will learn various aspects of Accounts Receivable, Billing, and Contracts within the APAC Region. 

Our Customer Financial Services team is responsible for ensuring the collection of aged receivables and timely application of payments, while working alongside internal departments to answer client queries and bring them to a resolution. 

At Bloomberg, we pride ourselves on platinum customer service. In this role you will have the opportunity to work closely alongside the New York billing team to resolve pricing issues and invoice disputes, as well as work with Sales to build strong working relationships and identify key areas for improvement. 

 

We’ll trust you to: 

  • Log all collection notes in our database or the internal ticketing system 
  • Be accountable for a sizable collections portfolio and meet specific, targeted goals related to the aging of open receivables 
  • Provide timely follow-up on payment arrangements 
  • Be responsible for processing customer refunds, write-offs, escheatable items, and preparing delinquent customers for third party collections 
  • Collaborate with our internal Sales, Contracts, Installations and Billing Teams to resolve outstanding issues

You’ll need to have: 

  • Minimum 3 years of experience in customer service and accounting operations, corporate collections, and/or Accounts Receivables 
  • Business level proficiency in English and an additional Asian language such as Korean, Japanese or Bahasa Indonesia 
  • Ability to multi-task, trouble-shoot and solve complex problems while utilizing multiple system interfaces and addressing a high volume of work within a fast-paced environment 
  • Ability to adjust priorities quickly under pressure to meet deadlines 
  • Flexibility within a constantly changing environment 
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills 
  • Ability to cooperate and collaborate effectively with team members 
  • Strong attention to details 


We'd love to see: 

  • Proven ability at successfully managing a large-scale account portfolio 
  • Previous experience in a customer service or client-facing role 
  • Knowledge of SAP 
  • Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint 
  • Project management experience 

 

If this sounds like you: 

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: www.bloomberg.com/professional 

 

Why Bloomberg? 

We’re individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We’re interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential. 

 

Learn more about our office and benefits: 

Hong Kong | www.bloomberg.com/hongkong

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Smarter, Faster, and as always - First. That's our philosophy. Bloomberg Media empowers global business leaders with breaking news, expert opinion and proprietary data distributed on every platform, across every time zone. Like our products and solutions- our teams are agile, dynamic, and innovative. We work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy for which we're known. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We challenge each other. And through our countless volunteer projects, we help bring out the best in our communities as around us, too. You can do outstanding work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.

The Planning and Campaign Management team plays a pivotal role in connecting client objectives with Bloomberg Media’s cross-platform advertising capabilities. As strategic collaborators, we bring together creativity, data and expert product knowledge to develop media solutions that deliver meaningful results for our clients. We are involved in the full campaign lifecycle, from plan creation through to execution and reporting, ensuring campaigns are delivered optimally and perform against defined critical metrics. Success in this role requires adaptability, curiosity and a proactive demeanor. We are looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment and is confident working across a broad suite of media channels, including TV & OTT video, digital display, social, audio, print and live events.


WE'LL TRUST YOU TO:
  • Develop a strong understanding of Bloomberg Media’s audience, platforms, advertising products, and targeting capabilities, and stay up to date with new offerings and product developments.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create strategic and creative single or multi-platform media plans that are aligned with client objectives.
  • Use proprietary and industry data and research tools to inform planning decisions.
  • Process insertion orders (IOs) accurately and coordinate campaign set-up, ensuring a smooth handover to post-sale teams.
  • Partner closely with Sales, Ad Operations and Client Services during the post-sale phase to ensure media plans are accomplished as intended, deliver against critical metrics, and contribute to overall client success and retention.
  • Monitor and analyze campaign results to uncover actionable and unexpected insights that inform ongoing optimizations and help Sales partners deliver timely, meaningful updates to clients.
  • Produce compelling mid and end-of-campaign reports that showcase results, highlight key takeaways and support client renewals.
  • Support the monthly billing process by partnering with Sales, Ad Operations and Finance to resolve billing-related queries, including third-party IO reconciliation.
  • Provide excellent customer service to both internal and external partners.
  • Use strong communication and time management skills to juggle multiple priorities effectively.
  • Adapt and thrive in an evolving, fast-moving environment.


YOU'LL NEED TO HAVE:
  • A minimum of 3+ years of digital media planning experience at a publisher or agency; cross-platform planning experience is preferred.
  • A strong understanding of media planning principles, campaign performance metrics, and media buying processes.
  • Familiarity with social media platforms, their ad formats and the key levers that influence performance.
  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and present meaningful insights in clear, visually compelling formats using PowerPoint or Google Slides.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets, including knowledge of pivot tables, lookup functions (e.g. XLOOKUP) and charts.
  • Familiarity with campaign management tools such as Google Ad Manager, Operative, DoubleVerify and Salesforce.
  • Technical ability to quickly learn and embrace new tools, systems and processes.
  • A self-motivated, enthusiastic and meticulous approach.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced environment with frequent changes in priorities.
  • Strong multi-tasking, time management and organizational skills.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a solutions-oriented approach.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • The ability to build and maintain strong professional relationships with internal and external partners.

title: Description & Requirements
description_html:
Bloomberg runs on data. Our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In Data, we are responsible for delivering this data, news, and analytics through innovative technology—quickly and accurately. We apply problem-solving skills to identify workflow efficiencies and implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products, and processes.

Our Team
The Company Financials team provides our clients with fast and accurate market-moving data so they can stay on top of their game: broker estimates, financial filings, and any other dataset that is useful to understand financial performance in the markets. Our products run on intelligence and industry-specific insights provided by the industry teams. We combine financial modeling, industry expertise, data management, and technical skills to curate critical metrics and drive insights from our data.

We are dedicated to crafting a best-in-class financial analysis and modeling product while constantly looking to enhance and expand our existing offering through a deep understanding of the markets we operate in, the sectors we cover, and our clients current and future needs.

What’s the Role?
As a Data Management Professional within the Foundational Support team, you will support the creation of scalable, high quality data workflows that underpin the delivery of accurate, fit-for-purpose datasets. Your work ensures that our foundational data processes not only meet accuracy and timeliness expectations but also evolve to support innovation, automation, and new commercial opportunities aligned with Bloomberg’s strategic goals.

You will play a pivotal role in validating end-to-end workflow orchestration, enhancing incident response and prevention frameworks, and embedding knowledge management and governance practices to strengthen data quality, transparency, and scalability across the Company Financials ecosystem.

We’ll trust you to:
  • Own validation and optimization of dataset workflows and tooling to drive scalability, data quality, and process efficiency
  • Lead feasibility assessments and proof-of-concept initiatives to evaluate and implement new tooling, automation, and dataset enhancements
  • Drive root cause and impact analyses through data profiling and analytical assessment to identify systemic risks, design preventive measures, and embed long-term resiliency into data workflows.
  • Partner cross-functionally with Product, Data, and Engineering teams to ensure alignment with strategic objectives, measurable ROI, and quality of workflow tooling release.
  • Establish and maintain governance frameworks to ensure critical operational and dataset knowledge is structured, discoverable, and embedded into workflows for sustainable knowledge management.
  • Develop best practices and process documentation that enable consistency, auditability, and scalability across onboarding and workflow execution.

You’ll need to have:
  • 4+ years of professional experience in data quality management, or data governance
  • Strong coding proficiency in SQL and Python for data analysis and workflow optimization idea generation
  • Familiarity with ETL processes, data pipelines, and workflow design
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, QlikSense, Power BI, or similar) to communicate quality insights
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong project management skills and ability to prioritize and adapt to tasks accordingly with a customer focused mentality
  • Powerful collaboration skills to work across departments and regions, excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a solutions-oriented mindset
  • Comfort working in a dynamic, evolving environment, balancing long-term strategy with immediate operational needs

We would love to see:
  • Industry-recognized data management certifications (e.g., DAMA, CDMP, DCAM)
  • Experience with company financials data and financial statements
  • Hands-on knowledge of data governance and quality frameworks, including metadata management and regulatory considerations
  • Knowledge of software testing and QA methodologies with experience in both manual and automating testing processes
  • Familiarity with modern data infrastructure and architecture (APIs, pipelines, cloud platforms), with exposure to AI/ML or LLM-based enrichment solutions for anomaly detection and automation
  • Experience using Bloomberg Terminal and Company Financials products
  • Exposure to Agile methodologies
